post_text: Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior Job in San Antonio, TX at USAA Home Why Work at USAA? Military and Spouses University Recruiting Search Jobs Senior Data Scientist-Research Engineer Job Job Number: 26919 Location: San Antonio , TX Date Posted: 4-1-2016 Job Title: Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior Apply We are currently seeking talented Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior for our San Antonio, TX facility. PURPOSE OF JOB Synthesizes analyses, identifies root causes, and develops and recommends key work products. Assembles key participants and guides and facilitates teams in the development and implementation of key initiatives. Execute applied research for business and technical innovation purposes across any known, future, or as of yet unknown set of business functions and/or complex technologies. Develops business and technology gap assessments, innovation forecasts, research recommendations, patent opportunities, and specialized business and technology evaluations based on complex analysis of business, technology, industry, competitors, economic environment, legal/regulatory/political, and suppliers. Serves as a mentor to peers and team members for assigned area of responsibility. Provides insight to management on issues. JOB DUTIES Identify technology needs and solutions using highly developed research techniques. Interact with appropriate experts from across the enterprise in assessments. Perform most complex research assessments, present findings to technical, business, and mid-level management audiences, without requiring guidance. Regularly interact with and maintain relationships with counterparts internally, externally across IT. Begin to network regularly across EBO, and develop business contacts. Act as a technology subject matter expert providing assistance across the enterprise in understanding and communicating technology capabilities, limitations, risks, and opportunities. Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience 6+ years relevant business support and/or general technology research/analysis experience Significant coordination and people networking skills Demonstrated functional development skills in infrastructure and architecture disciplines Advanced awareness of IT and financial service industry. Demonstrated elevated degree of creative and innovative skills. Advanced knowledge of data visualization (Excel, Tableau, Business Objects, etc.) Preferred Basic statistical model building skills Experience in structured hypothesis testing Basic ETL acumen Drive for Results and Innovation The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. Share our pride. Join our mission. As a Fortune 200 financial services organization, USAA is on a mission - to facilitate the financial security of our members, the men and women of the U.S. military and their families worldwide by providing a full range of financial services and products. Headquartered on a showcase campus in San Antonio, TX, USAA attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our 27,000 employees. They are the heart and soul of our member-service culture. Recently Ranked #11 in Forbes list of 500 of the "Best Employers in the U.S. in 2015" , we are proud to receive consistently outstanding awards and ratings for member service, employee well-being and financial strength. Everything that happens at USAA is based on our core values: Service, Loyalty, Honesty, and Integrity. These are the foundations of how we do business with our members, as well as how we treat each other. At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position. Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre-employment background and drug screen. USAA is an EEO/AA Employer - applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law. Houston, TX Save this job Email this job Text this job Associate Research Analyst - Houston, TX - 653375 Apply Now Apply Now Position Description Position Description: Welcome to one of the toughest and most fulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools, most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitless opportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life's best work. The international security arm of UnitedHealthcare Global, located in Sugar Land, Texas, provides a number of travel security services, including traveler tracking, emergency response, secure transportation, intelligence assessments, and incident monitoring for some of the worlds top companies and institutions. The Associate Research Analyst (Watch Officer) is the entry-level position for UnitedHealthcare Global Risks Intelligence Department. The Associate Research Analyst provides primary support for the Intelligence Department and company overall and requires shift work, including evenings, overnights, weekends and holiday hours. Specific shift hours vary. Primary Responsibilities: P rovide consistent and constant monitoring of world news for international security, safety, political and social developments. Follow proper protocol to notify management and clients of significant incidents. Deliver written and verbal intelligence briefings, including but not limited to customized trip security reports, worldwide incident monitoring reports, special reports, forecasting analysis, incident event summaries and more Provide in-depth analytical coverage for an assigned region of the world in all related product lines Serve as the primary customer/client interface during shift hours Support operational services requirements, including telephone reception, emergency call center support, additional communications coverage, services tasking and follow up Engage in and manage special projects as required Occasional domestic travel may be required but is uncommon Core Competencies: Excellent research and analytical skills Excellent writing skills appropriate for this position and for a business environment. The ability to construct written arguments and present analysis and conclusions within the business parameters is paramount Must be able to meet verbal consulting needs and give presentations on area of expertise Ability to multi-task efficiently under fluid and sometimes stressful situations is essential Must articulate well with excellent interpersonal, problem-solving, decision-making and communication skills (verbal and written) Learn more about us by visiting our website: www.uhcglobal.com Requirements To be considered for this position, applicants need to meet the qualifications listed in this posting. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree from an Accredited University or College with a defined focus on International Affairs, Security/ Intelligence Issues, or other related Humanities or Social Studies field OR High School Diploma/GED with five (5) years of experience providing Geopolitical Intelligence for a Business or Government entity Exceptional Writing skills for a business environment (Writing test will be administered - in person interview is contingent upon completion and satisfactory results as determined by the hiring manager) Strong knowledge of and interest in current, International Affairs at a global or regional level Able to work primary shift hours of evenings, overnights, weekends and holidays Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint Preferred Qualifications: Master's Degree from an Accredited University or College with a defined focus on International Affairs, Security/Intelligence Issues, or other related field. Foreign Language skills Previous International travel or residency outside the United States Experience using social media to track global developments UnitedHealth Group is working to create the health care system of tomorrow. Already Fortune 14, we are totally focused on innovation and change. We work a little harder. We aim a little higher. We expect more from ourselves and each other. And at the end of the day, we're doing a lot of good. Through our family of businesses and a lot of inspired individuals, we're building a high-performance health care system that works better for more people in more ways than ever. Now we're looking to reinforce our team with people who are decisive, brilliant and built for speed. Come to UnitedHealth Group, and share your ideas and your passion for doing more. We have roles that will fit your skills and knowledge. We have diverse opportunities that will fit your dreams. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment. post_text: Job Application for Data Scientist at Main Street Hub Apply Now Data Scientist at Main Street Hub (View all jobs) Austin Founded in 2010 out of Stanford University, Main Street Hub is headquartered in Austin, TX with a rapidly expanding sales office in New York City.  The response weve seen from local businesses everywhere has been incredible.We are the voice of more local businesses than any other company, we're the fastest-growing startup in Austin, and we're backed by leading investors in New York and Silicon Valley. Across the company, we have over 500 colleagues who care about local businesses, set high expectations for themselves, and want to be a part of something big. About Main Street Hub Engineering: The Engineering team is on a mission to build the absolute best software in the local space. We use our data and technology to effectively create and manage local business owners digital assets at scale. While our customers are hard at work realizing their passion and dream, our software delivers to them - A compelling digital experience that matches the authenticity and spirit of that local business to their consumers.  We can help the consumers to find their next favorite local joint, or love their current one even more. Data driven insights about their consumers and their business - insights they can use to compete with the giants and thrive. A content platform that empowers our content managers to create engaging content while having fun using the tools. In addition to all top notch engineering talents we already have on the team, we also have the best partner in crime - a killer Product and Design team!!! What is the opportunity? As a Data Scientist at Main Street Hub, you will Design and build machine learning models that help local businesses engage with their customers on social media Partner with product, finance, and operations teams to identify, prioritize, and answer the most important questions where analytics and modeling will have a material impact Drive cross functional analytics projects from beginning to end - from framing and structuring questions, to collecting and analyzing data, and presenting key insights to support decision making Collaborate with decision makers to develop products, strategies, and processes to produce repeatable analysis and actionable insights into customer behavior, operational efficiency, and risk Communicate key results to leadership in verbal, visual, and written media Why is it awesome? Your work is meaningful: helping local business owners and creating a thriving local economy == helping to make someones American dream come true Your work brings the voice of local business owners to life through data You will have a huge personal impact on the engineering team, Main Street Hub business, and most importantly, our service to local business owners You will be surrounded by top talents - we constantly raise the bar and all get better along the way. What does it take to succeed? Enthusiasm for local businesses and a fit with Main Street Hub values Resourceful in distilling questions, wrangling data, and driving decisions Uncanny ability to identify unreasonable results and a well-tuned sense of skepticism Great attention to detail, because details matter (if you apply, include the word purple somewhere in your resume or cover letter) Embrace and thrive in high paced, lean startup cultures  we insist on saying NO to big corporate mentality Personal ambition - embrace challenges, energized by more more more, inspired by learning and growing An advanced degree (M.S. PhD), preferably in Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, or a related technical field Deep knowledge of machine learning, statistics, optimization, or related field Are there perks? Three weeks paid time off, plus holidays Brand new office in downtown Austin 100% paid medical, dental, and vision coverage 401(k) plan All that startup stuff - Houndstooth coffee served hot and personalized onsite, free drinks and snacks, beer on tap, ping pong tables, a Rubiks Cube collection, Great Discounts on Gym Memberships Say hi and show me what youve got!  I review all resumes, cover letters (especially cover letters) personally. summary: Machine learning, data visualization, statistical modeling, data mining, or information retrieval. Five years of professional experience working as a Data...
post_text:
Job posting details.
Sr Associate Data Scientist, Big Data KPMG Dallas, TX United States KPMGs values describe who we are, what we do, and how we do it. The KPMG culture is rooted in our values  its a culture of trust and collaboration, flexibility and diversity, where people share knowledge freely and genuinely try to bring out the very best in others. This culture allows you to flourish both as a professional and as an individual  to enjoy a challenging career and get the most from your personal life. Our business services groups consist of professionals with a wide range of skills and backgrounds. We are currently seeking a Data Scientist, to join us in any major US city with a KPMG office. Responsibilities: Analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analyses Build recommendation engines, spam classifiers, sentiment analyzers and classifiers for unstructured and semi-structured data Cluster large amount of user generated content and process data in large-scale environments using Amazon EC2, Storm, Hadoop and Spark Perform machine learning, natural language, and statistical analysis methods, such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods Drive client engagements focused on Big Data and Advanced Business Analytics, in diverse domains such as product development, marketing research, public policy, optimization, and risk management; communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations Perform explanatory data analyses, generate and test working hypotheses, prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns Qualifications: Five years of professional experience working as a Data Scientist Experience with command-line scripting, data structures and algorithms and ability to work in a Linux environment, processing large amounts of data in a cloud environment Masters degree or PhD from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields, with a minimum of two years of relevant experience (strong mathematical background with ability to understand algorithms and methods from a mathematical viewpoint and an intuitive viewpoint) Strong knowledge in at least one of the following fields: machine learning, data visualization, statistical modeling, data mining, or information retrieval Strong data extraction and processing, using MapReduce, Pig, and/or Hive preferred Proficiency in analysis (e.g. R, SAS, Matlab) packages, programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, Ruby) as well as the ability to implement, maintain, and troubleshoot big data infrastructure, such as distributed processing paradigms, stream processing and databases such as Hadoop, Storm, SQL and Solr KPMG offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. No phone calls or agencies please. One Firm. One Team. Countless Opportunities. KPMG, an equal opportunity employer/disability/veteran. KPMG maintains a drug-free workplace. KPMG will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state or federal law (including San Francisco Ordinance number 131192). Click here to apply for this position. Job code: 59318 47969959

Businesses and governments around the globe rely on our comprehensive content, expert independent analysis and flexible delivery methods to make high-impact decisions and develop strategies with speed and confidence. IHS was founded in 1959 and is headquartered in Englewood, Colorado, USA. Trusted by clients for more than 50 years, IHS employs more than 9000+ people in 32 countries. We serve 80 percent of the Global Fortune 500 as well as businesses and governments in 165 countries. _______________________________________________________________ Title: Research Analyst II Summary : The Research Analyst II functions as a core member of the team to provide quantitative research support and assist senior staff in creating reports, contributing to consulting projects and supporting events. General Job Duties: Support senior researchers activities by producing quick-turnaround analysis and research for site visits, consulting projects, and client presentations; and by maintaining data bases to help ensure timely and accurate responses to client questions; and to support the senrior researchers continued flow of crucail thought-leading research papers on practice-specific topics, as promised to the clients. Build databases that contribute to research reports and presentations by carefully combing through industry periodicals and external data sources to create organized and user-friendly data bases and to support accurate and in-depth retainer research. Contribute to consulting projects as required and as driven by business needs by working under the direction of a consulting project leader, digging data, creating spreadsheets and graphics, and seeking out peer review of materials to support delivery of high-quality client-specific projects. Under supervision or as part of a team effort, respond to basic, non-complex research-related questions from clients by working in a higly collaborative fashion to learn the roles and expertise of others on research teams; seeking out other colleagues; familiarizing himself/herself with our research products and with client request procedures to provide customer delight in situations of one-on-one client needs. Gain knowledge in a particular/designated practice or focus area by actively contributing to above listed activities and pursing activities/work in various disciplines and staying abreast of current/hot topics to begin to acquire subject matter knowledge. Required Education: Bachelors degree in economics, statistics, engineering or industry-related fields required; graduate degree is a plus. Required Experience: Minimum of 1 year related experience traditionally acquired by working in industry, government, or consulting. Other skills: Proficiency with MS applications required (Excel, Word and PowerPoint); experience with databases helpful. Requires a keen attention to detail and highly effective organization skills including the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. Requires demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills in a deadline-oriented environment. Must be flexible with the ability to work effectively and collaboratively with all coworkers Must be able to meet the attendance requirements of the position. Physical Requirements: This position will operate under normal office conditions and will include moderate phone use and moderate to heavy computer use. summary: First Data is committed to staying at the forefront of our industry, and we are innovating a wide range of next-generation commerce technology solutions to help...

You are not signed in. | My Account Options My Job Cart | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Basic Search | Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Data Scientist (30001041_03302016) Job Details Data Scientist - ( 30001041_03302016 ) Description First Data is a global leader in commerce-enabling technology solutions, serving more than six million business locations and 4,000 financial institutions in 118 countries around the world. Our 23,000 owner-associates are dedicated to helping companies, from start-ups to the worlds largest corporations, conduct commerce every day by securing and processing more than 2,300 transactions per second and $1.9 trillion per year. First Data is committed to staying at the forefront of our industry, and we are innovating a wide range of next-generation commerce technology solutions to help our clients better detect fraud, gain insights into consumer spending patterns and build customer loyalty. There are many exciting opportunities for talented individuals who would like to join our team and play a meaningful role in helping us shape the future of global commerce. First Data Network and Security Solutions provides a wide range of value-added technology solutions to financial institutions of all sizes, enterprise clients and small businesses. Network Solutions include Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) network services, such as STAR debit and ATM processing, and prepaid network services, including Valuelink, MoneyNetwork, Transaction Wireless, and Gyft. Security Solutions include best-in-class solutions such as TransArmor and TeleCheck, and our suite of advanced fraud prevention solutions. NSS also supports our other digital strategies including mobile payments and online and mobile banking Job Responsibilities Responsible for departmental adherence to established model building standards as well as development of new model building techniques. Advises senior manager on all matters of data science and is the principal on all major analysis projects. Performs additional job duties as required. Job Requirements 6+ yrs. of related IT experience. Bachelors Degree at College of Engineering and Technology or equivalent work experience. Expert in multiple languages and tools. Strong knowledge in emerging technologies. Possesses strong knowledge of application development technologies, tools, methodologies as well as all functional areas in IT organization. Good understanding of how technology relates to business, market and industry and applies such knowledge to support the needs of the business. 5+ years of experience in a transactional model building environment. Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science required. Master's Degree in Statistics preferred. Expert in the use of SAS for model building and data analysis. Strong knowledge of emerging data analysis and model building techniques. Strong work ethic and ability to work occasional nights/weekends required. Competencies IT Architecture First Data is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled/LGBT) Primary Location : United States-Texas-Sugar Land Job Field : Applications Development Schedule : Full-time Job Posting : Apr 4, 2016 Manager Level : L3 - Middle Mgmt/Sr Professional Employee Status : Regular Copyright ©2015 First Data Corporation. All rights reserved. Privacy & Legal

title: Data Analytics Scien Lv 2 PCCI
summary: As an experienced data analytic scientist, will be responsible for coordinating specific phases of data analytics (extraction, analysis, manipulation, synthesis...
post_text: Data Analytics Scien Lv 2 PCCI in United States at Parkland Health & Hospital System Compassion Integrity Respect Collaboration Leadership Excellence Stewardship When Collaboration can be rare... Find it Here. Parkland Health & Hospital System Jobs > Administration Jobs > United States Administration Jobs About Us Benefits Mission & Vision Nursing Search Jobs Career Opportunity apply Data Analytics Scien Lv 2 PCCI Dallas, TX PRIMARY PURPOSE As an experienced data analytic scientist, will be responsible for coordinating specific  phases of data analytics (extraction, analysis, manipulation, synthesis, summary, validation, testing, and maintenance) with the objective of creating and building predictive models and algorithms for clinical and operational initiatives as identified by PCCI. MINIMUM SPECIFICATIONS Education: -Must have a Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Informatics, Computer Science, Operations Research, or a related field. Experience: -Must have five years of experience in analysis of healthcare or business related data and information systems. -Must have research and development experience on predictive modeling, data mining and management, and other advanced analytics in the development of business intelligence and technology transfer. -Must have experience developing data mining solutions using various statistical software packages (Ex: R, Metlab, etc.) -Prefer experience working with healthcare organizations and healthcare applications. -Prefer experience working within a complex, academic healthcare organization. Equivalent Education and/or Experience: -May have an equivalent combination of education and experience to substitute for both the education and the experience requirements. Certification/Registration/Licensure: -None. Skills or Special Abilities: -Must be able to demonstrate an expert knowledge of statistical methods, concepts, practices, procedures, and their application. -Must have a strong understanding of healthcare inpatient and outpatient operations and regulatory requirements. -Must be able to demonstrate a comprehensive level of knowledge with regard to healthcare software design and development. -Must be able to demonstrate expert level critical thinking skills to solve challenging advanced analytics problems and provide solid solutions. o	Must demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of : o	IS operational policies, procedures, and standards o	Application features and their integration capabilities o	Business process analysis and redesign, including benefits engineering o	Statistical methods, concepts, practices, and procedures used for health outcome research -High deduction skills - must be able to use fundamental analysis and reasonable judgments to deduce answers for complex issues. -Must have a strong commitment to customer service. -Must have demonstrated experience and strong commitment to benefits engineering and performance metrics. -Must be able to demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation skills.  Must understand and engage audience to achieve the best results. -Must be flexible and be able to prioritize and reprioritize projects in line with Parkland Center for Clinical Innovation's leaders to meet deadline and deliverables. -Must demonstrate exceptional abilities for high level comprehension of projects and environment as well as remain extremely detail oriented for tasks and responsibilities. -Must be independent and reliable with the ability to drive initiatives to completion. -Must have knowledge of word processing, spreadsheet, data management, and statistical analysis software. -Mst demonstrate excellent knowledge and experience using different software including STATA, SPSS, SAS, MATLAB, and others performing data cleaning, manipulation, processing, management, and statistical analysis. title: Data Science Immersive Instructor
summary: Our Data Science Immersive course is a brand-new, life-changing educational experience where students leave with the skills and mindsets to take on new careers...
post_text:
Job Application for Data Science Immersive Instructor at General Assembly Apply Now Data Science Immersive Instructor at General Assembly (View all jobs) Austin, TX Recently voted Fast Companys #1 Most Innovative Company in Education and #28 Most Innovative Company in the world, General Assembly is a venture backed, post Series C, NYC-based startup in our fourth year. General Assembly transforms creators into thinkers through education and opportunities in technology, business, and design. We offer classes, workshops, long-form courses, and events in worldwide markets including New York where we are headquartered, Atlanta, Austin, London, Hong Kong, Sydney, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Boston, Chicago, Seattle, Melbourne and Washington DC..  We also partner with Fortune 500 companies to spur innovation through increased digital fluency and more effective approaches to collaboration. We are looking for a Data Scientist to teach our brand new full time class: Our Data Science Immersive course is a brand-new, life-changing educational experience where students leave with the skills and mindsets to take on new careers as Data Analysts and Scientists. We are looking for an instructor to spearhead this transformation through leading General Assemblys Data Science Immersive course. Why Teach the Data Science Immersive? If you are looking to make a life-changing impact by doing what you know and love, this is the position for you. Through this unparalleled opportunity, you will: Deepen your own skills by guiding students through a rigorous journey where they begin as driven novices and leave as empowered data analysts and scientists Facilitate a supportive and energetic community that lasts well beyond the course Hone your own leadership skills by working with an instructional team and classroom community Who are we? General Assembly is a venture-backed, NYC-based startup focusing on education for individuals and enterprises in the areas of technology, design, and entrepreneurship. We currently have physical classrooms in 15 cities across 4 continents, with tens of thousands of students coming through our doors. Skills and Qualifications You have at least 2+ years of professional data science experience. You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of the newest generation of data scientists. You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out. Must Haves: You are an expert in SQL, Python and related Python libraries (pandas, numpy). You have fluency in the following topics: statistics; manipulation of large data sets; data visualization techniques and tools such as Tableau, matplotlib; machine learning algorithms such as naive bayes, SVMs, decision trees, KNN, K-means clustering. Nice to haves: Familiarity with python libraries NLTK and sci-kit learn, Hadoop, Apache Spark, JavaScript, D3.js; R; Basket-weaving,. You are on top of big data trends You have previous data science or engineering teaching experience, through a course, team training, etc. Responsibilities and Duties 2 weeks of planning and curriculum development followed by 12 full work weeks (5 days a week) of teaching, planning and content development. Work closely with two  three co-instructors to provide students with meaningful and prompt feedback on their progress. Work alongside GA staff in order to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students. Guide students through the development of stellar projects that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers. Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community. Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning complex subjects Apply for this Job * Required First Name * Last Name * Email * Phone * Resume/CV * Drop files here Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste Cover Letter Drop files here Attach Dropbox Google Drive Paste Are you a current or former GA instructor? * -- Yes No Are you a current or former GA student? * -- Yes No If so, what course and when? What programming language(s) do you have the most experience in? * LinkedIn Profile: How did you hear about this job? * Anything additional you think we should know? origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. You are being
given the opportunity to provide the following information in order to help us comply with federal and state Equal Employment
Opportunity/Affirmative Action record keeping, reporting, and other legal requirements. Completion of the form is entirely voluntary . Whatever your decision, it will not be considered in the hiring
process or thereafter. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.   As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure
  the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories
  is as follows: A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985. Veteran Status - Select - I am not a protected veteran I identify as one or more of the classifications of a protected veteran I don't wish to answer Form CC-305 OMB Control Number 1250-0005 Expires 1/31/2017 Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability Why are you being asked to complete this form? Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities 1 .  To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability.  Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out.  If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way. If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way.  Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years.  You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier. How do I know if I have a disability? You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to: Blindness Deafness Cancer Diabetes Epilepsy Autism Cerebral palsy HIV/AIDS Schizophrenia Muscular dystrophy Bipolar disorder Major depression Multiple sclerosis (MS) Missing limbs or partially missing limbs Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) Obsessive compulsive disorder Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation) Disability Status - Select - Yes, I have a disability (or previously had a disability) No, I don't have a disability I don't wish to answer Reasonable Accommodation Notice Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities.    Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job.  Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. 1 Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.  For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labors Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp . title: Healthcare Financial Statistician
summary: The Healthcare Financial Statistician serves as a key business analyst by applying statistics analysis and financial insight in performing financial data...
post_text: Applicant Tracking Healthcare Financial Statistician Job Details Level Experienced Salary Range Undisclosed Job Location USA-TX-Houston (CBO) Travel Percentage Undisclosed Position Type Full Time Job Shift Day Education Level 4 Year Degree Job Category Finance Description The Healthcare Financial Statistician serves as a key business analyst by applying statistics analysis and financial insight in performing financial data analysis and projections of results to support the overall goals of Nobilis Health. In addition, the position enhances the organizations' awareness and understanding of operating performance information and financial scenario planning and reporting as well as the impact of management's decisions on these financial results. Designed and conducted advanced data analyses using statistical modeling techniques. Extracted and cleansed large data sets in preparation for data analysis. Participate in forecasting, monthly/quarterly business reporting, variance analysis, activities for the Revenue Cycle Operations. Work through cross-functional relationships within the organization, and facilitate communication between the functions within CBO departments to ensure accurate and predictive financial information is communicated throughout the organization. Forecast accuracy and monitoring countermeasures. Maintain weekly monthly Revenue Cycle Dashboard. Assist in developing annual RCM operating plans and long-range plans and assist in RCM capital planning processes. Perform special projects and ad-hoc financial reporting as required. Other duties as assigned Qualifications EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE Bachelors Degree in Applied Statistics, Econometric, Finance, or other related field required. Hospital/Healthcare experience as an Analyst preferred

                    Data Science Jobs at AT&T Change the way the world connects Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From healthcare mobile apps to revolutionary devices, our Data Science experts are pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out. Share Share this job with your friends and connections! Job Details Culture Apply now Apply now Professional Big Data Engineer (Data Modeling) Location: Plano, Texas Do you enjoy working with analytic use cases and scenarios?  How about driving the design and implementation of data models that advance future business decisions?  Why?  Because at AT&T we have massive data sets and AT&T is looking for a Professional - Big Data Engineer who can bring forward insights from a combination of external and AT&T data assets . The selected candidate will have responsibility for interpreting the requirements of various Big Data Analytic Use Cases and Scenarios, and driving the design and implementation of specific data models to ultimately help drive better business decisions through insights from a combination of external and AT&T's data assets. This role is also accountable for developing the necessary enablers and data platform in the Big Data Lake Environment and has the responsibility of maintaining its integrity during the life cycle phases. Key Roles and responsibilities: Define data requirements, gather and mine large scale of structured and unstructured data, and validate data by running various data tools in the Big Data Environment Support the standardization, customization and ad-hoc data analysis, and will develop the mechanisms to ingest, analyze, validate, normalize and clean data Implements statistical data quality procedures on new data sources, and by applying rigorous iterative data analytics, supports Data Scientists in data sourcing and preparation to visualize data and synthesize insights of commercial value Will work with Big Data Policy and Security teams and Legal to create data policy and develop interfaces and retention models which requires synthesizing or anonymizing data Develop and maintain data engineering best practices and contribute to Insights on data analytics and visualization concepts, methods and techniques AT&T offers a collaborative, fun, and fast paced environment.  If this is what drives you and allows you to unleash your potential, then AT&T may have the perfect career opportunity for you! Desired Qualifications: Typically requires 3-5 years experience in Big Data Engineering and Analysis Ability to analyze use cases and scenarios Experience with Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining, and/or other distributed environment technologies Experience with Hadoop query languages like Pig and Hive A creative genius when it comes to data modeling Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. title: Data Scientist
summary: The Data Scientist is responsible for developing advanced analytics and business intelligence applications that enable knowledge discovery in health care...
post_text: Pieces Careers Show navigation Hide navigation Home Employment Listings Search Current Openings Update Your Profile Create a Job Agent Update Job Agent Recruiting Agency Login Your user session will timeout in 5 minutes.  Please click OK to continue with your application. Data Scientist Tracking Code 66-237 Job Description The Data Scientist is responsible for developing advanced analytics and business intelligence applications that enable knowledge discovery in health care organizations. Our goal is to use these findings to improve patient care quality, outcomes, and clinical decision making. Responsibilities: Participates in project preparation, exploring the scope, depth, and challenges of new projects, and formulating strategies and action plans. Responsible for leading efforts in dissecting, designing, analyzing, developing, summarizing, and presenting predictive modeling, machine learning, and other advanced analytics solutions to key stakeholders. Works independently or with a team to transfer R&D results and outcomes to software development. Responsible for data scoping, exploration, identification, extraction, cleaning, verifying data elements and constructing the database that is relevant of individual project. Provides consultation and supervision for technology transfer to ensure applications operate according to the appropriate analytical framework. Performs complex data analysis to identify patterns, correlations, trends and anomalies in order to obtain insights into historical and future performance. Takes initiatives to conduct in-depth assessment and selection of the most appropriate methodologies for the project given its complexity, scope, and data structure for statistical analysis, overall descriptive statistics, exploratory data analyses, descriptive statistics, and statistical analysis: including graphical summaries, data transformations, confirmatory analysis and statistical tests and modeling. Responsible for tracking project-specific issues from initiation through release. Independently identifies & troubleshoots problems encountered during the process. Responsible for preparation of data files and statistical reports for project release. Identifies systematic problems with data and software. Participates in formulating data/analytics core-related strategies, action plans, steps and training/development plans. Engages in or assists in grant applications, and preparation of presentations and publications. Identifies ways to improve work processes and improve customer satisfaction. Engages in continuous improvement for outcome, accuracy, and efficiency. Makes recommendations to supervisor, implements, and monitors results as appropriate in support of the overall goals of the department. Stays abreast of the latest developments, advancements, and trends in the field of data analysis by attending seminars/workshops, reading professional journals, and actively participating in professional organizations. Integrates knowledge gained into current work practices. Maintains knowledge of applicable rules, regulations, policies, laws and guidelines that impact the assigned department. Develops effective internal controls designed to promote adherence with applicable laws, accreditation agency requirements, and federal, state, and private health plans. Seeks advice and guidance as needed to ensure proper understanding. Required Skills Knowledge of statistical methods, concepts, practices, procedures and their applications Critical thinking skills Strong quantitative and qualitative communication skills. Word processing, spreadsheet, data management, and statistical analysis software Experience with R, STATA, SPSS, SAS, MATLAB, and others performing data scrubbing, manipulation, processing management and analysis. Required Experience Education: Bachelors degree in a health related field of management information systems. Prefer a Masters degree in a related field. Prefer advanced mathematical and statistical coursework at a university level. Experience: Five years of experience in analysis of healthcare or business related data and information systems Research and development experience in predictive modeling, data mining, and management, and other advanced analytics in the development of business intelligence and technology transfer. Experience working with healthcare organizations and/or healthcare applications Job Location Dallas, Texas, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular Apply Share Return To Job Listings © Copyright Pieces Technologies, Inc. 2016. All rights reserved. Loading...

Job Description The selected candidate would be joining the Global EG Pricing Team as a Senior Analyst. He/she would play a key role in understanding the broad spectrum of pricing activities across the various HP EG Businesses, identify areas of analytical engagement and support the deployment of pricing initiatives Globally. The selected candidate should be responsible for overall executing and mentoring of various Pricing analysis projects within the team along with his/her individual deliveries. He/she is expected to conceptualize the analytical methodology for business problems, provide strategic and operational data-based insights to business management group on a regular basis and achieve business impact. The selected candidate is also expected to manage communication rhythm with key stakeholders on regular basis. Responsibilities Understand HPEs various Pricing strategies through interviews and discussions with the region product category and finance managers Identify analytical solutions (including explore existing solutions) that meet business needs Develop and implement pricing models for multiple business lines and market segments to drive competitive advantage while maximizing profit Analyze and understand customer buying behaviors; strategize and coach sales on the outcomes Closely collaborate with the HPE's Business Units, EG Finance and Sales Operations to drive the implementation of the pricing analytics tools Develop strategic approach to pricing analytics and help implementing it in the day-to-day business operations Work closely with the EG Finance and Business Leadership Teams to drive the definition and implementation of the differentpricing models according to the companys business strategy Proactively gather market & competitive pricing intelligence Continuously analyze the price trends in the market, recommending the course of action to take accordingly Support ad-hoc complex business opportunities requiring a tailored pricing approach Qualifications Experience: Bachelor's degree required; MBA Preferred 5+ years of experience in analyzing large data and providing recommendations to senior management within in a multi-product environment Experience in a matrix reporting environment Solid reputation and credibility with business Ability to manage a fast moving, market oriented and dynamic work environment HW business experience may be an advantage Key Success Drivers: Strong business and finance acumen, ability to partner and challenge the business Strategic mindset and business orientation Superior business application skills (e.g., Microsoft Excel). Excellent interpersonal communication skills and an ability to influence Critical thinking and excellent analytical skills Sound business judgment and an appreciation and interest in the 'big picture' Ability to define and solve unstructured business problems Ability to make decisions and defend them clearly Self-motivation and independence Project management skills will be an advantage Strong ethics and transparency in dealings with all internal stakeholders . Evaluates the research data, and revises techniques or approaches to work problems. Searches and studies the literatures, brings new idea and methods in research on pediatric oncology. Identifies new therapeutic targets and develops new approach strategies for the treatment of cancer. Monitors and ensures quality control on lab procedures Analysis reporting and publication. : Complies, writes and submits reports to the PI. Authors abstracts and papers Prepares manuscripts for publication, presents data in the scientific meeting. Personnel management and supervision : Assigns and reviews work of subordinates, determines specific goals or objectives to be attained. Participates in evaluation of lab employees. Orients and trains new laboratory employees PhD in one of the natural sciences or related field or Medical degree With PhD, no experience required. With Medical degree, two years of experience in experimental or scientific work. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105552 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications. summary: The successful applicant is expected to collaborate with both technical staff and scientists and efficiently communicate in such environments about requirements...
post_text: Software Engineer Skip to Main Content Toggle navigation Home Search Jobs Create Account Log In Help About Rice Annual Security Report Houston: It's Cooler Than You Think Take a Virtual Tour of Rice Sustainability@Rice Software Engineer Bookmark this Posting | Print Preview | Apply for this Job Please see Special Instructions for more details. Provide 3 References which includes contact information. Posting Details Position Information Job Title Software Engineer Department Physics and Astronomy Full Time/Part Time Full-Time Requisition Number S16325 Open Date 02/03/2016 Close Date Salary Information Salary Commensurate with Experience and Qualifications Work Schedule Regular business hours and occasional nights and weekends. Benefits Eligible Yes Eligible for Overtime No Position Summary The Rice University group has an opening for a software engineer to work on the online and data acquisition systems of the Compact Muon Solenoid ( CMS ) experiment at CERN . The responsibilities for this position include the development and maintenance of online systems that acquire and monitor non-event data. Additionally, a significant responsibility will involve software development for and maintenance of the CMS data acquisition system. The successful applicant is expected to collaborate with both technical staff and scientists and efficiently communicate in such environments about requirements and proposed methodologies. The work location will be at CERN , Geneva, Switzerland. The successful applicant must be willing to occasionally work outside regular working hours, which may include nights, weekends, or official holidays, as well as have a willingness to do shift and be on stand-by duty. Education Required Bachelor's Degree Concentration / Degree Type In physical sciences, computer science, or engineering. Substitution for Education Requirement Experience may not be substituted for the education requirement. Education Preferred PhD in physical sciences, computer science, or engineering is preferred. Experience Required 3 years Type of Experience - The candidate should have relevant experience in programming for real-time systems. Preferably this experience is in programming such systems for accelerator-based physics experiments. - The candidate should demonstrate experience in developing large-scale online software using Object-Oriented programming (preferably in C++) as well as excellent knowledge of Linux real-time system programming and inter-process communication. - The candidate should demonstrate experience with, or otherwise show a strong affinity for working in large-scale database environments. Substitution for Experience Requirement Education may not be substituted for the experience requirement. Experience Preferred - Experience of working on large-scale physics projects or other international team environments. License/Certification Required N/A License/Certification Preferred N/A Skills Required - Programming for real-time systems. - Developing large-scale online software using Object-Oriented programming (preferably in C++) and Linux real-time system programming and inter-process communication. - Skills associated with working in large-scale database environments. - Knowledge and skills in industrial standards mandates. Skills Preferred - In addition to extensive experience with C++, experience with Python and Java is also preferred. - Experience/Skills in large-scale physics projects and international team environments - Able to learn new tools and software and skills to adapt to existing in-house software standards. - Knowledge of industrial standards is desirable. Internal / External Contacts Frequent interactions and communications with Rice faculty, postdocs, students, and other members of the CMS collaboration at CERN , Geneva, Switzerland. Physical Demands Must be able to travel between CERN offices and CMS experimental site (20 kilometers apart) by car. Working Conditions The successful applicant must be willing to occasionally work outside regular working hours, which may include nights, weekends, or official holidays, as well as have a willingness to do shift and be on stand-by duty. Security Sensitive No Special Instructions to Applicants Provide 3 References which includes contact information. Quick Link for Posting http://jobs.rice.edu:80/postings/6457 Job Duties Job Duty Name Web Based Software Development Description of Job Duty - Development and operation of online software to support and upgrade Web-Based Monitoring system for operation of the CMS detector. Percentage of Time 40 Job Duty Name On-Line Data Operation Description of Job Duty - Development and operation of online software for the CMS data acquisition system for real-time data taking during the LHC run. Percentage of Time 40 Job Duty Name Software Maintenance Description of Job Duty - Maintenance of test stand software for upgrades of Web-Based Monitoring system and data acquisition system. Percentage of Time 20 Supplemental Questions Required fields are indicated with an asterisk (*). * Do you have a bachelor's degree or higher in physical sciences, computer science, or engineering? Yes No * Do you have three or more years of experience that includes the following: relevant experience in programming for real-time systems, preferably this experience is in programming such systems for accelerator-based physics experiments; experience in developing large-scale online software using object-oriented programming (preferably in C++) as well as excellent knowledge of Linux real-time system programming and inter-process communication and  experience with, or otherwise ability to show a strong affinity for working in large-scale database environments? Yes No * Are you willing and able to work and live In Geneva, Switzerland for this position? (Open Ended Question) Applicant Documents Required Documents Resume Optional Documents Curriculum Vitae 6100 Main, Houston, Texas 77005-1892 | Mailing Address: P.O. Box 1892, Houston, Texas 77251-1892 Return to the Top ? ? ? Copyright @ PeopleAdmin

title: Research Analyst
summary: Reasonable relocation expenses will be reimbursed if the successful candidate does not live in the area. Earn recognition as an industry leader by creating...
post_text:
Research Analyst - Dallas, TX - IRMI Jobs Home Jobs Research Analyst - Dallas, TX Toggle navigation Research Analyst Jobs Login 12-Apr-2016 to 11-Jun-2016 (PST) Editorial Dallas, TX, USA Salary Full Time Medical, Dental, Vision, and more! Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job Join the Content team for International Risk Management Institute, Inc. (IRMI), as a Research Analyst! Earn recognition as an industry leader by creating cutting-edge information products on insurance coverage issues. You will have the opportunity to share your knowledge and expertise with others without the pressures of billing by the hour. You can make an impact on the world by helping to simplify the management of risk. This could be the career move you have been waiting for! The Research Analyst will work on developments in case law interpreting insurance coverage and report on these developments in CGL Reporter and other IRMI publications. Additionally, the Research Analyst will study and provide advice and commentary on insurance coverage provisions and risk management issues. Some of the key activities will be as follows.  Staying current with appellate court decisions focused on insurance coverage issues  Working with the managing editor and editorial board of CGL Reporter to publish summaries of the latest case law  Researching case law on specific insurance coverage issues  Researching information on commercial insurance coverage and risk management  Preparing written material that provides explanations, conclusions, and recommendations based on this research This position is in our home office in Dallas, with a limited amount of travel to attend industry conferences and seminars. Reasonable relocation expenses will be reimbursed if the successful candidate does not live in the area. Desired Skills and Experience  510 years' legal experience focusing primarily in the area of coverage law  Undergraduate college degree and JD or LLB degree  Knowledge of commercial lines insurance  Excellent writing skills  CPCU, CIC, CRM, or ARM designation a plus Description of the Company IRMI is the premier authority and educator for risk management, insurance, and legal professionals. We provide trusted, unbiased information via reference services, books, newsletters, continuing education courses, conferences, and certifications. IRMI has been in business for over 38 years and offers an innovative, supportive, and stable work environment. The average tenure of our employees is over 10 years! For a glimpse of why our employees enjoy working at IRMI, see the top 10 reasons to work at IRMI: http://www.irmi.com/about/companyinfo/top-10-reasons-to-work-at-irmi.pdf . Come be part of our team! Please apply in the Careers section of our website. IRMI https://irmicareers.applicantpro.com Apply Now with our quick 3 minute application!

          Patients Giving Careers 1 2 3 4 1 2 3 4 Home > Search Jobs JOB DETAILS Back Refer This Job Send Link Apply RESEARCH SCIENTIST-Urology Research Job Ref: 23147 Talent Area: Laboratory Location: Houston Methodist Research Institute Houston, TX 77030 Area/Department: Urology Research Employment Type: Regular Job Type: Full-Time Organization: Houston Methodist Work Shift: DAY Work Week: M - F Company Profile Houston Methodist Research Institute was formed in 2004 to rapidly and efficiently translate discoveries made in the laboratory and the clinic into new diagnostics, therapies and treatments.  The research institute was created to provide the infrastructure and support for these endeavors, and to house the technology and resources needed to make innovative breakthroughs in important areas of human disease.  A 440,000 square foot building dedicated to research, the research institute houses over 1,150 staff members, 270 principal investigators and has more than 600 ongoing clinical trials. Job Summary The Research Scientist is primarily engaged in research or research-related services to the institution, e.g. direction of research core facilities. The role is limited to one that is primarily supportive in nature. This includes scientists who are not on an independent path in terms of external grant funding and publications, and individuals whose job is to serve and support TMHRI. The expectation for faculty on the Research Track is that full salary support must be maintained by the supervising faculty member(s).  This salary support can be constituted from extramural funding, philanthropic funding, start up support, or any combination thereof. PATIENT AGE GROUP SERVED Describe the age group of primary customers/patients served if applicable to this position. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES Duties and Responsibilities are cross-referenced to the hospital¿s Pillars of Excellence and will be transferred to Performance Evaluation. Please include % breakout of tasks/essential functions. PEOPLE (10%) 1. Under the direction of a Principal Investigator, coordinates and provides technical direction to the work activities of research staff engaged in projects (EF). FINANCE (25%) 2. Participates in grant writing 3. Designs, develops, or adapts equipment used in experiments or research to obtain desired results (EF). QUALITY/SAFETY (25%) 1. Establishes procedures to be applied for projects (EF). 2. Performs and supervises those procedures which require a highly developed technical skill (EF). 3. Follows all safety rules while on the job. Reports accidents promptly and corrects minor safety hazards. 4. Completes all hospital required and job-related in-services and applies the information as needed. 5. Reviews scientific literature (EF). SERVICE (20%) 1. Analyzes data and interprets data (EF). 2. Demonstrates the components of the ICARE values statement. 3. Performs other duties as assigned. GROWTH/INNOVATION (20%) 1. Compiles, writes, and submits project results to the principle investigator (EF). 2. Defines problems and possible solutions as dictated by the research project (EF). 3. Participates in writing manuscripts and publications EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Ph.D. EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Varies CERTIFICATES, LICENSES AND REGISTRATIONS REQUIRED None SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED WORKING ENVIRONMENT Standard laboratory environment Equal Employment Opportunity Houston Methodist is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Equal employment opportunity is a sound and just concept to which Houston Methodist is firmly bound. Houston Methodist will not engage in discrimination against or harassment of any person employed or seeking employment with Houston Methodist on the basis of  race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or other characteristics protected by law. post_text: Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior Job in San Antonio, TX at USAA Home Why Work at USAA? Military and Spouses University Recruiting Search Jobs Senior Data Scientist-Research Engineer Job Job Number: 26919 Location: San Antonio , TX Date Posted: 4-1-2016 Job Title: Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior Apply We are currently seeking talented Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior for our San Antonio, TX facility. PURPOSE OF JOB Synthesizes analyses, identifies root causes, and develops and recommends key work products. Assembles key participants and guides and facilitates teams in the development and implementation of key initiatives. Execute applied research for business and technical innovation purposes across any known, future, or as of yet unknown set of business functions and/or complex technologies. Develops business and technology gap assessments, innovation forecasts, research recommendations, patent opportunities, and specialized business and technology evaluations based on complex analysis of business, technology, industry, competitors, economic environment, legal/regulatory/political, and suppliers. Serves as a mentor to peers and team members for assigned area of responsibility. Provides insight to management on issues. JOB DUTIES Identify technology needs and solutions using highly developed research techniques. Interact with appropriate experts from across the enterprise in assessments. Perform most complex research assessments, present findings to technical, business, and mid-level management audiences, without requiring guidance. Regularly interact with and maintain relationships with counterparts internally, externally across IT. Begin to network regularly across EBO, and develop business contacts. Act as a technology subject matter expert providing assistance across the enterprise in understanding and communicating technology capabilities, limitations, risks, and opportunities. Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience 6+ years relevant business support and/or general technology research/analysis experience Significant coordination and people networking skills Demonstrated functional development skills in infrastructure and architecture disciplines Advanced awareness of IT and financial service industry. Demonstrated elevated degree of creative and innovative skills. Advanced knowledge of data visualization (Excel, Tableau, Business Objects, etc.) Preferred Basic statistical model building skills Experience in structured hypothesis testing Basic ETL acumen Drive for Results and Innovation The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. Share our pride. Join our mission. As a Fortune 200 financial services organization, USAA is on a mission - to facilitate the financial security of our members, the men and women of the U.S. military and their families worldwide by providing a full range of financial services and products. Headquartered on a showcase campus in San Antonio, TX, USAA attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our 27,000 employees. They are the heart and soul of our member-service culture. Recently Ranked #11 in Forbes list of 500 of the "Best Employers in the U.S. in 2015" , we are proud to receive consistently outstanding awards and ratings for member service, employee well-being and financial strength. Everything that happens at USAA is based on our core values: Service, Loyalty, Honesty, and Integrity. These are the foundations of how we do business with our members, as well as how we treat each other. At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position. Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre-employment background and drug screen. USAA is an EEO/AA Employer - applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law. Roughly 60-75% hands-on coding Resolve defects/bugs during QA testing, pre-production, production, and post-release patches Work cross-functionally with various Intuit teams: Product Development, Product Management, Project Management Office, Sales, Care, Data Architects, Shared Data Services, Data Scientists, Data Analysts and other Data Engineers Qualifications Minimum 2 of years experience in ETL/ELT with Hadoop and MPP environments such as Vertica, GreenPlum, and RedShift Experience working on Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a plus Familiarity with NoSQL database environments such as Cassandra BS/MS in computer science or equivalent work experience Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non- technical audience Strong understanding of the Software design/architecture principles Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation.                     Data Science Jobs at AT&T Change the way the world connects Around here, technology has the power to make the impossible possible. From healthcare mobile apps to revolutionary devices, our Data Science experts are pushing the limits of innovation. What does it feel like to develop life-changing ideas? This is your chance to find out. Share Share this job with your friends and connections! Job Details Culture Apply now Apply now Sr Specialist Big Data Software Eng BIG DATA Location: Plano, Texas Responsible for the development of high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies. Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM are desirable. Key Roles and Responsibilities: Uses Big Data programming languages and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions. Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented. Works in a highly agile environment. Job Contribution: Developing technical professional with some experience. Completes moderately complex work within discipline/specialty area. Contributes to development of concepts/methods/techniques. Moderate team impact. KNOWLEDGE Has expanded technical knowledge in own discipline/specialty area. Applies broader knowledge of discipline/specialty area standards to work assignments. Sound understanding of 1 to 2 specific AT&T technologies/systems/procedures. Deepens technical knowledge through exposure and continuous learning. ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Identifies problems/issues. Solves non routine problems by independently applying judgment to established analysis and standard approaches. Integrates/evaluates multiple factors to develop creative practical solutions. INDEPENDENCE Guided by project and work deadlines; sets own priorities. Uses discretion to complete assignments; independently applies knowledge of technical practices and specialty area standards. Independently completes assignments; participates in diverse projects. CONTRIBUTION TO AT&T TECHNOLOGY Supports technical initiatives normally as part of a larger project. Works on new technologies development and/or existing technologies maintenance. Contributes to milestone project completion. COMMUNICATION Exchanges complex technical information. Provides training/guidance to others in work area breaking down information in a systematic/logical manner. Cultivates good peer working relationships. Education: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred. Experience: Typically requires 2-3 years experience. Supervisory: No. Principal Functional Skills / Competencies associated with this Title: Agile Development Application Design, Architecture Application Development (Web) Application Development Tools Application Programming Interface (API) Big Data Software Engineering Data Mining and Data Science Emerging Technologies Information Security Management Programming Requirements Analysis Software Development Life Cycle Statistics and Actuarial Modeling Testing User Interface Design Requisition ID: 1562712 Apply now Apply now AT&T has the best innovative technology, the best ideas, and the best leadership team.
