Senior Developer Development | Austin, TX Job Description Square Root is hiring: Senior Developer About Square Root We are Square Root, an Austin-based tech startup and a leading enterprise SaaS provider. CoEFFICIENT, our flagship product, is a cloud based platform that leverages data to help large retail networks improve performance. Today, some of the biggest players in automotive and retail use our product to optimize their daily operations. Since 2013, we've received a number of awards for our business growth and unique culture, including being named an Inc. 5000 company, a best small company to work for in Texas by Texas Monthly , and a top local startup by the Austin A-List. Most recently, we were named the 2nd best small company to work for in the U.S. by Fortune magazine. Role Description Our developers power the software that makes Square Root a successful company. Working in small scrum teams, developers focus on fast iterations to deliver value to our clients. Our developers' extensive design and engineering experience is critical to the quality of our products and our ability to deliver elegant, highly scalable solutions. Although our primary focus is enterprise-class web development on an open source stack, our developers also get to dig into complex data representations and other technologies within a service-oriented architecture. We depend on our senior developers to be highly collaborative within the engineering group as well as with product managers and data scientists, so that Square Root defines and delivers the best solution possible. If you have a passion for excellence, both in the code and the value it delivers to the user, you might be just who we're looking for. Give us a shout. Role Requirements 5+ years software engineering experience Excellent understanding of the fundamentals of computer science, design patterns, data structures, and algorithms A thirst for learning and understanding current development best practices, trends, and techniques Strength in full-stack web application development Experience in Ruby on Rails or strong interest to learn it Familiarity with Agile software development processes and iterative delivery cycles UI/UX design experience a plus A positive attitude, a sense of humor, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Self-motivation and an internal drive to produce high quality work Square Roots Radical Culture Our culture is at the core of everything we do. We have fun, but we work hard. So, as we grow were not only looking to hire the best and brightest, but were also looking for people that share our values. This is the code we live by: Think big. Do bigger. We think big ideas are meant to be pursued. So, we think critically and have a bias for action and impact. We continually iterate to deliver smarter direction and better software. Be customer-inspired. We aim to over-deliver and delight by doing whats best, not just whats expected. Thats why we make it a priority to understand how our customers operate and the challenges that they face. We look for inspiration in the details so that we can deliver relevant and impactful solutions. Partner. We build strong relationships by having a partnership mindset  internally and externally. We go above and beyond to help our customers and one another succeed. Thrive. We set our internal bar high so that we can bring enthusiasm, speed, and innovation. We empower each Square Root employee to take ownership, act, and iterate to make everything we do  from work product to working environment  better. We revere personal drive, growth, and balance. We celebrate successes, and, sometimes, we just celebrate. Square Root Perks Flexibility: no dress code, office hours, or vacation policy A small, innovative team with a passion for making a huge impact on large, enterprise customers Competitive benefits and compensation Modern-retro downtown offices Team lunches, stocked kitchens, coffee-snob compliant coffee machines Regular office happy hours and a full office bar including local beer on tap and an expansive scotch collection Return to Square Root Apply for this job Apply for this job Apply for this job SHARE Not the right job? title: Senior Backend Server Developer
summary: Using machine learning and NLP techniques to process and analyze primary and derived data. You will be a critical member of this team of highly skilled...
post_text: Playfair Capital - Jobs: Senior Backend Server Developer - Apply online All jobs ? Senior Backend Server Developer Senior Backend Server Developer Austin, Texas, United States · Clarify · Engineering Description The world has moved beyond text. Every day there is more audio and video recorded than was recorded in the entire 20th century. Unfortunately, these media files are only occasionally sorted, rarely organized, and at best have a short text description. And generally the text is... lacking. At Clarify , our mission is to improve human communication. Using our self-service API, any application can easily submit audio and video files for analysis. We perform sophisticated signal processing, automated speech recognition, and natural language processing to turn this unstructured information into actionable data. The first step is search. Using our API, we can tell you exactly where each word is said in the audio. But were not done there. Here are some of the challenges we're tackling: Extracting a multitude of information from audio and video media and metadata Using machine learning and NLP techniques to process and analyze primary and derived data Indexing everything to yield document and time-based search results Building an API that balances power and depth with fast development and ease-of-use Creating a great developer experience And thats where you come in... Were looking for a world-class Senior Backend Server Developer . Someone who loves data and who loves software.  The ideal candidate will want to live in Austin... but were willing to consider someone remote who can spend a lot of time here. The Senior Backend Server Developer will play a key role in the design and implementation of Clarify s cloud-based platform. As part of a small team, you will have an opportunity to work on many different components and touch a lot of different technologies. You will be a critical member of this team of highly skilled developers and scientists. As part of the development team, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and testing of various parts of the Clarify platform and evaluate 3rd-party and open-source software and technology that can be incorporated. You will participate in our weekly sprint planning meetings and help write, estimate, and prioritize stories. You will understand how developers are using our API and build features based on their needs. You will be accountable for writing clean, maintable code with good test coverage, following our standards for code management and deployment, and for communicating with the other team members to ensure product quality and deadline targets are met. It's a supportive team but you will not be micro-managed. You will be consulted on platform design and product feature decisions as well as on how we can improve the way we work and new technologies we may be able to leverage. You are encouraged to bring new ideas to the table. We're an open minded, mostly ego-free group and we expect you to be the same so we can continue our free exchange of ideas. We're looking for people who have deep expertise in some areas, yet recognize they have a lot to learn in others. You will be regularly informed of the business developments of our fast-paced startup and encouraged to interact with future and current customers - both to educate them about our API to and to learn from them to gain an understanding of their needs and how they are using our API. Come and work at Clarify  were a TechStars and Capital Factory Incubator company. How we work : REST APIs Python / Node.js (Hapijs) / C / C++ Agile, automated tests, continuous integration. DevOps: Chef, Docker, Logstash/Kibana, AWS Asynchronous Workflows/Task Queues, such as Celery, Rabbit/AMQP Databases: MySQL,Elasticsearch, NoSQL such as S3, Redis Audio & video processing toolkits: ffmpeg, gstreamer Search technologies: ElasticSearch, Lucene. Video or audio signal processing Speech/NLP/Machine Learning toolkits such as Kaldi, SciPy, SciKit, NumPy, OpenNLP, Mahout, pandas HTML5 / AJAX / jquery / backbone / Django Requirements Our ideal candidate will have : 3+ years of server / backend systems design and development. Experience with object-oriented and asynchronous programming. Very strong programming skills. Strong analytical and problem solving skills, including the ability to understand, articulate, and critique requirements. Strong troubleshooting and diagnostic skills. Strong communication and team collaboration skills. Highly desirable : Experience in a fast paced/customer centered agile startup environment. Has worked at another software company that sells into the developer community. Has lived through and survived fast company growth. Experience with scalable cloud deployment environments. Apply for this job Playfair Capital website Powered by Workable

We are a $1.4 billion dollar company with more than 5,000 employees globally serving the financial services and insurance industries. We are evolving at a rapid pace and the clients we serve are challenged from every direction, which means we are growing and innovating to help drive their success. Working together, and differentiated by our superior data, analytics and data-enabled solutions, we empower our clients to make smarter business decisions through data-driven insights. We take initiative, are fully accountable, build respect and trust, make transparency a mustand engage, include and collaborate at every turn. We take pride in our work and believe in cultivating a work environment that supports and values our greatest asset: our talented employees. Design, develop, and deliver solutions that will enhance and add value to new and existing data assets for broad industry application and aligned with business and market requirements.   Develop algorithmic and rule-based models and analytic capabilities based on rules engine, machine learning, mathematical modeling, pattern recognition, and data mining techniques.   Performs data analysis and modeling using a variety of analytic techniques, tools, and programming languages to provide business insight and product analytics. Job Duties: Create enterprise-level entity matching engine through algorithm and/or data rules. Create data derivation and linkage through algorithm and/or data rules. Create and select predictive features from raw data. Create model reports for stakeholder review and model documentation. Perform pattern recognition model creation and training using various types of algorithms and machine learning modeling techniques for unknown or less well-defined  an unknown problem, solve new problems (e.g., scorecards, logistic regression, neural networks, CART, support vector machines, boosting trees, unsupervised models). Develop analytics tool using SQL, R, Java, Perl, Python and big data tools such as Jaspersoft BI Suite, Talend Open Studio, Skytree Server, Tableau, and Splunk. Develop analytics solutions using traditional database technology such as SQL and big data technology such as Hadoop, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Riak, CouchDB, and Neo4j, NoSQL databases. Perform complex data analysis on large volumes of property and consumer data and present model performance to stakeholders. Provide data science and analytic support for the Enterprise Data Group (EDG), and interact with other EDG teams as well as other business units. QA and analyze large amounts of data to create appropriate data sets for model building. Prepare and maintain programs and documentation for analytic models. Conduct defined quantitative and qualitative research projects independently and communicates research results to internal and external stakeholders. Act as a consultant to EDGs data management and data technology teams Job Requirements: Masters or higher in machine learning, a hard science, math, statistics or an engineering field, or equivalent work experience. Ability to thrive in a team environment and adapt to quickly changing priorities. Strong problem solving and analytical ability. Ability to quickly and efficiently adapt to new concepts. Demonstrated knowledge of statistical techniques. Strong working knowledge in multiple analytic development tools, statistical tools, programming languages, and big data tools. Data mining/data analysis experience. Ability to work collaborative with cross-function teams and business units. Demonstrated general business acumen; experience working in a real estate and mortgage related data industry a plus. We offer an empowered work environment that encourages creativity, initiative and professional growth and provides a competitive salary and benefits package. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and maintains a Drug-Free Workplace. We are fully committed to employing a diverse workforce and creating an inclusive work environment that embraces everyones unique contributions, experiences and values. Apply @ Copyright Loxo. Home > Search  openings > Search  results > Job  details Job details Job 1 of 1 Apply to job Save to cart AutoReqId 25275BR Job Title Research Technician Job Description JOB SUMMARY The Research Technician is responsible for conducting synthetic reactions supporting Organometallic Catalysis Research. The Research Technician is also responsible for the purification and analysis of reaction products, scale-up of synthetic routes, preparation of supported catalyst formulations, and the evaluation of catalyst performance using autoclave and/or high throughput reactor systems.  Additional responsibilities include the maintenance of laboratory equipment, management of the laboratory chemical inventory, and participation in hazard reviews. The position is located at the Baytown Technology and Engineering Complex and is based on an 8 hour work day. PRIMARY JOB FUNCTIONS     Execute synthetic reactions and purify and characterize reaction products.     Prepare and evaluate catalyst formulations (homogeneous and heterogeneous) using autoclave and/or high throughput reactor systems.     Maintain all associated laboratory equipment and chemical inventories.     Interact with research scientists on data reporting and work progress. JOB REQUIREMENTS     A BS degree in chemistry and/or 3+ years of experience in a chemical research lab environment.     Experience in synthetic chemistry (inorganic, organometallic, or organic).     Understanding of analytical methods and separations techniques (NMR, FTIR, chromatography).     Good mechanical aptitude, troubleshooting skills, understanding of chemical properties and hazards.     Demonstrated strong safety values, flexibility, initiative, time management, and ability to work in a team environment.     Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills. PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES (KSAs)     Experience with handling air sensitive and/or pyrophoric materials is a plus.     Experience with working in glove boxes and using nitrogen/vacuum manifolds is a plus.     Experience with catalyst evaluation using autoclave, or similar reactors, is a plus.     Experience with the use of high throughput experimentation methods and equipment is a plus.     Knowledge of polymer analytical methods is a plus. Develops detailed analysis, utilizing sophisticated analytical and financial modeling and statistical techniques to predict, evaluate and manage the credit risk across various loan portfolios. SPSS, R). Working knowledge of industry data sources. Working knowledge of gathering and documenting data requirements and analyzing these requirements from a business perspective. The RM/OR group works with a variety of other departments, as such, strong communication skills and a candidates ability to convey ideas clearly is a must. Quantitative techniques utilized may include economic forecast and passenger behavior models, mathematical programming and other optimization techniques, simulation, data mining, and decision analysis. Most projects include an analysis component, a recommendation for improvement path, as well as working with dedicated IT group towards a production implementation. Individuals will develop a solid understanding of core airline economics and be well positioned for potential advancement. Qualifications An advanced degree (MS or PhD) in Economics, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics or a related field is required Successful candidates will have a demonstrated aptitude for logical analysis, problem identification, and problem solving as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. The ability to use computer-based tools and programming languages to implement solutions is required. Willingness to show initiative and take ownership of job responsibilities. Experience solving large-scale problems and familiarity with the airline industry are a plus. Working knowledge of SAS, Python and Java is also
preferred. summary: Design, test and implement analytics processes and tools based analytics solutions based on business requirements, technical specifications and quantitative...

Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Quantitative Information Analyst (OCA00500) Job Description Quantitative Information Analyst - OCA00500 Description Summary: Responsible for performing analytics, business analysis, technical research and statistical programming.  Must be able to apply and develop skills in SAS base and statistical products on personal computers and in Windows and UNIX server environments to perform multi-platform data extraction, complex data transformation and statistical analysis.  Must be able to perform statistical analysis, ad hoc reporting and analytics that maximize information technology and business operational efficiency and productivity.  Also responsible for performing research, analysis, interpreting, communicating and applying adequate knowledge of electric industry standards and processes aligned with previous professional work experience related to the following defined electric business processes: (1) metering, market operations and ERCOT transactions (2) energy distribution, field operations and service orders (3) revenue billing or credit procedures (4) load research and energy forecasting (5) operational performance metrics and marketing (6) financial and regulatory. Candidate must be able to. Candidate must be able to perform statistical analysis, ad hoc reporting and analytics that maximize information technology and business operational efficiency and productivity. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Learn, understand and apply the various energy delivery business and technical processes to help determine and implement the appropriate research and quantitative methods critical to applying sound analytics solutions. Identify, foster collaboration and communicate with business process owners and technical solutions providers to define business requirements and explore analytics opportunities in new or existing business data, processes and workflows. Evaluate information sources, data collection methods, analysis processes and analytics results to determine any limitations or defects and to ensure both data and process validity, quality, applicability, efficiency and accuracy. Provide analysis of electric energy, operations, financial and billing data and life cycle processes in support of the development of regulatory strategies and filings and operational metrics Design, test and implement analytics processes and tools based analytics solutions based on business requirements, technical specifications and quantitative research plans. Apply valid numerical and statistical methods using information obtained from baseline or historical data to structure quality, substantiated, repeatable, efficient and cost-effective analyses Analyze and interpret statistical data to identify significant differences in relationships among sources of information¸ identify relationships and trends in data, and determine any factors that could affect research process, findings and/or decision-making. Communicate research findings and analytics results to business clients and peers through meetings, formal presentations, written reports and technical specifications. Prepare ad-hoc reporting requests, SDLC documentation, research documents, task plans and diagrams to support the blueprint, design and maintenance of statistical programs and analytics solutions. Contribute to group knowledge and best practices through cross training other analysts, exposure to diverse analytics processes and tools, conducting technical process and data quality reviews, providing documentation and leading analytics work tasks Qualifications Education: A Bachelors of Science degree from an accredited college or university in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Chemistry, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or Management. Post-graduate coursework towards a Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Chemistry, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or Management is preferred. Experience: Previous professional work experience for the non-entry level positions as described Quantitative Information Analyst Level II Recent college graduate with at least one (1) year of previous professional work experience Within one (1) year candidate must become proficient in SAS base and statistical products on personal computers and in the UNIX server environment. gain and be able to apply a foundational knowledge of electric industry standards and operations related to at least two (2) of the defined electric business processes. Quantitative Information Analyst Level III A minimum of two (2 ) years of previous professional work experience A minimum of two (2) years of electric industry experience Competency in at least three (3) of the defined electric business operations processes A minimum of two (2) years of technical experience with defined technology tools and data management practices Quantitative Information Analyst Level IV A minimum of five (5) years of previous professional work experience A minimum of five (5) years of electric industry experience Competency in at least four (4) of the defined electric business operations processes A minimum of five (5) years of technical experience with defined technology tools and data management practices Additional Knowledge, Skills, Licenses/Certifications, Abilities & Personal Characteristics (KSLAPs): SAS Base Certified Programmer or SAS Advanced Certified Programmer credentials preferred Familiarity with SAP HANA, SAP Business Objects, IBM SPSS, R, SQL Server, UNIX Server, SQL Query Development and/or C preferred. Able to demonstrate a high level of initiative, professionalism, sound judgment, continuous learning and leadership Ability to work with varying levels of supervision to accomplish work assignments Business knowledge related to the defined electric business operations processes Business and/or technical writing skills Electric industry experience in each of the following: application of Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) EDI transactions (TXSET) application of electric tariff, metering, billing and operations practice, procedures and policy direct interaction with finance, auditing, engineering or regulatory business clients Technical work experience using basic SAS, SAS statistics products and SAS ACCESS products from multiple technology platforms. Technical work experience managing, extracting and transforming large information sets from variety of information platforms (i.e. ORACLE, DB2, SAP BW) Able to work well in a team environment. Able to recognize and to handle confidential information in a discreet manner Able to apply strong analytical and complex problem solving and critical thinking skills Able to communicate professionally (verbal/written) with solid interpersonal skills Able to communicate and present ideas persuasively to others Able to manage multiple projects and priorities effectively and efficiently to deliver work products;  particularly under pressure of stringent timelines Able to work cost effectively through planning and process improvement Able to learn and to apply knowledge of CNPs corporate policies and procedures. Able to learn and to apply knowledge of complex policies, procedures and regulations affecting regulatory research and analysis Able to utilize mainframe, server and/or personal computer systems and software proficiently, such as electronic mail, spreadsheets and word processing software (currently Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint). Able to provide a valid state drivers license, present and maintain a good driving record and to operate company vehicles safely and in compliance with applicable laws and company policies. Physical Requirements: Able to demonstrate the manual dexterity required to operate a personal computer Able to travel out of town, occasionally overnight, for meetings, audits, conferences, etc. Able to communicate orally in a clear manner. Able to hear oral communication either in person or on equipment such as telephone or mobile phone. Able to view a personal computer monitor or laptop screen for extended periods of time. Able to operate a personal computer, either desktop or laptop, for extended periods of time creating, composing and reviewing computer code, documents and spreadsheets. Able to operate office equipment, including telephone, mobile phone, photocopier, fax machine, scanner and calculator. Able to reach, grasp and move items. Able to sit, stand or walk for extended periods of time. Able to operate a motor vehicle, including ability to enter and exit the vehicle unassisted, and travel long distances. Able to exert up to 10 pounds of force occasionally, and/or a minimal amount of force frequently to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Working Conditions: Able to work a varied schedule to complete projects and meet established deadlines in response to changing demands. Able to work in fast paced environment with daily pressure to meet deadlines. Able to perform work indoors in an office environment, regardless of whether cubicle, open office or private office. Able to demonstrate commitment to compliance with applicable laws and regulations, the Company's Ethics and Compliance Code, and other Company policies and procedures, and take all required training courses. Must demonstrate respect for all individuals and adhere to the Company's values and business practices. Able to support the Emergency Operating Plan. This job description reflects an assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict the tasks for this position. Other duties and tasks may be assigned to this position at the Companys discretion. This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR §§ 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a), and 60-741.5(a).  These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.  Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. Job Info. All Rights Reserved.

Job Title : : Digital Marketing Strategist - Austin, TX Location : : Austin, Texas Posted on : : Wed Apr 06, 2016 Experience required : : 6 years - 10 years Job category: : SEO, SEM, PPC, Online Marketing Job Description Our Digital Marketing Strategist role is responsible for managing the data-driven optimization of our social media and blog content and associated paid campaigns, providing insights and reporting to internal stakeholders, and strategically integrate social media and blog initiatives into other areas of our digital marketing organization. They are our data scientist for social and blog and are dedicated to ensuring were engaging with the right audiences on social and optimizing our content and campaigns effectively  supporting our marketing strategy and improving the performance of our campaigns. A third of this role is dedicated to optimizing our brands content engine on social  using data-driven insights to drive quality content and run targeted campaigns on our global social channels. The next third of this role is dedicated to measuring content and campaign performance, and reporting performance  along with actionable advice  to internal stakeholders. The remaining third of this role is dedicated to integrating social media and blog strategies with the strategies of other teams within our digital marketing organization, to build smarter, more strategic digital initiatives  including our email, advertising, marketing automation, and web teams at our corporate office and our regional offices around the world. This role is on our Global Social Media Team, working in close partnership with the Social Media Community Manager and reporting into the Social Media Program Manager. Key responsibilities include:  Manage social media and blog reporting for the brand o Manage global content tagging strategy in partnership with Social Media Community Manager o Build and optimize reporting templates for social and blog, to be used corporately and regionally o Report on all major social media campaigns; serve as go-to data scientist for social and blog for a broad group of internal stakeholders o Train and educate internal teams on social media reporting  Optimize our brands content engine on social o Work in close partnership with Social Media Community Manager on campaign/content planning ? Inform digital strategy of major campaigns ? Tweak ongoing content strategy based on performance insights o Communicate actionable insights to social media teams globally, as well as to internal stakeholders as needed o Work in close partnership with our agency on paid social campaigns ? Work with NIs marketing programs to build target audiences based on keywords, CRM data, and other available input types ? Mine data from other areas of the organization to inform our paid targeting strategies ? Collaborate on target profiles for major paid campaigns o Identify opportunities for us to proactively engage on social media based on real-time data  Integrate social media and blog strategies with the strategies of the broader digital marketing organization o Work with our web team to measure insights from social media traffic to our website o Work with our web team to place and manage tracking pixels to be used for re-targeted social campaigns o Work with our community team on ways to better connect our owned community with social media and blog channels o Work with our marketing automation team to align social media efforts with other digital channel strategies like email o Work with a broad set of stakeholders internally to ensure were reporting on the right KPIs, and that social media and blog KPIs align with/map to KPIs of the marketing organization as a whole  Write social media and blog content for campaigns o Though not a key focus for this role, all roles on our Global Social Media Team are expected to write short- and long-form content for our social media channels and blog, and be able to step in to write for the brand during large campaigns More >> View all jobs of this company Similar Jobs View company profile Home | About Us | Resources | SEO Companies | Partners | SEO Jobs by Countries | Site Map | Contact | Mobile | RSS Feeds Copyright ©2013 SEO Jobs Finder All rights reserved. Quantitative Risk Analyst III Tracking Code 7318-702 Job Description Responsible for developing, delivering, signing-off and supporting advanced, regulatory-compliant credit models, including, Probability of Default (PD) and Ratings, Loss Given Default (LGD), Exposure at Default (EAD). This position support management as well as the regulatory capital/provisions requirements. Also, on a more management oriented side these models constitute the basis for the optimization of economic capital and the management of portfolio risk adjusted performance measures. The model development resides on high standards using solid conceptual credit risk foundations. Extensive use of advanced statistical techniques is applied to detailed credit data sourced both internally and externally. Acts as an expert resource in the fields of credit risk quantification and modeling, working closely with other stakeholders both internal and external such as business and risk areas, and regulatory authorities. Essential Functions: Develop, enhance, implement, document and provide ongoing expert support for advanced credit risk models and methodologies, covering Probability of Default (PD), Loss Given Default (LGD) and Exposure at Default (EAD). Work within the Risk Methodology Group, to produce all required deliverables to a high standard. Contribute to the overall development and implementation of advances in credit risk methodology generally and specifically related to point-in-time and through-the-cycle PDs and ratings and stress testing. Provide the businesses with transaction advice and support, acting as an expert resource in the fields of risk quantification and modeling, and working closely with other stakeholders both internal and external, such as business areas & regulatory authority Work with the dedicated credit risk systems implementation team to support the roll-out of tactical and strategic implementations of the various credit models and methodologies Advanced credit model developments delivered on time. Accurate, concise and high quality model build documentation. Contribute to model and methodology-related presentations to model committees, credit officers, and model users as well as to regulators. Application of methodology to internal and external data sets for model development Other Functions: Special projects as requested Performs other duties as assigned Required Experience Requirements: Bachelors degree in a related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience, required Masters Degree preferred Five (5) to seven (7) years of related experience required Advanced Microsoft Excel skills. Strong time management skills. Excellent written and verbal communication with a focus on detailed and clear technical writing. Good understanding of commercial and retail banking environment. Good working knowledge of Basel II-like concepts and broad understanding of Model Risk Management regulatory requirements. Knowledge of point-in-time (PIT) and through-the-cycle (TTC) PD and rating approaches. Knowledge of key industry default and loss data from rating Agencies and other vendors. Some familiarity with understanding of banking and finance in a Corporate Banking/Capital Markets environment. Strong skills in developing and supporting sophisticated risk models and methodologies. Team player, prepared to work under pressure close to deadlines. Technology skills encompassing spreadsheet and database work. Preferences: Advanced degree in economics, physics, math, finance, statistics, or a related field. Working Conditions: Extended working hours may be required as dictated by management and business needs. Travel to multiple facilities may be required. May be required to lift, push, or pull materials weighing up to twenty (20) pounds. May be required to sit and review information on a computer screen for long periods of time. May require repetitive motions of the hands and wrist related to writing and typing at an electronic keyboard. Corporate / satellite office role. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Operations Research Analyst - Programmer and Database Developer (00ZOZ) Job Description Operations Research Analyst - Programmer and Database Developer - 00ZOZ Description Sabre is the global leader in innovative technology that leads the travel industry. We are always looking for bright and driven people who have a penchant for technology and want to hone their skills. If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you! It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs for our airline, hotel, and travel agency customers. GENERAL DESCRIPTION: There is increasing demand for the unique services provided by the Airline Solutions Consulting Team.  With this demand comes a growing requirement for expertise in Programming and Database Development and an over-arching set of capabilities in Business Intelligence, Statistical Analysis, and Data Exploration.  The position capabilities include: Programming and Scripting Database development Business Intelligence representation Tableau or Similar Tool development Client interaction Project documentation Statistical analysis Software development Data exploration Collaborative nature Project investigation As the Operations Research Data Strategy consulting group is expanding, we seek a Contributor who is ready to flourish in a dynamic, customer centric, team environment.  Tomorrows travel industry revelations await a motivated candidate.  This candidate must have a strong desire to learn and possess demonstrated capabilities in scientific exploration through programming, scripting and database development.   In addition, proficiencies in business intelligence, statistics, data exploration, software development and customer consultation are a plus. The selected candidate will support consulting projects on site with clients. Duties include: Playing a contributor role in programming, scripting and database development.  This role requires up to 75% travel. Developing software for data management (access, load, manipulation, etc.) to elevate project effectiveness. Developing software for project automation and efficiency. Providing operational support and software testing assistance. Documenting and managing source code. Evaluating customer database requirements and collaborating with both internal and external teams in solution development. Evaluating customer opportunities through statistical analysis and data exploration to contribute to project design, prototyping and execution.. Documenting the design and implementation of underlying processes. Evaluating customer Business Intelligence requirements and collaborating with both internal and external teams in solution development (Tableau). Qualifications EDUCATION: Bachelors degree or higher in Computer Science or similar coupled with 3 years of experience required (Masters degree preferred). EXPERIENCE: The Contributor  Programmer and Database Developer will, ideally, possess a working knowledge of the airline, travel and/or closely aligned transportation/supply chain business segments. The following background, competencies, experience, academic and personal attributes represent general guidelines for what the position requires. Three plus (3+) years of programming and scripting in Java. Three plus (3+) years of experience in database/SQL scripting, diagramming, normalization, relational algebra, etc. Statistical analysis skills (forecasting, descriptive and predictive models). Data mining, data warehousing and big data skills are desirable (Hadoop, Pig, etc.). Solid knowledge of RDBMS (Oracle/Teradata/MySQL). Ability to develop numerical algorithms in a procedural language (Java required). Proficiency in Unix/Linux as well as scripting languages (Shell/Perl/Python). Visualization expertise for Business Intelligence is desirable. Ability to handle multiple projects and customer engagements simultaneously. Excellent oral and written communication skills. At Sabre, we are fortunate to have the resources of a large company paired with the culture of a startup. Our company culture includes casual work environments, employee amenities, flexible work arrangements, and exceptional learning opportunities. And, you will be surrounded by intelligent team members who you will be proud to call your peers. To learn more about the people and culture at Sabre, follow us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Sabre is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans, and disabled individuals. Job : Technical Product Development - Research Primary Location US-TX-Dallas Ft Worth - Southlake Organization : Sabre Schedule : Full-time Travel : Yes, 75 % of the Time Overtime Status : Exempt Stay Connected with Sabre Careers Reasonable Accommodation Sabre is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. Applicants applying for a Sabre position with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact Sabre's Employee Relations Department at employee.relations@sabre.com Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis. Affirmative Action Sabre is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and is committed to providing employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans and disabled individuals. Excellent communications and writing skills. Job Description: Scientific Research Corporation is on contract supporting the Air Force Digital Integration for Combat Engagement (DICE) task. The mission of DICE is to conduct digital integration in support of Air Force initiatives that enable and enhance National-Tactical Information-Operations with capabilities including integration, testing, training, and TTP development of C2&ISR common and tactical data link (CDL/TDL) systems. Scientific Research Corporation is an advanced information technology engineering company that provides innovative products and services to government and private industry, as well as independent institutions. At the core of our capabilities is a seasoned team of highly skilled engineers and scientists with multidisciplinary backgrounds. This team is challenged daily to provide cutting edge technology solutions to our clients. PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES : Develop and deliver Air Force programs focused on C2 systems in support of Link 16, AF-DCGS, AFNTI and 25 AF OC operations. Provide subject matter expertise to the AFDICE Program Management Office on a variety of technical aspects including; systems support, network accreditation and data analysis. Perform the Information System Security Operator (ISSO) role and implement the AFIC Risk Management Framework for 25 information systems. Scientific Research Corporation offers a competitive salary, an extensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages excellence. Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Scientific Research Corporation is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate in employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status. post_text: Digital Marketing Media Analyst job - Effective Spend - Austin, TX | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Digital Marketing Media Analyst Effective Spend - Austin, TX **Please include a cover letter with your application** Effective Spend is a digital marketing agency specializing in paid search marketing (SEM/PPC), search engine optimization (SEO) and social advertising. Were looking to hire a Digital Marketing Media Analyst that has a passion for all things digital and a true interest in becoming an expert-level digital marketer. The Digital Marketing Media Analyst will be responsible for creating, managing and reporting on advertising campaigns on Google, Bing, Facebook, LinkedIn and other online channels. We're looking for applicants with 1-2 years of professional experience in marketing, advertising or business. Experience in digital advertising such as search engine marketing is a plus, although not a requirement. We provide advanced training to our team members so you can learn industry best practices and master the technology tools and analytical skills that have helped us deliver superior digital marketing services to our clients. We are looking for candidates with the following qualities: Analytical - Will love geeking out with us over pivot tables and diving into spreadsheets of data to understand what drives performance. Creative - Appreciates that digital advertising campaigns are equal parts data analytics and good creative design. Can tap into both their right and left brain to come up with creative solutions. Scientifically-Minded - Fancies themselves a bit of a mad scientist. Enjoys testing new ideas, analyzing results, and experimenting with changes to find success. Growth Mentality - Embraces intellectual challenges and seizes opportunities to improve skills and seek out new knowledge. Passionate - Brings it. Hungry, ambitious, motivated and competitive, with a strong work ethic. Resourceful - Will Google literally anything. A true self-starter that enjoys learning new skills and researching new ideas on their own. Organized and Detail-Oriented - Obsessively makes to-do lists and can't stand to let things fall through the cracks because they genuinely care about their clients success. Key Responsibilities of the Digital Marketing Media Analyst: Campaign Creation - Build campaigns from the ground up, including account set-up, campaign planning/organization, competitive analysis, keyword research and ad copy writing. Campaign Management & Optimization - Manage campaigns to ensure that they continually improve over time. Test and optimize bids, keywords, text ads, image ads and landing pages to improve campaign performance. Reporting & Analysis - Master the art of performance analysis and client reporting through the daily use of tools such as Google Analytics, Kenshoo, Google Trends, AdWords and more. Compensation: Compensation is commensurate upon experience. This is a salaried position with medical, dental and vision benefits, paid time off and a 401k company matching program. Qualifications & Skill Requirements: 4-year Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, advertising, statistics, analytics or a related field. 1-2 years of professional marketing, advertising or business experience. Experience with Google AdWords and/or Bing Ads is a plus. Experience with paid advertising on Facebook and/or other Social networks is a plus. Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint. Strong mathematical and analytical skills. To Apply: Please send your resume and a cover letter explaining your interest and related qualifications. Your cover letter is your opportunity to show off your writing skills, highlight your relevant experience and prove your attention to detail. So, show us what youve got! The position offers opportunities to work on exciting topics including: (i) statistical methods and computational algorithms to interpret next-generation sequencing data; (ii) Gene regulation network, combine epigenomics, RNA-Seq, and other types of sequencing data to study gene regulation, with particular interest in stem cell, tissue development, and regenerative medicine. (iii) Cancer system biology, integrate genomics and other types of high throughput data to understand molecular mechanisms in cancer. Each successful candidate will have many opportunities to collaborate with fantastic wet-bench biologists and physician scientists in translational biomedical research. Salary and benefits will be highly competitive and commensurate with experience. Ideal candidates would be PhD with considerable experiences in genomic data analysis. Programming skills with at least one language such as C/C++, Python, R, or Perl is essential. The Methodist Hospital is frequently ranked as one of the best companies to work for by the FORTUNE Magazine, and is ranked as #1 best hospital in Texas by U.S. News. post_text: Research - Research Scientist\Bhalla Lab jobs in Houston at MD Anderson Cancer Center Career Opportunities Locations How to Apply Benefits MD Anderson Cancer Center Jobs > Houston Jobs > Research Jobs Careers Useful Links How to Apply Benefits Working at MD Anderson Working in Houston EEO and Accessibility Military Skills Translator REGIONAL CARE CENTERS LOCATIONS Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands STAY CONNECTED Facebook Twitter Where will you be when cancer is history? At MD Anderson Cancer Center, we bring together the expertise, the technology and the dedication that is moving us closer to our goal of Making Cancer History®. Advanced Search Search Jobs Job Opportunity Apply Now Research Scientist\Bhalla Lab Job Location: Houston, TX 1. The basic and translational research focus of this laboratory includes epigenetic mechanisms involving histone deacetylases, methyltransferases and demethylases, heat shock proteins and their cancer and leukemia-relevant client proteins, as well as transfection and functional analyses of genes regulating cell death/survival of human cancer cells. Experience in animal studies involving NOD/SCID or nude mice, and mouse imaging (xenogen and MRI) is highly desirable. Experience in molecular techniques involving plasmid DNA preparations and transfection, the analysis of gene expression including QPCR, microarrays, chromatin immunoprecipitation, evaluation of protein biochemistry with 2D gels, animal models, the yeast-two-hybrid system, confocal microscopy and tissue culture are also preferred. 2. Plans, organizes, coordinates, directs, and participates in scientific research projects. Performs quality research in relation to current research projects, and other identified needs. Interprets results of experiments, and makes necessary changes in procedures when needed. Compiles data sheets. 3. Organizes and performs routine procedures involving molecular biology and biochemistry of RNA processing. Requires experience in tissue culture, DNA & RNA preparation, PCR, DNA cloning, protein synthesis and electrophoresis. Responsible for providing laboratory services, tissue culture, processing research samples, and/or cataloging samples as required. Interacts with the principal investigators, postdoctoral fellows and other research personnel in communicating experimental design and results. 4. Requires knowledge of standard radiographic techniques. Dark room usage is essential as is use and proper handling of radioisotopes. Must be able to comply with all institutional safety policies including Universal Precautions and OSHA standards when handling toxic, hazardous, flammable, or potentially infectious or carcinogenic materials. This may require wearing common protective garments or equipment such as gloves, eye protection, face mask, gown or lab coat, etc. Additionally some procedures may require the use of a fume hood or biological safety cabinet. 5. Work with laboratory animals such as mice and rats and to perform interventional procedures such as tail vein injections and orthotopic implantations. Retrieves, maintains, and catalogs specimen stocks from outside reference laboratories. Assists in other laboratory activities as needed. 6. Performs and coordinates scientific experiments in a collaborative effort with other technicians, postdoctoral fellows, and staff members. Monitors work flow as it pertains to the need for supplies, equipment maintenance and stock solutions. Performs preventive maintenance on laboratory equipment. 7. Equipment monitoring on a daily basis verifying correct temperatures of freezers, refrigerators, incubators, etc. Equipment maintenance on a weekly basis includes cleaning and disinfecting refrigerators and incubators. Daily counter clean up and disinfection to ensure safety of the laboratory work place. Bags waste and transports to appropriate refuse area utilizing safety standards and guidelines. Maintains all safety precautions. 8. Assigns and reviews work of subordinates, determines specific goals or objectives to be attained, evaluates resulting research data, and revises techniques or approaches to work problems. Supervises the design, development, or adapting of equipment used in experiments or research to obtain desired results. Utilizes institutional and departmental databases to perform data retrieval for analysis. Designs retrieval templates for standard queries. Apply bio-statistical methods in analyzing clinical data such as pretreatment characteristics, response to treatment, toxicities, and mortality, etc. Conducts Library Work. Finds and copies journal articles as required. Reads and understands articles related to ongoing research. Maintains references in a manual filing system. Requires good reading and comprehension skills as well as diligence, patience and ability to carry several heavy books at a time. 9. Assemble samples, reagents, dry or wet ice, data and packaging materials; draft a cover letter, accurately and legibly fill out shipping labels; carry package to receiving area on ground floor prior to pick up. Keep accurate legible logs of outgoing and incoming packages. For incoming packages, ascertain contents, store at appropriate location, file information sheets and notify principal investigator. Update pertinent inventory logs. 10. Compiles, writes, and submits reports to superior. Plans and supervises the training of technicians and other laboratory personnel with respect to proper laboratory techniques, the use of laboratory equipment, and safety procedures. 11. Presents findings of data to PI and prepares scientific documents for publication. Presents findings of research projects to professional groups and prepares scientific documents for publication. 12. Performs related work as required. source:sonj EDUCATON Required: PhD in one of the natural sciences or related field or Medical degree EXPERIENCE Required: With PhD, no experience required. With Medical degree, two years of experience in experimental or scientific work. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105623 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications. Careers Careers Browse Open Jobs Search Open Jobs Edit Your Profile Job Details Job Number 088/16 Post Date 4/15/2016 Title Waypoint - Operations Research Analyst City Round Rock State TX Description Who you are: The Operations Research Analyst is responsible for carrying out the organizations data management and analytic needs and must have a background in complex research and analysis related to fiscal and operational activities. This person has experience acting as a research project lead, as well as serving as a key resource on research methods, statistics, corporate databases, and SAS programmingincluding intermediate-level SAS programming support to the corporation. Additionally, The Operations Research Analyst has a firm understanding of data analysis to identify and assess trends in behavior as well as creating reports to inform operational decisions. The perfect candidate is comfortable collaborating with other team members to update core products, develop reports to meet customer demand, maintain existing reports, and respond to ad hoc requests. Who we are: Waypoint Resource Group is part of the TG family of companies and provides accounts receivable management solutions across a variety of industries. Waypoint has the enthusiasm of a well-funded start-up under the stable umbrella of a company with a proven record of success. Waypoint draws from this experience to deliver results that improve revenue recovery and safeguard consumer relationships. We offer the right candidate the rare chance to drive growth and help shape our companys future. What youll do: 	Provide research and behavioral analysis of assigned portfolios, leveraging best practice statistical techniques and tools to identify trends. You will also regularly improve predictive and forecasting models that support operations and anticipate corporate opportunities and risk. 	Develop evaluation methodologies to assess the efficacy of various management interventions. 	Initiate, develop, maintain, and coordinate the creation of major reporting instruments that support internal and external customers. 	Facilitate the development and completion of research projects and ad hoc reporting requests, using intermediate SAS programming and other necessary skills. 	Maintain and execute data retention policies 	Help maintain the SAS analytics server; provide direction and oversight for data extractions, loads, and transformation processes. 	Perform other duties as required, including other research and analytical duties, e.g. market analysis, survey sampling, statistical modeling, competitive intelligence, etc. Qualifications: 	Required:  Bachelors degree in social sciences, mathematics, business, or other related area; graduate degree preferred. 	3-5 years experience in statistical modeling and analysis; 2-3 years experience focused primarily on financial products and services. Experience applying analytical methods in a work setting. 	Demonstrated expertise working with statistical and behavioral models within spreadsheet programs, including Microsoft Excel. Possess superior spreadsheet skills. 	1-2 years experience leading and managing research projects. 	Demonstrated ability to build and validate statistical models that anticipate business opportunities and risk. 	Demonstrated data management skills, including quality control, data transformation, file merges, and summarization of large data files. 	Intermediate SAS programming skills including expertise in Base SAS, reporting PROCs and SAS Macros. Expertise in SAS ODS is required. 	Hands-on experience accessing and transferring data between different data sources including DB2, SAS, Access, Excel, and similar data formats. Familiarity with SQL is preferred. 	Ability to successfully interact with a variety of roles and decision-making levels within and outside the company; strong writing and communications skills. 	Instinctive ability to decipher large amounts of data and requests and then distill into clear communications. 	Exceptional coordination and follow-thru skills; demonstrated ability to consistently meet deadlines and performance objectives. 	Strong sense of urgency, blended with high quality standards; experience working in high-performance cultures is very beneficial. 	Able to maintain multiple projects simultaneously; working both as part of a team and individually. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or sexual orientation. We are also an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and protected
 veterans. Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here . Apply On-line Send This Job to a Friend Contact Webmaster | Internet Policies | Public Information | PRIVACY POLICY © 2016 Texas Guaranteed Student Loan Corporation

Date: Apr 1, 2016 Location: Austin, TX, US Job ID: 49688 Company: Micron Req ID: 49688 Req Id: 49688 The convergence of storage and memory technologies has only just begun, and in the coming years it will drive the largest changes to computing system architectures in decades. Todays OS storage stack cannot fully exploit the performance and cost benefits of flash-based Solid State Drives (SSDs) because flash memory works nothing like traditional hard disks. A re-thinking and re-architecture of storage application and block I/O stacks has begun, but we are early in the process. The Micron Storage Solutions Center in Austin, Texas, is looking for a few serious software engineers and computer scientists to help define the future of storage software. If you thrive on developing kernel and higher level solutions to flash and memory related storage, we want to talk to you. Initiative, passion and leadership skills are extremely valued in your day to day work. Micron has long been a leader in DRAM and Flash memory, and we are at the forefront of emerging NVM technologies such as our recently announced 3D XPoint. As such we are well-positioned to lead the software revolution that will allow customers to experience the full benefit of these exciting memory technologies. Roles and Responsibilities - Design, prototype and develop Linux-based storage systems software - Collaborate with firmware and hardware teams developing advanced memory technologies and controllers - Analyze and improve storage software performance, reliability and availability - Develop frameworks and tools to enable high-coverage testing Education and Experience - Bachelor of Engineering plus 8 years or Master of Engineering and 6 years of experience in computer science, computer engineering or a related discipline - Minimum 10  20 years of industry experience Knowledge and Skills - Advanced knowledge of systems architecture and strong experience in C programming, systems architecture and algorithms - Strong in multithreading, concurrency control, lock-free synchronization, and transaction theory - Kernel level coding/debugging and problem solving experience - Working knowledge of fundamental Computer Science algorithms and data structures - Excellent oral and written communication skills Additional Qualifications Leading candidates will also possess one or more of these additional qualifications - Development experience with file systems, block storage systems, RAID SW/FW or other software systems that provide data persistence such as databases and key-value stores Knowledge of NAND characteristics and flash translation layer (FTL) design - Linux upstream code submissions a big plus We recruit, hire, train, promote, discipline and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person's race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, pregnancy, veterans status, or other classifications protected under law. Sr. Statistician Tracking Code 6235-702 Job Description Summary of Responsibilities: Statistician III are responsible for supervising the development and maintenance of sophisticated empirical models - including credit scoring models - for a nonprime auto lender. The position is highly quantitative in nature and requires an individual capable of taking a hands on approach to data analysis.  This position is furthermore responsible for summarizing and reporting information to a variety of internal and external clients. Senior Statisticians are expected to interact with many other departments in the interest of achieving the overall company objectives. Essential Functions: Supervises the development of complex mathematical models  including credit origination and customer behavior scorecards - which directly support critical decision making processes and the companys overall understanding of our business, the markets within which we operate, and our customers. Develops the underlying assumptions, theory, empirical evidence, and conceptual soundness of statistical and mathematical models. Applies statistical techniques to analyze trends and uncover risks and opportunities relative to portfolio management and originations. Uses internal and external data sources to create robust model development datasets. Ensures modeling projects are conducted in accordance with established company policies and generally-accepted mathematical modeling practices. Identifies modeling needs and communicates them to the Director of Statistical Analysis. Periodically assesses department procedures for accuracy and completeness. Utilizes data mining and statistical techniques to develop analytic insights, sound hypotheses, and informed recommendations. Encapsulates analytic findings into executive-level summary documents to support senior management decision-making. Liaisons with IT and other internal teams to define requirements and ensure the timely and accurate delivery of data elements required for analyticprojects. Provides requisite information in support of independent model validation activities. Actively participates in the professional development of junior-level statisticians. Develops a thorough understanding of the firms operations and business practices. Other Functions: Special projects as requested. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Skills Requirements: Master's degree in Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, or a related quantitative discipline required.  PhD preferred. Minimum five (5) to seven (7) years experience in an analytics role for a financial services company (or companies), preferably indirect nonprime auto financial services. Prior experience developing credit scoring models. Prior experience with logistic regression models, segmentation and variable reduction techniques, hypothesis testing, neural networks, design of experiments, ANOVA, decision trees, and linear regression. Prior experience working with credit bureau data. Prior experience using SAS, particularly SAS base, SAS/STAT, PROC SQL, and SAS Macro programming. Additional knowledge of R preferred. Demonstrated ability to use SQL and SAS to extract data from multiple data sources. Demonstrated ability to merge, concatenate, clean, and prepare extremely large datasets for statistical analysis and mathematical model development. Demonstrated ability to create complex pivot tables in MS Excel. Ability to effectively explain advanced mathematical concepts, techniques, and analyses to a business audience. Ability to translate analysis into a clear business plan. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to manage a team of operational      direct reports. Ability to delegate and co-ordinate multiple tasks related to the development and monitoring of statistical models. Ability to maintain confidentiality. Working Conditions: Extended working hours may be required as dictated by management and business needs. Travel to multiple facilities may be required. May be required to sit and review information on a computer screen for long periods of time. May require repetitive motions of the hands and wrist related to writing and typing at an electronic keyboard. Corporate / satellite office role. Employers Rights: This job description does not list all the duties of the job.  You may be asked by your supervisors or managers to perform other duties.  You will be evaluated in part based upon your performance of the tasks listed in this job description. The employer has the right to revise this job description at any time.  This job description is not a contract for employment, and either you or the employer may terminate employment at any time, for any reason. title: Research Admin Analyst
summary: The ideal candidate will have a degree in a basic scientific field with two years of basic scientific research experience....
post_text: Managerial\Professional - Research Admin Analyst jobs in Houston at MD Anderson Cancer Center Career Opportunities Locations How to Apply Benefits MD Anderson Cancer Center Jobs > Houston Jobs > Managerial\Professional Jobs Careers Useful Links How to Apply Benefits Working at MD Anderson Working in Houston EEO and Accessibility Military Skills Translator REGIONAL CARE CENTERS LOCATIONS Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands STAY CONNECTED Facebook Twitter Where will you be when cancer is history? At MD Anderson Cancer Center, we bring together the expertise, the technology and the dedication that is moving us closer to our goal of Making Cancer History®. Advanced Search Search Jobs Job Opportunity Apply Now Research Admin Analyst Job Location: Houston, TX The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston ranks as one of the worlds most respected centers focused on cancer patient care, research, education and prevention. It is one of only 40 comprehensive cancer centers designated by the National Cancer Institute. Since U.S. News & World Report began its annual Best Hospitals survey 25 years ago, MD Anderson has ranked No. 1 or No. 2 in cancer care every year. The ideal candidate will have a degree in a basic scientific field with two years of basic scientific research experience. The primary responsibilities of the position is to review the scientific scope grant proposals for congruency with the corresponding work approved by MD Anderson compliance committees (e.g. IBC, IACUC, IRB, etc.). Review for compliance of research funding applications. Performs comparative review of grants and sponsored agreements with IACUC, IBC, Stem Cell and Radiation protocols. Advises faculty and supporting staff of compliance status and facilitates correcting any outstanding issues in order to complete the compliance review. Institutional Resource Serves as an institutional resource by answering calls to the ORA help-line, answers questions to assist in finalizing grant compliance reviews. Refers questions and issues to responsible personnel when appropriate in a timely manner. In addition, maintain monthly metrics for grant congruency reviews. Assist in other areas as requested. Training Provides training classes for faculty and staff regarding animal and biosafety materials on grant compliance reviews EDUCATION: Required: Bachelor's degree in Business, Public Administration or related field. EXPERIENCE: Required: Two years of business experience. May substitute required education degree with additional years of equivalent experience on a one to one basis. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105434 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications. title: Senior Consultant, Advanced Analytics
summary: Expertise in SQL / R/ SAS & advanced analytics / Statistics Techniques such as general linear model, ANOVA, decision trees, linear regression, Bayesian etc....
post_text:
Senior Consultant, Advanced Analytics - Fractal Analytics - Job Board View Our Website View All Jobs Thanks for visiting our Job Board. Please review our open positions and Apply / Refer talent to the positions that closely matches your interest and qualifications. Senior Consultant, Advanced Analytics San Antonio, TX Full Time USA Experienced Share Summary: Position of Senior Consultant will be expected to deliver an analytics engagement at client location independently. This will include problem solving, hypothesis testing, advanced analysis, creating models & solutions and compelling visualizations to make the solutions scalable and easily understood. Senior consultant will collaboratively work along with senior engagement managers & lead a team of analysts and data scientists across the globe. Senior consultant will interact with the client directly and expected to build a strong Fractal brand. Position expectations in detail: Solve business problems & develop business solution: Use problem solving methodologies to propose creative solutions to solve business problem. Recommend design and develop state-of-the-art data driven analysis using statistical & advanced analytics methodologies to solve business problems. Develop models & recommend insights. Form hypothesis and run experiments to gain empirical insights and validate hypothesis. Identify and eliminate possible obstacles and identify alternative creative solution. Project management: Lead at least one client engagement independently. Execute end to end client engagements. Ensure regular client updates & meetings, stakeholder management, any failure or risk analysis of the project, data sources, tracking execution & success metrics is done effectively & efficiently. Client relationship management: Build deep client relationship, network & be a thought partner. Anticipate business problems & deliver par excellence. Sales support & account growth: Actively focus on opportunities to grow the client along with the senior engagement manager. Support the sales team as required for RFPs and regular sales pitches Firm building: Contribute to firm growth by participating and conducting training sessions. Also, participate in other activities which make Fractal an employer of choice. Coaching & grooming: Coach & groom the team on gaining knowledge & skills on first principles of analytics techniques, problem solving, project management, client relationship management & team work skills. Conduct regular one to one reviews with team members. Skills & Qualifications: Knowledge of data conversion strategy, capturing data, creating source to target definitions for ETL / data flow process, data quality and data base management Expertise in SQL / R/ SAS & advanced analytics / Statistics Techniques such as general linear model, ANOVA, decision trees, linear regression, Bayesian etc. Knowledge of any one visualization tools such as Tableau, Spotfire or equivalent Problem solving, Project management and communication skills & Creative thinking High learning orientation & agility Over all experience of 5-6 yrs with at least 3 - 4 years of hands on experience in running data analytics projects Experience in processing and synthesising large data sets Ability to think on his/her feet and engage with both the business and analytical community Ability to adapt with ambiguity in cross functional environment Good to have: Experience Big data tools such as Hadoop, Hive, Impala and Python Graduate in Computer Science, Mathematics, Operational research, Information Science, Engineering, Statistics. (MS or MBA preferred) Certification in any R, SAS,SQL, Visualisation Tools, Machine Learning, Bayesian and/or Regression etc. (Preferred) Read More Apply for Position Apply for this position Required * Apply with LinkedIn Apply with Indeed Apply with Indeed First Name * Last Name * Email Address * Address Phone * Resume * Attach resume or Paste resume Attach resume ( .pdf, .doc, .docx ) or Paste resume Paste your resume here or Attach resume file Cover Letter How did you hear about this opportunity? * -- No answer -- Online Job Board Recruiting Agency Social Media Alumni Word of Mouth / Friend Campus Recruiting Search Engine Employee Referral If you were referred by an Employee, please mention the full name of the Fractal employee?
