title: Natural Scientist Assistant
summary: Previous employment and any additional experience will be subject to verification prior to employment processing....
post_text: Applicant Home Job Description Job ID: 3291 Job Title: Natural Scientist Assistant Business Unit: Park and Recreation Department: Nature Ctr and Refuge Location: Fort Worth - North Full/Part Time: Part-Time Regular/Temporary: Temporary Shift: Not Applicable Hours (weekly): 40.00 Salary Range: To: 10.50 10.500 Per Hour Return to Previous Page Apply Online Only The City of Fort Worth currently stands as the 16th largest city in the U.S. and the fastest growing among large cities.  Fort Worth has received multiple accolades, including number one Downtown (Livability), top five commercial real estate markets (Urban Land Institute), and the second-best City in the nation for Job Seekers (Forbes).  Our employees serve the needs of over 800,000 City residents.  We are seeking individuals that reflect our values of exceptional customer service, mutual respect, embracing the diversity of our communities, continuous improvement, ethical behavior, and accountability. CLOSING DATE:  OPEN UNTIL FILLED NOTE:  PLEASE ATTACHED A COPY OF YOUR COLLEGE TRANSCRIPT WITH APPLICATION. These positions are funded for up to 16 weeks working 40 hours per week. Exact start and end dates are negotiable. Interns are expected to begin work in mid-May to early June 2016 and end in mid-August to early September 2016.  These are seasonal positions; will work up to 40 hours with no benefits. Must be able to work weekends are required. Job Description The City of Fort Worth Park and Recreation Department is recruiting for several part time Natural Scientist Assistants to work at its Nature Center & Refuge location.  The Fort Worth Nature Center & Refuge program provides training and experience in the coordination, implementation, and operation of a natural area facility by assisting with an array of natural resource management and research activities and/or providing natural science and conservation oriented recreational and educational activities to the public. We are hiring for two summer positions on the resource management side and one summer position on the natural history education side. Duties will include, but are not limited to: All positions: Performs facility opening and closing duties; patrols area to ensure safety procedures are followed. Assists Natural Scientist with volunteers Performs related duties and responsibilities as required. Adheres to assigned work schedule as outlined in the Department and City attendance policies and procedures; ensures all behaviors comply with the Citys Personnel Rules and Regulations. When assigned to the Refuge Service Center: Performs entry-level staff work in the conservation, development, maintenance, and protection of wildlife and plant populations. Assists with the development and implementation of wildlife habitat enhancement projects and biological inventories. Assists with the development, implementation and analysis of natural resources research projects. When assigned to the Hardwicke Interpretive Center: Assists with the development and implementation of educational and recreational programs centering on natural science topics including school programs, educator workshops, summer youth camps, public outreach programs, seminars, and nature hikes; develops and maintains exhibits and conducts facility tours. Assists with the care and maintenance of captive education animals. Reviews animal care logs to ensure proper care. Performs and reports water quality measurements including the inventory and maintenance of chemicals used in the testing and their associated safety data sheets. Organizes and leads guided canoe and kayak programs and teach water safety classes. QUALIFICATIONS Minimum: H.S. diploma/GED and a minimum of 16 credit hours from an accredited college or university with major course work in a natural or physical science, including biology, geology, botany, range management, environmental science, forestry, or a related field or informal organized training (such as the Texas Master Naturalist program) and no direct experience is required. Other Requirements Possession of, or the ability to obtain a valid Texas driver's license within six months of hire. The successful candidates will be required to perform extensive public contact, possess excellent written and verbal communication skills and demonstrate a willingness to work with live animal exhibits. Job Preferences Preference will also be given to candidates who are proficient in the use of Microsoft  Office (Word, PowerPoint and Excel. Preferred candidates with experience and training in customer service techniques. Conditions of Employment WORKING CONDITIONS Environmental Conditions: Inside and outside working conditions; exposure to varying weather conditions; dangerous animal species and pesticides; moving objects and vehicles; movement on uneven terrain. Physical Conditions: Essential and marginal functions may require maintaining physical condition necessary for sitting, standing, or walking for an extended period of time; climbing using both arms and legs; adequate speech, vision, and eyesight required; general manual dexterity; must be able to operate assigned vehicles and equipment. Persons selected for employment into any position must pass a drug test. Some positions may require passing an alcohol test. Previous employment and any additional experience will be subject to verification prior to employment processing. A drivers license and driving record check will be conducted if driving is a job requirement. A post offer employment medical examination may be conducted prior to job placement. You will be paid by direct deposit only. The City of Fort Worth affords equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. This policy is practiced in all personnel actions and conditions of employment, including but not limited to: recruitment, employment, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, termination, layoff, discipline, compensation, and benefits. title: Research Analyst
summary: Serves as a subject matter expert focusing on overall supply chain capabilities, Supplier/Industry Intelligence, emerging trends and best practices....
post_text: GSD Research Analyst I Job in San Antonio, TX at USAA Home Why Work at USAA? Military and Spouses University Recruiting Search Jobs Research Analyst Job Job Number: 26901 Location: San Antonio , TX Date Posted: 4-5-2016 Job Title: GSD Research Analyst I Apply We are currently seeking talented GSD Research Analyst I for our San Antonio, TX facility. PURPOSE OF JOB Designs and analyzes competitive activities, products and industry trends for short and long term business goals and results. Serves as a subject matter expert focusing on overall supply chain capabilities, Supplier/Industry Intelligence, emerging trends and best practices. Understands business strategy and identifies and communicates trends, competitive forces, and potential 3rd party solutions. Provides cross functional analysis and research pertaining to sourcing, supplier competition, risk mitigation and due diligence on initiatives across a broad range of topical areas. Translates findings into business recommendations that proactively drive operational, innovative and strategic business decisions. May present/communicate findings to various levels of leadership. JOB DUTIES Researches and identifies industry best practices and trends. Acquires, maintains and applies knowledge of the business and knowledge of supplier/competitive/industry intelligence research. Supports GSD and the enterprise with ongoing and ad-hoc analysis and research in support of existing and potential 3rd party relationships. Able to synthesize information from various sources and identify opportunities. Translates business requirements to findings and recommendations and interacts across GSD to interpret complex research data and findings into potential solutions. Supports the creation of 3rd party strategies pertaining to CoSA-specific initiatives. Advises key GSD stakeholders on industry best practices through research and analysis of internal/external business data and competitive information. Minimum Requirements 4+ years of general business experience. Working knowledge of supply chain process and contracting methods. Ability to synthesize complex information. Strong oral and written communication skills. Bachelor's degree in Business or related field required or 4 years of related work experience may be used in lieu of a degree. Preferred Masters degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Finance, Economics or Accounting. 4+ years of experience using relevant research tools such as Gartner, Everest, LexisNexis, etc. in support of 3rd party research. 4+ years experience in competitive analysis/intelligence or related research fields. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. Share our pride. Join our mission. As a Fortune 200 financial services organization, USAA is on a mission - to facilitate the financial security of our members, the men and women of the U.S. military and their families worldwide by providing a full range of financial services and products. Headquartered on a showcase campus in San Antonio, TX, USAA attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our 27,000 employees. They are the heart and soul of our member-service culture. Recently Ranked #11 in Forbes list of 500 of the "Best Employers in the U.S. in 2015" , we are proud to receive consistently outstanding awards and ratings for member service, employee well-being and financial strength. Everything that happens at USAA is based on our core values: Service, Loyalty, Honesty, and Integrity. These are the foundations of how we do business with our members, as well as how we treat each other. At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position. Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre-employment background and drug screen. USAA is an EEO/AA Employer - applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law. Apply Big Data Developer Please enter your email to start the apply process Email: Big Data Developer Cook Systems US-TX-Irving Posted: 4/9/2016 Email Job Print Job Report This Job Apply Job Description The primary function of this position is for the development of sophisticated solutions for various initiatives and projects the IT applications department will undertake using Big Data technologies and related platforms. The IT Big Data Senior Developer will undertake technical leadership roles in ownership of applications, services framework or components assigned to them. The Big Data Developer will be expected to architect solutions in AWS based cloud deployments of big data platforms. This position will be expected to provide technical leadership and mentoring, working with a team of in-house and outsourced Big Data Developers in design, development, deployment and systems integration activities. In addition, the Big Data Senior Developer is expected to do hands on coding and develop/implement design patterns and other best practices. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Provide leadership for software application and module design and coding to software development teams developing complex software and services using Big Data platforms. Leadership may also extend to applications using advanced analytic tools and technologies. Provide leadership, mentoring and guidance to junior members of the Big Data development team. Manage and deliver the necessary solutions, software modules and code for assigned projects. Improves Big Data solutions by tracking emerging technologies Architect solutions in AWS based cloud based deployments of big data platforms MINIMUM SKILL REQUIREMENTS: Bachelors or Masters degree in computer science.           Patients Giving Careers 1 2 3 4 1 2 3 4 Home > Search Jobs JOB DETAILS Back Refer This Job Send Link Apply RESEARCH ASSOCIATE I-Medicine Job Ref: 23040 Talent Area: Laboratory Location: Houston Methodist Research Institute Houston, TX 77030 Area/Department: Medicine-Lung Employment Type: Regular Job Type: Full-Time Organization: Houston Methodist Work Shift: DAY Work Week: M - F Company Profile Houston Methodist Research Institute was formed in 2004 to rapidly and efficiently translate discoveries made in the laboratory and the clinic into new diagnostics, therapies and treatments.  The research institute was created to provide the infrastructure and support for these endeavors, and to house the technology and resources needed to make innovative breakthroughs in important areas of human disease.  A 440,000 square foot building dedicated to research, the research institute houses over 1,150 staff members, 270 principal investigators and has more than 600 ongoing clinical trials. Job Summary To provide advanced technical research skills and establish test methods and procedures under the direction of Department Chairperson or Research Scientist (Faculty). DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Directs Laboratory Research Plans, directs and coordinates laboratory research projects (Low to medium complexity) Determines specific goals objectives to be attained Assigns and reviews work of research project staff. Oversees team of Research Assistants and Post Docs 0 to 2 Establishes and maintains quality control of project operations.  2. Grant Writing and Publications Plans research (Low to medium complexity) Analyses data (Low to medium complexity) Reviews scientific literature. 3. General Laboratory Duties Defines problems and possible solutions (Low to medium complexity) Adheres to internal controls established for Department. 4. Safety and Regulatory Compliance Writes and maintains regulatory and safety committee applications/protocols Adheres to and assists with customizing of TMH & TMHRI Safety Procedures for Laboratory. 5. Demonstrates the componets of the ICARE values statement. 6. Follows safety rules while on the job. Reports accidents promptly and corrects safety hazards. Compiles all hospital required and job-related in-services and applies the information needed. 7. Performs other duties as assigned EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Master of Science (MS) with 5+ years experience Or Terminal Degree with 5 years experience, 2 + years preferred. SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED 1. Strong analytical and interpersonal skills. 2.  Ability to work under pressure and balance many competing priorities. 3.  Proficient in spreadsheet, word-processing, and presentation software. 4. Demonstrates effective communication skills. 5. Maintains a positive and supportive attitude and demeanor. 6.  Professional handling of exposure to confidential/sensitive information. Equal Employment Opportunity Houston Methodist is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Equal employment opportunity is a sound and just concept to which Houston Methodist is firmly bound. Houston Methodist will not engage in discrimination against or harassment of any person employed or seeking employment with Houston Methodist on the basis of  race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or other characteristics protected by law. title: Research Admin/analyst
summary: Assist with the budget for clinical trials task area, accounts payable and receivable, to include contracts, protocol costs and extramural funding....
post_text: Research Admin/analyst job - Leading Edge Enterprises - San Antonio, TX | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Research Admin/analyst Leading Edge Enterprises - San Antonio, TX Tasks-The following are provided to demonstrate the task environment in which the services will be delivered. The following are not directives on how the services are to be provided but what traditionally has been required to successfully support the requirement. Task Area Research Administrative Support Tasks Provide administrative support at the task area program level to coordinate work flow between the task area manager, multiple collaborating task areas, principal investigators, and additional support services. Assist with the budget for clinical trials task area, accounts payable and receivable, to include contracts, protocol costs and extramural funding. Assist with tracking protocol expenditures, supply requests and shipping requirements to and from theater. Assist with within the programs to include the review and distribution of project tasks; confer with project managers to determine progress of work, materials needed, expected completion dates; and compile reports on status of work. Assist with preparation of packages for procurement of equipment, services and supplies. Assist to maintain contracts for collaboration and facilitate in gathering statements of work (SOWs) for Cooperative Research and Development Agreement (CRADAs), performance work statements (PWS) for personnel, Material Transfer Agreements (MTA) for samples and maintain current protocol versions for both institutions. Institute contract commencement with outside vendors. Assist with paperwork to maintain protocol currency, utilizing Regulatory as an advisor, to complete initial submission, addendums, continuing reviews, internal audits, and comply with the Institutional Review Board (IRB) regulations and standards. Assist to ensure the scientific theory behind all research procedures performed is documented. Assist with reference collection, organizing and editing research reports, posters and manuscripts. Assist to calculate results of assays and evaluate validity of data collected. Assist to maintain research records, including detailed laboratory notebooks and experimental data. Assist with performing laboratory procedures and analyses on research subjects, as well as from other sources including enzyme linked immunoassays (ELISAs), molecular biology, and cell culture. Assist with preparing solutions, drugs and reagents for experiments and maintains safe working environment in accordance with established laboratory procedures. Assist to inform summer interns of laboratory procedures and techniques. Qualifications Masters in biological sciences preferred but a Bachelors degree will be accepted with experience in lieu of higher education; At least 3 years experience in administrative work At least 2 years experience in data collection and reporting At least 2 years experience in a laboratory setting Requires experience in administrative concepts and practices including record management and the basics of budgetary principles. Requires experience with spreadsheet, word processing, graphics, database management, communication packages. title: Research Analyst-Senior
summary: Serves as a subject matter expert focusing on overall supply chain capabilities, Supplier/Industry Intelligence, emerging trends and best practices....
post_text: GSD Senior Research Analyst  Job in San Antonio, TX at USAA Home Why Work at USAA? Military and Spouses University Recruiting Search Jobs Research Analyst-Senior Job Job Number: 27013 Location: San Antonio , TX Date Posted: 4-5-2016 Job Title: GSD Senior Research Analyst Apply We are currently seeking talented GSD Senior Research Analyst for our San Antonio, TX facility. PURPOSE OF JOB Designs and analyzes competitive activities, products and industry trends for short and long term business goals and results. Serves as a subject matter expert focusing on overall supply chain capabilities, Supplier/Industry Intelligence, emerging trends and best practices. Understands business strategy and identifies and communicates trends, competitive forces, and potential 3rd party solutions. Provides cross functional analysis and research pertaining to sourcing, supplier competition, risk mitigation and due diligence on initiatives across a broad range of topical areas. Translates findings into business recommendations that proactively drive operational, innovative and strategic business decisions. May present/communicate findings to various levels of leadership. JOB DUTIES Researches and identifies industry best practices and trends. Acquires, maintains and applies knowledge of the business and advanced knowledge of supplier/competitive/industry intelligence research. Supports GSD and the enterprise with ongoing and ad-hoc analysis and research in support of existing and potential 3rd party relationships. Able to synthesize information from various sources and proactively identify opportunities. Translates business requirements to findings and recommendations and interacts across GSD and Enterprise to interpret complex research data and findings into potential solutions. Supports the creation of 3rd party strategies pertaining to enterprise-wide and CoSA-specific initiatives. Advises key GSD stakeholders on industry best practices through research and analysis of internal/external business data and competitive information Minimum Requirements Experience in conducting market or competitive intelligence using current tools and resources. Working knowledge of supply chain process and contracting methods. Demonstrated experience supporting cross functional project efforts. Ability to synthesize complex information. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Bachelor's degree in Business or related field required or 4 years of related work experience may be used in lieu of a degree. Preferred Masters degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Finance, Economics or Accounting. 4+ years of experience using relevant research tools such as Gartner, Everest, LexisNexis, etc. in support of 3rd party research. 6+ years experience in competitive analysis/intelligence or related research fields. Ability to influence others. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. Share our pride. Join our mission. As a Fortune 200 financial services organization, USAA is on a mission - to facilitate the financial security of our members, the men and women of the U.S. military and their families worldwide by providing a full range of financial services and products. Headquartered on a showcase campus in San Antonio, TX, USAA attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our 27,000 employees. They are the heart and soul of our member-service culture. Recently Ranked #11 in Forbes list of 500 of the "Best Employers in the U.S. in 2015" , we are proud to receive consistently outstanding awards and ratings for member service, employee well-being and financial strength. Everything that happens at USAA is based on our core values: Service, Loyalty, Honesty, and Integrity. These are the foundations of how we do business with our members, as well as how we treat each other. At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position. Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre-employment background and drug screen. USAA is an EEO/AA Employer - applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law. post_text: Senior Consulting Analyst - Machine Learning job - BRESA - Dallas, TX | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Senior Consulting Analyst - Machine Learning BRESA - Dallas, TX $100,000 a year Industry: Business Process Outsourcing Position: Senior Consulting Analyst Employment Type: Full Time Location: Dallas, TX (or remotely) Salary: $100,000 OVERVIEW: Searching for a Senior Consulting Analyst to mentor, develop and motivate a high-performance group of consulting professionals. The Senior Consulting Analyst will play a leading role in the success of the Cognitive Sciences Centre of Excellence. This position requires the candidate to be able to think strategically and work with a team of junior consulting analysts on customer facing engagements as well as focus on internal directives. The right candidate will also have exposure to Machine Learning and be able to talk technical. CANDIDATE MUST: - Understand the value proposition for the client and express this in a non-technical manner. Must be able to discuss various business cases with client utilizing excellent communication skills, not restricted by an overpowering "technical" talk. - Be a self starter, comfortable working independently and within groups as small as 3 - 5. RESPONSIBILITIES: Work with and mentor junior consultants Advise, assist and educate Solutions and Delivery Teams on all aspects of machine learning Be able to independently lead the development of proof-of-concepts, live demo systems and other software artifacts for consultative engagements as required Assist in and potentially lead customer data gathering and analysis workshops Document findings from workshops into a standard delivery package Create white papers and other collateral for the practice Create internal and external reports as required Strengthen relationships: Establish and maintain communication with clients and/or team members; understand needs and meet expectations Define organizations reputation: Take responsibility for deliverable quality to guarantee customer satisfaction and meet internal objectives Keep management updated: Relay important information in the form of timely and accurate reports Ensure the success of the consulting aspect of the Centre of Excellence EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: Masters degree or relevant work experience; Ph.D. in Machine Learning preferable EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: 8-10 years of experience in customer facing consulting Customer facing presentation and data gathering/analysis skills Experience creating and interpreting requirement specifications Experience using machine Learning frameworks (e.g. Matlab, R, Spark, Rapid Miner, WEKA) either as a consultant or as a developer Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills including Project and Visio TO SUCCEED IN THIS POSITION, YOU MUST: Have the ability to keep abreast of changes in the machine learning domain Have the ability to quickly learn and put into practice new technologies and concepts Have experience mentoring junior team members Have strong verbal and written communication skills; be able to communicate in a clear, constructive, and professional manner Be able to efficiently manage time and keep track of multiple schedules, meetings, and initiatives Be pro-active in developing trust and professional rapport with employees and team members; able to be a team-player Be able to effectively work with a team working remotely (WAH) Ability to travel to customer and company locations 25-30% Job Type: Full-time Salary: $100,000.00 /year Required experience: Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence and client facing consulting for major firms.: 8 years Required education: Bachelor's 5 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to BRESA. summary: The Scientific Financial Analyst II coordinates billing activities with intra- and extramural scientists and administration, including commercial sponsors;...
post_text:
Job Detail Home About Texas Biomed Texas Biomed Research Research Collaborations Milestone Achievements Extraordinary Resources About our Founder Texas Biomed Video Leadership Animals in Research Employment Find Texas Biomed News + Press News + Press Releases Progress Annual Report Scientific Report Media Photo Library Departments + Faculty Genetics Virology & Immunology Conferences & Workshops Faculty Seminar Series Southwest National Primate Research Center Support Texas Biomed Make a Contribution Request Information Planned Giving Circles of Support The Forum Founder's Council The Argyle Capital & Endowment Giving Memorial & Honor Giving Text Size: + /  About Texas Biomedical Research Resources Facility Financial Statements & Compliance Research Collaborations Milestone Achievements Infectious Disease Heart disease Neonatal Disease Extraordinary Resources Nonhuman Primates Biosafety Level 4 Laboratory Genomics Computing Resources About our Founder Institute's Origin A Life Cut Tragically Short Texas Biomed Video Leadership Board of Trustees Past Leaders Animals in Research Employment Job Opportunities Equal Employment Opportunity Policy of Affirmative Action Driving Standards Employee Benefits Onboarding Process Find Texas Biomed Human Resources Office Texas Biomedical Research Institute 7620 NW Loop 410 at Military Drive West San Antonio, Texas 78227 210-258-9400 Texas Biomed is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer Job Opportunities at Texas Biomed Administration /  Friday Apr 08, 2016 16-019 Scientific Financial Analyst Location: San Antonio, TX Job Duties The Scientific Financial Analyst II coordinates billing activities with intra- and extramural scientists and administration, including commercial sponsors; tracks financial status of scientific work on projects; prepares financial and personnel management paperwork for Office of Sponsored Programs and Accounting; approves purchase requisitions; analyzes income and expense trends and charging practices; recommends and implements process improvements.
Duties and responsibilities:
Reports financial data for projects, departmental funds, income accounts, startup funds, and fixed fees to investigators, department chair, and others (Accounting/Finance, investigator staff, OSP) monthly or more often as needed.
Tracks percent effort and hours on accounts, ensuring appropriated levels of support for each project and as required by grant/contract requirements.
Creates personnel datasheets and timesheets for department personnel.
Notifies investigators of department, grant, and contract end dates, funds remaining, projected expenditures, and extension requirements.
Builds and manages complex financial spreadsheets used to maintain financial records of the department, to prepare financial reports, to track effort and hours, and to predict future spending.
Creates monthly fixed fees transfer based on expenses and award terms then attaches to a dataloader for easy Oracle processing.
Creates or approves internal invoices for department procedure fees based on award terms then attaches the IDTs to a dataloader for easy Oracle processing.
Creates special reports and projections for investigators to determine future funding needs and to advise on availability of funds for new hires.
Develops and implements complex billing methodology for invoicing and tracking fixed fees and department procedure fees, including laboratory procedures on complex federal and commercial contracts awards.
Works with investigators to provide information necessary for external award billing to accounting and helps resolve issues and collection problems.
Reviews financial data to locate and correct any misclassifications of expenses, including expense charges, salary, and supplies.
Works closely with accounting staff to ensure that grants and contracts are charged correctly for salaries and other costs, and that grant and contract accounts are inactivated or closed out in a timely fashion.
Approves all purchase requisitions to ensure funds availability, allowability, and compliance with conditions of awards and administrative policies.
Prepares annual Institute budgets for the department.
Prepares required monthly financial reports submitted to sources by investigators.
Tracks and provides accounting monthly and fiscal year effort reports including hours worked submitted to sources and relevant government agencies.
Assists in preparation of budgets from institutional sources and grants and contracts that finance operations.
Helps departmental employees understand external regulations and internal policies and procedures to ensure iProcurement transactions are properly charged.
Performs other duties as assigned. Education Required: Bachelors degree in accounting, economics, finance or a related field. Experience/Skills Required: Two years of accounting or financial record management or budget management experience. Ability to build and manage computer databases and spreadsheets. Preferred:  Four or more years of job-related experience. Potential Hazards Will sit at a computer for long periods of time. Other This is a full-time salaried (exempt) position.  Texas Biomed business hours are Monday through Friday  8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  Texas Biomed is committed to a drug-free workplace.  Pre-employment drug screen is required.
Application packets are accepted electronically or in hard copy. Completed application packet is a requirement for all positions.  Incomplete applications will not be accepted. Position Information Application Types Accepted Application Requisition Number 161937 Job Category Administrative Job Title Prospect Research Analyst Status Full-Time # Hours Per Week 40 Shift/Work Schedule M-F School/Unit University Administration Department Office of Development Job Location Texas Medical Center Job Summary Where Creating the Best Hope for a Healthier Future Begins... In this position, you will be responsible for identifying, researching, and analyzing prospects in support of University fundraising initiatives. Additional Summary Specific to Job - Participates in portfolio reviews with development leadership and/or development officers to develop prospect identification, cultivation, solicitation and overall fundraising strategies. - Provides ongoing prospect pipeline analysis.  Collects donor information and classifies prospects according to interest, affinity and financial capacity in addition to prioritizing the donors for follow-up by fundraising staff. - Keeps abreast of the activities and initiatives underway at the university. - Conducts and composes in-depth prospect research as needed to support donor cultivation, solicitation, and stewardship.  Interprets and synthesizes large volumes of data and complex financial, legal and technical language into easily comprehensible information. - Provides analysis of information gathered on prospects and donors.  Creates narrative reports and develops tables, charts, and illustrations as required to describe a prospect or group of prospects.  Ensures that donor and prospect records are populated with demographic information as it is found. - Participates in prospect management activities, including tracking the prospect pipeline and providing recommendations regarding cultivation and solicitation strategies. - Proactively identifies potential donors by developing prospect lists using in-house and external resources. - Monitors printed and online publications for coverage of companies, people, products and issues that impact prospect and donor information, fundraising, and prospect research trends. - Keeps abreast of trends in the field of prospect research, emerging technologies, and available research tools. Organizational Requirements Bachelor's degree with a minimum of two years related experience or equivalent related experience in lieu of education.  Position requires excellent organizational, written and oral communication, research and analytical skills.  Thorough computer skills, including working with Microsoft products, online database searching, and use of the Internet. Degree in journalism, library science or similar field is preferred but not required. Experience in a fundraising environment preferred but not required. Departmental Requirements/Preferences Experience with relational databases. Position requires excellent organizational, written and oral communication, research and analytical  skills.  Thorough computer skills, including working with Microsoft products, online database searching, and use of the Internet. summary: Provide guidance to Data Scientists and other engineers on design, performance and engineering best practices....
post_text: Career Opportunities Principal Software Development Engineer Location: United States - Houston Department: Engineering Development - CTO Description Alert Logic, the leader in security and compliance solutions for the cloud, provides Security-as-a-Service for on-premises, cloud, and hybrid infrastructures, delivering deep security insight and continuous protection for customers at a lower cost than traditional security solutions. Fully managed by a team of experts, the Alert Logic Security-as-a-Service solution provides network, system and web application protection immediately, wherever your IT infrastructure resides. Alert Logic partners with the leading cloud platforms and hosting providers to protect organizations worldwide. Job Title Principal Software Development Engineer Job Summary We are continuing to expand our team and are looking for a Principal Software Development Engineer to join some of the industrys brightest minds that are dedicated to providing our customers and partners with security value and outcomes. You will be an integral part of a multi-talented team of engineers leading the development of a comprehensive big data analytics platform. This group of peers is challenged to re-think the delivery of big data analytics for Alert Logics security problem domain. As a Principal Engineer on the Advanced Analytics Platform team, you will be a technical leader responsible for setting the technical direction, designing, and engineering our advanced analytics platform of the future. You will work closely with other engineers, Data Scientists, security analyst, security content developers and technical leadership to establish the needs of the platform, including both data and software services as needed. Our ideal candidate will be an expert in using Big Data Analytics using Storm, Spark, or similar big data technologies based on the Hadoop ecosystem. Experience leveraging the Amazon Web Services implementation of these technologies is useful, as we will be leveraging AWS solutions moving forward. You will have skills in architecture, high scalability, and distributed computing problem sets. You will have familiarity in both batch- and real-time analytics solutions. You will be a polyglot programmer, moving between several languages as needed. Experience in Python, Java, Scala, and Erlang would be preferred. Familiarity with continuous integration, continuous deployment, and other dev-ops cultural aspects is highly desired. Primary Responsibilities Analyze big data analytics requirements. Design and implement platform services for the Advanced Analytics Platform. Proactively monitor and analyze operational behavior of the platform in both integration and production environments; assist in improving performance and scale on an ongoing basis. Provide guidance to Data Scientists and other engineers on design, performance and engineering best practices. Provide technical leadership by cooperating with other technical leadership on an ongoing basis. Performs other duties as assigned Required Skills and Experience Experience with distributed computing, from design, implementation and supporting in production. Hands on experience developing real-time and batch analytics processing systems. Extensive experience in developing big data solutions using the Spark/Hadoop ecosystem. Experience with NoSQL and SQL storage technologies. Deep understanding of CAP tradeoffs. Extensive experience with software-as-a-service systems. Experience with Amazon Web Services. Desired Skills and Experience Experience with analytics techniques, such as machine learning and statistics. Scrum/Agile methodology working group experience. Great communication skills, both written and verbal. Experience with graph databases. Education BS or MS in Computer Science or Management of Information Systems, related field, or equivalent industry experience. Physical Demands General office environment. May require long periods sitting and viewing a computer monitor. No special physical demands required. FLSA Status Exempt Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled. The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this classification.  It is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employee assigned to this job. The Associate will apply technical principles, project management skills and experimental design/analysis to create and evaluate innovation and brand stewardship projects. Key Responsibilities: Lead technical assignments for the Frito-Lay Regional team in the areas of new product development, process development, and technical brand stewardship. Initiate innovation and development of new technology to maintain and grow the PepsiCo business. Lead the identification, assessment, validation and commercialization of new technologies. Utilize scientific methods to develop knowledge that creates business opportunities that support the company strategic market objectives. Provide technical and business risk assessment/perspectives related to new product development. Design and execute experiments, and analyze and interpret data to make sound technical recommendations on product and process issues. Leverage external and internal experts for key analytical and sensory research. Participate as an active member of cross-functional business development teams comprised of individuals from a variety of disciplines, including Marketing, Purchasing, Engineering and other groups. Participate in quality/product improvement and productivity initiatives By joining the Frito Lay North American R&D Regional Popcorn team, you will become a part of a team whose platform is on fire, with +22% CAGR growth over the past 4 years, ~$1.1MM sales, and 50% incremental to the Frito-Lay's base business. You will develop skills including: Technical skills in applying scientific principles to solve new problems Product and process knowledge in the popcorn category People leadership skills by working with individuals in other functions Collaboration and influence skills through interaction with cross-functional teams Education/Certifications: MS or Higher Degree in Food Scientist BS or Higher Degree in Engineering Work Experience: Minimum 2 years in a Food Company Skills & Responsibilities: Demonstrated ability to translate business objectives into strategic and tactical project goals and objectives Proven ability to make significant technical scientific advances utilizing internal and/or external resources Demonstrated understanding of how to incorporate business needs into technical decisions The ability and interest to work in laboratory, pilot plant and manufacturing scale environments in a Food Company Proven ability to manage multiple assignments/ tasks Strong communication skills (oral and written) Other: Extensive cross-functional experience, preferably cross-divisional Experience leading/coordinating cross-functional teams Ability to influence, collaborate and communicate both above and below level High-level expertise with PowerPoint and presentation writing All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. post_text: Careers Research Analyst Consulting | Houston, TX, United States Apply Send Jobvite Argus Media is a fast-growing global B2B media company providing essential information to the energy industry and other commodity markets. Argus benchmarks are used globally throughout the energy sector for formula pricing in contracts, as a taxation reference, in investment planning and for a variety of other purposes. We are looking for an Analyst to join our global Consulting Services practice where you will work on a range of strategy reports and client studies focused on global energy, petrochemicals, and the American fertilizer industry. Duties & Responsibilities: Deliver extensive research of production, demand, and trade data for various commodities to support supply/demand analysis and assist with forecasting. Produce analysis and research in support of various consulting projects and presentations. Support consultants on engagements to respond to client enquiries. Provide materials in support of proposal developments. Build and cultivate strong internal and external relationships with key industry contacts. Maintain current knowledge of major drivers and trends across the energy industry. Liaise with Argus staff to ensure current knowledge of Argus products and to identify opportunities to promote services. Required Qualifications: The legal authorization to work in the US for any US employer. A minimum of a Bachelors degree in a related field. Key experience in energy is a must; with experience in a commodity market, like fertilizers, crude, biofuels, or other, is a plus A minimum of 3 years of experience in Data Analysis and Research, Consulting or Financial Services. Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Self-motivated with excellent organization skills, and the ability to work independently Demonstrated structured problem solving and analytical skills. The willingness and ability to travel up to 15% of the time, including international travel, in order to fulfill the responsibilities of this position. About Argus Argus is a leading provider of price assessments, business intelligence and market data for the global crude oil, petroleum products, LPG, natural gas, coal, electricity, bioenergy, emissions, fertilizer, petrochemicals, metals and transportation industries. Data provided by Argus is widely used for indexation of physical trade. The company publishes sophisticated market data and business intelligence internationally and has a strong reputation for accuracy, reliability and invaluable insight into the non-transparent energy markets. Companies, government and international agencies rely on Argus information for analysis and planning purposes. Argus is headquartered in London and has offices in Moscow, Washington, Houston, Calgary, Singapore, Tokyo, Beijing, New York, Kiev, Rio de Janeiro, Calgary, Sydney, Moscow, Astana, Riga and Dubai. In addition, they have employees in other key locations around the world. Argus was founded in 1970, has over 700 employees and is a privately held UK-registered company owned by its employees and the family of its founder. Employee Benefits Competitive salary Group medical, dental and vision plans Company paid long term disability and life insurance plan Group 401(k) safe harbor retirement plan with a 4% company match 15 vacation days your first year, which increases with tenure Subsidized gym membership Extensive internal and external training Apply « Back to Current Openings

title: Quantitative Risk Analyst-Senior
summary: 5 years related quantitative analysis experience in a discipline relevant to risk management to include statistical analysis, modeling, mathematics or other...
post_text: Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst (Model Risk Management) Job in Phoenix, AZ at USAA Home Why Work at USAA? Military and Spouses University Recruiting Search Jobs Quantitative Risk Analyst-Senior Job Job Number: 27006 Locations: Phoenix, AZ Tampa, FL Colorado Springs, CO Chesapeake, VA San Antonio, TX Date Posted: 4-13-2016 Job Title: Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst (Model Risk Management) Apply We are currently seeking talented Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst (Model Risk Management) for our San Antonio, TX, Phoenix, AZ, Colorado Springs, CO, Tampa, FL or Chesapeake, VA facility. PURPOSE OF JOB The Quantitative Risk Analyst (Model Risk Management) is a key member of a high performing team who ensure that the risks of models used throughout the enterprise are well-understood and appropriately managed. Conducts and develops quantitative and analytic models, assessments and/or applications in support of risk management efforts that assess the market and identify risks and gaps in existing or proposed processes. Applies diverse methodologies and deep experience in a variety of disciplines to identify and solve complex and/or undefined risk problems. Works with leadership to remediate gaps and improvements identified between existing practices and regulatory requirements. JOB DUTIES Specific Job Duties for this role include: Use advanced analytics and statistical/econometric techniques to assess model quality. Interact with model developers during the model design phase to ensure that the goal of building sound models is collaboratively pursued at the beginning and throughout each model development project. Produce Validation Reports which assess the statistical soundness of models that have been built. Review proposed Action Plans from model developers who have been required to remediate model deficiencies. Confirm that appropriate remediation actions have been taken and models are acceptable for use. Review Model Performance Monitoring Reports and recommends actions based on the results. Utilizes advanced analytics to assess future risk, opportunities, and effectiveness. Translates results into meaningful solutions to enhance decision making. May present findings to various levels of leadership. Utilizes industry best practices to quantify risk and aggregate exposures. Develops complex systems and programs that measure aggregate risk exposures. May engage in model validation and/or produce model validation reports. Applies innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make recommendations to answer business objectives and drive change using developed knowledge. May translate recommendations into communication materials to effectively present to colleagues for peer review and management. Produces advanced analytical material for discussions with cross-functional teams to understand complex business objectives and influence solution strategies. Communicates analytical results, findings and solutions to governance committees and business process owners and influences business analysis. May create statistical reporting and financial analysis to forecast results for required stress test scenarios. Analyzes and challenges stress testing results and partners with relevant functions to validate those results. Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences or other quantitative discipline 5 years related quantitative analysis experience in a discipline relevant to risk management to include statistical analysis, modeling, mathematics or other quantitative discipline OR advanced degree/designation in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, or other quantitative discipline and 4+ years work experience in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk management OR PhD in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative discipline and 2+ years work experience in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk management Successful completion of an analyst assessment may be required Preferred Master's degree in Statistics Experience in Model Validation or Model Development at a large financial institution SAS programming experience Risk management experience in a complex financial institution The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. Share our pride. Join our mission. As a Fortune 200 financial services organization, USAA is on a mission - to facilitate the financial security of our members, the men and women of the U.S. military and their families worldwide by providing a full range of financial services and products. Headquartered on a showcase campus in San Antonio, TX, USAA attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our 27,000 employees. They are the heart and soul of our member-service culture. Recently Ranked #11 in Forbes list of 500 of the "Best Employers in the U.S. in 2015" , we are proud to receive consistently outstanding awards and ratings for member service, employee well-being and financial strength. Everything that happens at USAA is based on our core values: Service, Loyalty, Honesty, and Integrity. These are the foundations of how we do business with our members, as well as how we treat each other. At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position. Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre-employment background and drug screen. USAA is an EEO/AA Employer - applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law. title: Senior Data Scientist-Research Engineer
summary: Advanced knowledge of data visualization (Excel, Tableau, Business Objects, etc.). Act as a technology subject matter expert providing assistance across the...
post_text: Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior Job in San Antonio, TX at USAA Home Why Work at USAA? Military and Spouses University Recruiting Search Jobs Senior Data Scientist-Research Engineer Job Job Number: 26919 Location: San Antonio , TX Date Posted: 4-1-2016 Job Title: Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior Apply We are currently seeking talented Data Scientist/Research Engineer, Senior for our San Antonio, TX facility. PURPOSE OF JOB Synthesizes analyses, identifies root causes, and develops and recommends key work products. Assembles key participants and guides and facilitates teams in the development and implementation of key initiatives. Execute applied research for business and technical innovation purposes across any known, future, or as of yet unknown set of business functions and/or complex technologies. Develops business and technology gap assessments, innovation forecasts, research recommendations, patent opportunities, and specialized business and technology evaluations based on complex analysis of business, technology, industry, competitors, economic environment, legal/regulatory/political, and suppliers. Serves as a mentor to peers and team members for assigned area of responsibility. Provides insight to management on issues. JOB DUTIES Identify technology needs and solutions using highly developed research techniques. Interact with appropriate experts from across the enterprise in assessments. Perform most complex research assessments, present findings to technical, business, and mid-level management audiences, without requiring guidance. Regularly interact with and maintain relationships with counterparts internally, externally across IT. Begin to network regularly across EBO, and develop business contacts. Act as a technology subject matter expert providing assistance across the enterprise in understanding and communicating technology capabilities, limitations, risks, and opportunities. Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree or equivalent work experience 6+ years relevant business support and/or general technology research/analysis experience Significant coordination and people networking skills Demonstrated functional development skills in infrastructure and architecture disciplines Advanced awareness of IT and financial service industry. Demonstrated elevated degree of creative and innovative skills. Advanced knowledge of data visualization (Excel, Tableau, Business Objects, etc.) Preferred Basic statistical model building skills Experience in structured hypothesis testing Basic ETL acumen Drive for Results and Innovation The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. Share our pride. Join our mission. As a Fortune 200 financial services organization, USAA is on a mission - to facilitate the financial security of our members, the men and women of the U.S. military and their families worldwide by providing a full range of financial services and products. Headquartered on a showcase campus in San Antonio, TX, USAA attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our 27,000 employees. They are the heart and soul of our member-service culture. Recently Ranked #11 in Forbes list of 500 of the "Best Employers in the U.S. in 2015" , we are proud to receive consistently outstanding awards and ratings for member service, employee well-being and financial strength. Everything that happens at USAA is based on our core values: Service, Loyalty, Honesty, and Integrity. These are the foundations of how we do business with our members, as well as how we treat each other. At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position. Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre-employment background and drug screen. USAA is an EEO/AA Employer - applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law.                     Big Data Jobs at AT&T Change the way the world connects Looking to do something amazing? Our Big Data team is made up of top innovators, cool technology and a start-up culture. Here, youll work with one of the largest data sets in the world to shape the way we interact with our customers. Its a big opportunity with even bigger rewards. Share Share this job with your friends and connections! Job Details Culture Apply now Apply now Principal Software Engineer Front End Big Data Architect Location: Plano, Texas Are you a front-end architect who loves to put things together and build the future from the world's most massive data sets?  Why?  Because AT&T is looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer to develop high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, and text mining .  We are looking for people with a ton of passion, a desire to try big things, people who have a lot of curiosity and can go deep into the lowest layer of a complex system. We want people who want to learn new things, and people who have a clear customer point-of-view. The selected candidate will write code, complete programming and documentation, and perform testing and debugging of applications within our Big Data Organization; Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions; Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented; Enjoy working in a highly agile environment. AT&T offers a collaborative, fun, and fast paced environment.  If this is what drives you and allows you to unleash your potential, then AT&T may have the perfect career opportunity for you! Desired Qualifications: 8+ years experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies Hadoop certification is desired and highly relevant A passion for building things from massive data sets and a passion to create the future in technology Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM Masters of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred Viewed as a pioneer within field AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.  EOE/AA/M/F/D/V Requisition ID: 1624841 Apply now Apply now AT&T has the best innovative technology, the best ideas, and the best leadership team. summary: Our team of scientists and professional management personnel allows us to bring real-world experience to meet the growing demand for solutions to some of the...

Sign In This service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. Your session will end in {1} minutes. Click OK to reset the timer to {0} minutes. You have been signed out. This service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity. Job Search Basic Search | All Jobs Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - STARS Automation and Adaptation Specialist, Houston (16000752) If you would like to apply for this position, click the "Apply Online" button. STARS Automation and Adaptation Specialist, Houston - 16000752 Location :  Houston, TX Position :  We are seeking an Automation and Adaptation Specialist 2 to support our FAA customer in Houston, TX.  Successful candidates will have a background in FAA's National Airspace Systems (NAS) and specifically have previous experience in site adaptation and automation with NAS systems such as STARS, STARS Elite, CARTS, ARTSII, ARTS III or Microearts Benefits :  Comprehensive benefits package with generous Paid Time Off and a matching 401k Savings Plan with immediate vesting! Requirements: Education, Skills and Abilities : High School diploma and fifteen (15) years of technical experience ATC systems, ATC automation, ATC procedures & development, and ATC management background; STARS, CARTS, ARTSII or ARTSIII is desired Understanding of the functions of the Tools Menu to identify most common procedures used in adaptation, distributing and downloading application software, problem reporting Experience in the FAA Terminal environment experience such as hands on Terminal Radar Approach Control Operations, Control Tower Operations, Non-Radar, Operations, and Flight Planning functions and/or FAA Air Traffic experience. Desired Skills: STARS Database Management Software STARS Rules Language OSF Adaptation Tools STARS Tools Menu MCW ATCoach CARTS Adaptation Knowledge of control operations to systems analysis, design, development, testing, installation, implementation and maintenance of software to meet Air Traffic (AT) defined user requirements Knowledge of the air traffic mission and objectives to provide technical leadership in system analysis, design and program review and to serve as a technical advisor to the organization. Responsibilities: Provides adaptation and automation for STARS and other FAA NAS systems Builds STARS databases from an empty template in the Database Management Software (DMS) to a fully populated database with the capability to generate full and emergency service level adaptation Troubleshoots radar and inter facility hand off problems and can assist less experienced personnel in all aspects of STARS or ARTS lIE second level support Reviews and evaluates Program Technical Reports (PTR) and Program Improvements to determine their impact of functional, diagnostic, and support software ASRC Federal Research and Technology Solutions (ARTS) focus is on technical and complex, mission-oriented services with contracts supporting federal government agencies. Our team of scientists and professional management personnel allows us to bring real-world experience to meet the growing demand for solutions to some of the most complex problems in aviation, IT management, aviation, and Earth and space sciences. The FAA (Federal Aviation Administration has selected ARTS to provide engineering, maintenance, and related support services for the FAAs National Air Space System at the William J. Hughes Technical Center in Egg Harbor, NJ. The Technical Center is the worlds premier aviation research and development, test and evaluation facility. ARTS is proud to provide second level maintenance and engineering for data management, as well as systems for technical operations, terminal services and surveillance programs. ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, gender, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, religion, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status or any other factor prohibited by applicable law. Job - Information Technology Primary Location - United States-TX, United States-Houston, TX, United States Education Level - High School Diploma / (GED) Schedule - Full-time Shift - Day Job / 1st Shift Travel - Yes, 25 % of the Time Job Level - Individual Contributor/Non-Management Job Type - Standard EOE An Equal Opportunity Employer

Comment: Thank you. A member of our team will review this job posting shortly. Apply Big Data Developer Please enter your email to start the apply process Email: Big Data Developer Cook Systems US-TX-Irving Posted: 4/9/2016 Email Job Print Job Report This Job Apply Job Description The primary function of this position is for the development of sophisticated solutions for various initiatives and projects the IT applications department will undertake using Big Data technologies and related platforms. The IT Big Data Senior Developer will undertake technical leadership roles in ownership of applications, services framework or components assigned to them. The Big Data Developer will be expected to architect solutions in AWS based cloud deployments of big data platforms. This position will be expected to provide technical leadership and mentoring, working with a team of in-house and outsourced Big Data Developers in design, development, deployment and systems integration activities. In addition, the Big Data Senior Developer is expected to do hands on coding and develop/implement design patterns and other best practices. title: Principal Software Development Engineer
summary: Provide guidance to Data Scientists and other engineers on design, performance and engineering best practices....
post_text: Career Opportunities Principal Software Development Engineer Location: United States - Houston Department: Engineering Development - CTO Description Alert Logic, the leader in security and compliance solutions for the cloud, provides Security-as-a-Service for on-premises, cloud, and hybrid infrastructures, delivering deep security insight and continuous protection for customers at a lower cost than traditional security solutions. Fully managed by a team of experts, the Alert Logic Security-as-a-Service solution provides network, system and web application protection immediately, wherever your IT infrastructure resides. Alert Logic partners with the leading cloud platforms and hosting providers to protect organizations worldwide. Job Title Principal Software Development Engineer Job Summary We are continuing to expand our team and are looking for a Principal Software Development Engineer to join some of the industrys brightest minds that are dedicated to providing our customers and partners with security value and outcomes. You will be an integral part of a multi-talented team of engineers leading the development of a comprehensive big data analytics platform. This group of peers is challenged to re-think the delivery of big data analytics for Alert Logics security problem domain. As a Principal Engineer on the Advanced Analytics Platform team, you will be a technical leader responsible for setting the technical direction, designing, and engineering our advanced analytics platform of the future. You will work closely with other engineers, Data Scientists, security analyst, security content developers and technical leadership to establish the needs of the platform, including both data and software services as needed. Our ideal candidate will be an expert in using Big Data Analytics using Storm, Spark, or similar big data technologies based on the Hadoop ecosystem. Experience leveraging the Amazon Web Services implementation of these technologies is useful, as we will be leveraging AWS solutions moving forward. You will have skills in architecture, high scalability, and distributed computing problem sets. You will have familiarity in both batch- and real-time analytics solutions. You will be a polyglot programmer, moving between several languages as needed. Experience in Python, Java, Scala, and Erlang would be preferred. Familiarity with continuous integration, continuous deployment, and other dev-ops cultural aspects is highly desired. Primary Responsibilities Analyze big data analytics requirements. Design and implement platform services for the Advanced Analytics Platform. Proactively monitor and analyze operational behavior of the platform in both integration and production environments; assist in improving performance and scale on an ongoing basis. Provide guidance to Data Scientists and other engineers on design, performance and engineering best practices. Provide technical leadership by cooperating with other technical leadership on an ongoing basis. Performs other duties as assigned Required Skills and Experience Experience with distributed computing, from design, implementation and supporting in production. Hands on experience developing real-time and batch analytics processing systems. Extensive experience in developing big data solutions using the Spark/Hadoop ecosystem. Experience with NoSQL and SQL storage technologies. Deep understanding of CAP tradeoffs. Extensive experience with software-as-a-service systems. Experience with Amazon Web Services. Desired Skills and Experience Experience with analytics techniques, such as machine learning and statistics. Scrum/Agile methodology working group experience. Great communication skills, both written and verbal. Experience with graph databases. Education BS or MS in Computer Science or Management of Information Systems, related field, or equivalent industry experience. Physical Demands General office environment. May require long periods sitting and viewing a computer monitor. No special physical demands required. FLSA Status Exempt Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled. The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this classification.  It is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employee assigned to this job. title: Research Asst I Leukemia
summary: Conducts close work with and instructs other technicians, students, post-doctoral fellows, visiting scientists, and staff members in scientific protocols...
post_text: Research - Research Asst I Leukemia jobs in Texas at MD Anderson Cancer Center Career Opportunities Locations How to Apply Benefits MD Anderson Cancer Center Jobs > Texas Jobs > Research Jobs Careers Useful Links How to Apply Benefits Working at MD Anderson Working in Houston EEO and Accessibility Military Skills Translator REGIONAL CARE CENTERS LOCATIONS Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands STAY CONNECTED Facebook Twitter Where will you be when cancer is history? At MD Anderson Cancer Center, we bring together the expertise, the technology and the dedication that is moving us closer to our goal of Making Cancer History®. Advanced Search Search Jobs Job Opportunity Apply Now Research Asst I Leukemia Job Location: Houston, TX KEY FUNCTIONS This position will work in the Leukemia Sample Bank at the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center. S/he will be required to collect and process all samples as well as maintain the sample database. This position will also assist in research activities in the laboratory.  This is an excellent entry level position for someone recently graduated with a degree in biological sciences that is looking for some laboratory experience, perhaps before proceeding on to graduate studies. 1. This position involves retrieving blood and bone marrow samples collected from patients in various clinics and inpatient units throughout the hospital and transporting them back to the laboratory. 2. Samples are then processed to yield DNA, RNA, protein, viable cells and serum using standardized operating procedures. Specific cell fractions are isolated using magnetic antibody conjugated sorting. Automated DNA and RNA extraction is performed. Quality control assays are performed on the materials produced. Samples are distributed fresh to researchers, or the surplus material is banked for later use. 3. Data is then entered into a computerized database to record what samples are received, how they were processed, what materials were produced, who they were distributed to, where they are stored. 4. Perform duties related to retrieval of stored specimens and updating of the database when samples are requested for research. This includes shipping samples to offsite researchers. 5. Perform duties in accordance with general laboratory support including maintenance of laboratory equipment and ordering of laboratory supplies. 6. Upon demonstration of laboratory proficiency in these areas the person hired for this position will be involved in ongoing research projects within the lab. 7. Conducts close work with and instructs other technicians, students, post-doctoral fellows, visiting scientists, and staff members in scientific protocols currently used.  The above requires good communication skills, patience, and a good working knowledge of the necessary equipment. 8. Seminars: Participates in section seminar series and also attend work-related seminars. EDUCATION Required: Bachelor's degree, major course work in one of the basic sciences. EXPERIENCE Required: No experience. Preferred: Working experience or internship in a research laboratory. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105290 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications.
