title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
summary: Regular and ad hoc analytics dives into dashboards and other data to provide meaningful insights. Analyze data for duplicate data or other data errors....
post_text: Apply for Job: Senior Quantitative Analyst Loading... Job Title:  Senior Quantitative Analyst Job ID: 2280 Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst Rate: $80K-$90K Primary Skills: Bachelors degree with a major in business, accounting, finance or technical area preferred, or equivalent skills and knowledge. 3-5 years in Statistical Analysis role utilizing SQL, SAS or R 3-5 years mortgage industry experience Strong written and verbal communication skills including listening and retaining critical information and the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly Good interpersonal skills to work effectively with others and develop partnerships internally and externally Skills and knowledge to compile reports and perform analytical functions. Expert skills in Excel, and proficient in Word and Power Point Strong skills in writing SQL queries and developing objects such as views and stored procedures Experience with SSRS or other reporting portals is a plus Excellent analytical and mathematical skills and applications Ability to explain and document work product and methodology Excellent organizational skills and the ability to be flexible, prioritize work, and follow through in order to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Attention to detail; multi-tasking skills; excellent time-management skills Ability to work independently and take initiative, not requiring significant direction Flexibility and adaptability in a fluid and rapidly changing environment Willingness to do more than basic job requirements as needed Description: The primary responsibilities are to develop reporting and risk models to provide data transparency and business metrics to all levels of end-users through the organization from staff/end-user to executive level. Responsible for scoping, researching, designing and developing models for assigned business unit(s).  Handles a large number of ad-hoc requests for data and analysis from both internal and external sources (such as regulatory groups or auditors.) Once developed, maintains these models and reports (and business rules and definitions behind them) to ensure consistency and accuracy over time. Provides feedback on the data being reported such as identifying trends, or other areas for data exploration and analysis. Model and Reporting Development: Work with business to define key metrics and needs.  Identify data sources, coordinate data feeds from external sources and develop or coordinate the development of reports, queries, forms and spreadsheets to meet process and information needs of business unit. Analyze data for duplicate data or other data errors. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.  Maintain / Monitor data dictionary, and other relevant documentation.  Data Analysis: Regular and ad hoc analytics dives into dashboards and other data to provide meaningful insights. Write up analysis and findings into cohesive and clear documents for senior/executive management to understand trends or patterns. Provide data to various stakeholders within different parts of business as needed Ensure accuracy and consistency of data. Data and Reporting Infrastructure: Work with business to identify additional data needs likely from external sources. Work with IT to define these data needs and requirements to automate data import or build out database. Work with IT on defining framework/technology for modeling and reporting and report delivery. Participate in special projects as needed, and performs other duties as assigned. Talking with co-workers and branch operations to communicate and gather information. title: Field Research Assistant
summary: This is a unique opportunity to work with leading edge technology and talented research scientists seeking to deliver the best in crop genetics....
post_text:
Field Research Assistant Description at MONSANTO <iframe src="//www.googletagmanager.com/ns.html?id=GTM-53N8FX"
    height="0" width="0" style="display:none;visibility:hidden"></iframe> Skip Navigation who we are products newsroom improving agriculture Select Language English Afrikaans Albanian Amharic Arabic Armenian Azerbaijani Basque Belarusian Bengali Bosnian Bulgarian Catalan Cebuano Chichewa Chinese (Simplified) Chinese (Traditional) Corsican Croatian Czech Danish Dutch Esperanto Estonian Filipino Finnish French Frisian Galician Georgian German Greek Gujarati Haitian Creole Hausa Hawaiian Hebrew Hindi Hmong Hungarian Icelandic Igbo Indonesian Irish Italian Japanese Javanese Kannada Kazakh Khmer Korean Kurdish (Kurmanji) Kyrgyz Lao Latin Latvian Lithuanian Luxembourgish Macedonian Malagasy Malay Malayalam Maltese Maori Marathi Mongolian Myanmar (Burmese) Nepali Norwegian Pashto Persian Polish Portuguese Punjabi Romanian Russian Samoan Scots Gaelic Serbian Sesotho Shona Sindhi Sinhala Slovak Slovenian Somali Spanish Sundanese Swahili Swedish Tajik Tamil Telugu Thai Turkish Ukrainian Urdu Uzbek Vietnamese Welsh Xhosa Yiddish Yoruba Zulu Powered by Translate Menu search jobs Keyword Search Country, City, State, or ZIP Search radius Radius 5 miles 15 miles 25 miles 35 miles 50 miles Search Field Research Assistant Lubbock, Texas, US apply now Apply Later Job ID 017S3 Monsanto is seeking a highly motivated Field Research Assistant with the ability to work as part of a multidisciplinary Research Team. The Field Research Assistant will assist in all phases of a comprehensive breeding and testing program aimed at germplasm development and the introgression of new traits into elite cultivars. The successful Field Research Assistant has the opportunity to manage all operations related to field trials, seed preparation, seeding, field plot management, data collection, harvesting and trial plots. This is a unique opportunity to work with leading edge technology and talented research scientists seeking to deliver the best in crop genetics. Twenty years from now, the earths population will need 55% more food than it can produce now. Today, Monsanto is working with farmers around the world to do something about it. In over 60 countries, Monsanto has established industry-leading products because we give professionals the freedom to make real decisions. Monsanto is an Employer Of Choice with an outstanding professional development program and a history of building careers. Make an impact by joining the team that is working to solve one of mankinds greatest challenges. Responsibilities include:  Utilization of research equipment such as planters, combines and hand held computers for note taking  Manage different greenhouse operations, seeding, management of plants, crossing, self-pollinating, data collection, harvest, etc.  Assist in computer related activities and provide support for day-to-day nursery and testing activities such as operation of shelling systems, seed counters, and seed packaging  Shipping of nursery and hybrid testing materials  Perform safety inspections, and assist in providing safety training and guidance to field personnel  Supervision and training of temporary employees  Work closely with other research sites to keep program operating efficiently  Participate with team to successfully maintain the ISO Quality Management Standards  Assist in other projects and perform other duties as requested  Overnight travel during the planting and harvest season is possible. Several 2-3 days of travel for training and other meetings are likely during the year Required Education & Skills/Experience:  Minimum of a Bachelors Degree in Agronomy or a related field  Ability to work extended hours during the peak planting, pollinating and harvest seasons  Ability to travel overnight for multiple days during peak season  Experience utilizing MS Word and MS Excel  Ability to work effectively with interdisciplinary teams  Demonstrated ability to balance and prioritize tasks  Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively, both written and oral  Basic understanding of farm equipment maintenance  Ability to lift 60lbs Desired Education & Skills/Experience:  Familiarity with breeding methodologies  Broad knowledge of crop production and farming practices as well as farm equipment operation and repair  Class A CDL or ability to obtain a Class A CDL  Pesticide applicator license Who is Monsanto? Monsanto is an agriculture company with more than 20,000 employees focused on making a balanced meal accessible to everyone. We work to help farmers produce food in a more sustainable way. We think about how our food is grown so farmers have the tools they need to have better harvests. We believe that bringing diverse perspectives together is the most effective way to develop creative solutions to some of the worlds biggest challenges. Career opportunities at Monsanto range from farming, plant breeding, chemistry and engineering to marketing, environmental science, IT and many other areas. Were always looking for exceptional professionals interested in developing a strong career while collaborating to develop solutions for sustainable agriculture. Sound like a job for you? Why work with us?  Life at Monsanto means collaborating with dedicated professionals in a stimulating environment  Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships  You will work with market leading brand products in a global organization  We provide competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and some of the best career development opportunities in the industry  Monsanto is named Great Place to Work in many countries around the world Join our global team where your contribution will make a real difference! apply now Apply Later Share Facebook Twitter Email LinkedIn Recent Jobs Territory Sales Manager - Mansa - , Senior Manager-Tax Financial Reporting - St. Louis, Missouri China Corporate Engagement Lead - Beijing, Beijing HR Lead- Soda Springs Manufacturing Site - Soda Springs, Idaho Territory Sales Manager - Nizamabad - , Andhra Pradesh Useful Links Monsanto Sustainability Careers Viewpoints Awards and Recognitions Students Diversity at Monsanto Discover Monsanto Awards Follow us on the web: Facebook Twitter LinkedIn YouTube Blog stay in the loop with our job news and events Email Address Area of interest Search for a category, location, or category/location pair, select a term from the suggestions, and click "Add". Category Location Add Research & Development, Lubbock, Texas, United States Remove Confirm Email Monsanto is an equal opportunity employer, we value a diverse combination of ideas, perspectives and cultures.

title: Research Analyst-Senior
summary: Serves as a subject matter expert focusing on overall supply chain capabilities, Supplier/Industry Intelligence, emerging trends and best practices....
post_text: GSD Senior Research Analyst  Job in San Antonio, TX at USAA Home Why Work at USAA? Military and Spouses University Recruiting Search Jobs Research Analyst-Senior Job Job Number: 27013 Location: San Antonio , TX Date Posted: 4-5-2016 Job Title: GSD Senior Research Analyst Apply We are currently seeking talented GSD Senior Research Analyst for our San Antonio, TX facility. PURPOSE OF JOB Designs and analyzes competitive activities, products and industry trends for short and long term business goals and results. Serves as a subject matter expert focusing on overall supply chain capabilities, Supplier/Industry Intelligence, emerging trends and best practices. Understands business strategy and identifies and communicates trends, competitive forces, and potential 3rd party solutions. Provides cross functional analysis and research pertaining to sourcing, supplier competition, risk mitigation and due diligence on initiatives across a broad range of topical areas. Translates findings into business recommendations that proactively drive operational, innovative and strategic business decisions. May present/communicate findings to various levels of leadership. JOB DUTIES Researches and identifies industry best practices and trends. Acquires, maintains and applies knowledge of the business and advanced knowledge of supplier/competitive/industry intelligence research. Supports GSD and the enterprise with ongoing and ad-hoc analysis and research in support of existing and potential 3rd party relationships. Able to synthesize information from various sources and proactively identify opportunities. Translates business requirements to findings and recommendations and interacts across GSD and Enterprise to interpret complex research data and findings into potential solutions. Supports the creation of 3rd party strategies pertaining to enterprise-wide and CoSA-specific initiatives. Advises key GSD stakeholders on industry best practices through research and analysis of internal/external business data and competitive information Minimum Requirements Experience in conducting market or competitive intelligence using current tools and resources. Working knowledge of supply chain process and contracting methods. Demonstrated experience supporting cross functional project efforts. Ability to synthesize complex information. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Bachelor's degree in Business or related field required or 4 years of related work experience may be used in lieu of a degree. Preferred Masters degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Finance, Economics or Accounting. 4+ years of experience using relevant research tools such as Gartner, Everest, LexisNexis, etc. in support of 3rd party research. 6+ years experience in competitive analysis/intelligence or related research fields. Ability to influence others. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job. Share our pride. Join our mission. As a Fortune 200 financial services organization, USAA is on a mission - to facilitate the financial security of our members, the men and women of the U.S. military and their families worldwide by providing a full range of financial services and products. Headquartered on a showcase campus in San Antonio, TX, USAA attributes its long-standing success to its most valuable resource, our 27,000 employees. They are the heart and soul of our member-service culture. Recently Ranked #11 in Forbes list of 500 of the "Best Employers in the U.S. in 2015" , we are proud to receive consistently outstanding awards and ratings for member service, employee well-being and financial strength. Everything that happens at USAA is based on our core values: Service, Loyalty, Honesty, and Integrity. These are the foundations of how we do business with our members, as well as how we treat each other. At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is available for this position. Qualified applicants must successfully complete a pre-employment background and drug screen. USAA is an EEO/AA Employer - applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, protected veteran status or other status protected by law. title: Research Scientist\Bhalla Lab
summary: Presents findings of data to PI and prepares scientific documents for publication. Plans, organizes, coordinates, directs, and participates in scientific...
post_text: Research - Research Scientist\Bhalla Lab jobs in Houston at MD Anderson Cancer Center Career Opportunities Locations How to Apply Benefits MD Anderson Cancer Center Jobs > Houston Jobs > Research Jobs Careers Useful Links How to Apply Benefits Working at MD Anderson Working in Houston EEO and Accessibility Military Skills Translator REGIONAL CARE CENTERS LOCATIONS Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands STAY CONNECTED Facebook Twitter Where will you be when cancer is history? At MD Anderson Cancer Center, we bring together the expertise, the technology and the dedication that is moving us closer to our goal of Making Cancer History®. Advanced Search Search Jobs Job Opportunity Apply Now Research Scientist\Bhalla Lab Job Location: Houston, TX 1. The basic and translational research focus of this laboratory includes epigenetic mechanisms involving histone deacetylases, methyltransferases and demethylases, heat shock proteins and their cancer and leukemia-relevant client proteins, as well as transfection and functional analyses of genes regulating cell death/survival of human cancer cells. Experience in animal studies involving NOD/SCID or nude mice, and mouse imaging (xenogen and MRI) is highly desirable. Experience in molecular techniques involving plasmid DNA preparations and transfection, the analysis of gene expression including QPCR, microarrays, chromatin immunoprecipitation, evaluation of protein biochemistry with 2D gels, animal models, the yeast-two-hybrid system, confocal microscopy and tissue culture are also preferred. 2. Plans, organizes, coordinates, directs, and participates in scientific research projects. Performs quality research in relation to current research projects, and other identified needs. Interprets results of experiments, and makes necessary changes in procedures when needed. Compiles data sheets. 3. Organizes and performs routine procedures involving molecular biology and biochemistry of RNA processing. Requires experience in tissue culture, DNA & RNA preparation, PCR, DNA cloning, protein synthesis and electrophoresis. Responsible for providing laboratory services, tissue culture, processing research samples, and/or cataloging samples as required. Interacts with the principal investigators, postdoctoral fellows and other research personnel in communicating experimental design and results. 4. Requires knowledge of standard radiographic techniques. Dark room usage is essential as is use and proper handling of radioisotopes. Must be able to comply with all institutional safety policies including Universal Precautions and OSHA standards when handling toxic, hazardous, flammable, or potentially infectious or carcinogenic materials. This may require wearing common protective garments or equipment such as gloves, eye protection, face mask, gown or lab coat, etc. Additionally some procedures may require the use of a fume hood or biological safety cabinet. 5. Work with laboratory animals such as mice and rats and to perform interventional procedures such as tail vein injections and orthotopic implantations. Retrieves, maintains, and catalogs specimen stocks from outside reference laboratories. Assists in other laboratory activities as needed. 6. Performs and coordinates scientific experiments in a collaborative effort with other technicians, postdoctoral fellows, and staff members. Monitors work flow as it pertains to the need for supplies, equipment maintenance and stock solutions. Performs preventive maintenance on laboratory equipment. 7. Equipment monitoring on a daily basis verifying correct temperatures of freezers, refrigerators, incubators, etc. Equipment maintenance on a weekly basis includes cleaning and disinfecting refrigerators and incubators. Daily counter clean up and disinfection to ensure safety of the laboratory work place. Bags waste and transports to appropriate refuse area utilizing safety standards and guidelines. Maintains all safety precautions. 8. Assigns and reviews work of subordinates, determines specific goals or objectives to be attained, evaluates resulting research data, and revises techniques or approaches to work problems. Supervises the design, development, or adapting of equipment used in experiments or research to obtain desired results. Utilizes institutional and departmental databases to perform data retrieval for analysis. Designs retrieval templates for standard queries. Apply bio-statistical methods in analyzing clinical data such as pretreatment characteristics, response to treatment, toxicities, and mortality, etc. Conducts Library Work. Finds and copies journal articles as required. Reads and understands articles related to ongoing research. Maintains references in a manual filing system. Requires good reading and comprehension skills as well as diligence, patience and ability to carry several heavy books at a time. 9. Assemble samples, reagents, dry or wet ice, data and packaging materials; draft a cover letter, accurately and legibly fill out shipping labels; carry package to receiving area on ground floor prior to pick up. Keep accurate legible logs of outgoing and incoming packages. For incoming packages, ascertain contents, store at appropriate location, file information sheets and notify principal investigator. Update pertinent inventory logs. 10. Compiles, writes, and submits reports to superior. Plans and supervises the training of technicians and other laboratory personnel with respect to proper laboratory techniques, the use of laboratory equipment, and safety procedures. 11. Presents findings of data to PI and prepares scientific documents for publication. Presents findings of research projects to professional groups and prepares scientific documents for publication. 12. Performs related work as required. source:sonj EDUCATON Required: PhD in one of the natural sciences or related field or Medical degree EXPERIENCE Required: With PhD, no experience required. With Medical degree, two years of experience in experimental or scientific work. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105623 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications. You are not signed in. | My Account Options My Job Cart | Sign In Job Search My Jobpage Search | Jobs Matching My Profile | All Jobs Beginning of the main content section. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Team Lead Program Manager (00ZSN) Job Description Team Lead Program Manager - 00ZSN Description Sabre is the global leader in innovative technology that leads the travel industry. We are always looking for bright and driven people who have a penchant for technology and want to hone their skills. If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you! It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs for our airline, hotel, and travel agency customers. As a Technical Program Manager at Sabre, you will manage portfolios of highly complex, multi-disciplinary technical projects. You will create strategic and tactical roadmaps fulfilled by your projects. You will ensure requirements are clearly articulated by architects and other internal subject matter experts and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to stakeholders. Your program often consists of projects that span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all resources and stakeholders aligned and meeting deadlines to deliver quality technology on scope, on schedule and within budgets. As a Technical Program Manager youll ensure proper governance structure is in place while working side-by-side with Data Architects, Cloud scientists and Security experts in understanding how the work they perform maps to program success. You will play a critical role in maintaining a strong culture of innovation, velocity, respect, and collaboration. You will:  Manage complex schedules that involve both internal and external engineering teams  Have sufficient technical experience to understand technical deliverables and implementations  Track projects and milestones, communicating schedule and technical considerations to senior leadership  Multi-task and prioritize activities for quick execution of critical path deliverables Qualifications Preferred qualifications:  Bachelors degree in Computer Science OR Engineering, OR equivalent work experience.  5+ years experience leading and tracking technical projects such as common enterprise platforms, cloud infrastructure and security systems  Thorough understanding of Architecture and Governance Best Practices  PMP certified preferred Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient with Microsoft Office suite or equivalent. Proficient with a project scheduling software tool-MS Project preferred. Must be able to interface at appropriate management levels with moderate customer interface. At Sabre, we are fortunate to have the resources of a large company paired with the culture of a startup. Our company culture includes casual work environments, employee amenities, flexible work arrangements, and exceptional learning opportunities. And, you will be surrounded by intelligent team members who you will be proud to call your peers. To learn more about the people and culture at Sabre, follow us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. Sabre is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans, and disabled individuals. Job : Technical Product Development - Project Management Primary Location US-TX-Dallas Ft Worth - Southlake Organization : Sabre Schedule : Full-time Travel : No Overtime Status : Exempt Stay Connected with Sabre Careers Reasonable Accommodation Sabre is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. Applicants applying for a Sabre position with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact Sabre's Employee Relations Department at employee.relations@sabre.com Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis. Affirmative Action Sabre is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and is committed to providing employment opportunities to minorities, females, veterans and disabled individuals. EEO IS THE LAW Technical Assistance For technical assistance with this career site, send an email to recruiting@sabre.com Note: Resumes/CVs are not accepted via email. post_text: Clinical Research Finance Analyst - Simmons Comprehensive Cancer Center job in Dallas, TX | UT Southwestern Medical Center Jobs Careers Main About Us Benefits FAQs Contact Us Home About Us Benefits FAQs Contact Us Job Details Clinical Research Finance Analyst - Simmons Comprehensive Cancer Center Apply Back Refer a Friend Job Number: 521597 Categories: Professional Location: Dallas , TX Department: Simmon CC CRO Rsrch Full/Part Time/PRN: Full-Time Regular/Temporary: Regular Security This position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code 51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information Salary Salary Negotiable Experience and Education Associate's degree and RN, or Bachelor's degree, and a minimum of four (4) years working in a clinical research setting, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Previous coverage determination analyst, research coordinator, research nurse, or research-related budget work preferred; AND Certified Professional Coder (CPC), Certified Medical Coder (CMC), or the ability to obtain an appropriate/approved coding certification within 12 months of employment/start date required. Job Duties Perform review of research protocols, informed consent documents, contracts, Notices of Grant Award, FDA letters, and other research documents to develop clinical trial budgets and comprehensive Coverage Analyses. Analyze Medicare benefit policies, coverage determinations (NCD, LCDs), and medical practice guidelines related to study specific interventions. Facilitate effective work-flow by accurately reporting the status of CAs that are in development and issues causing delays in completion. Recommend policies, procedures, and processes to ensure compliance with federal and state rules and regulations regarding research compliance billing. Solve problems pro-actively to facilitate project start up as efficiently as possible. Keep abreast of Medicare and other regulatory documents to best inform the CA process. Provide information to University Billing Compliance Committee and other appropriate committees, as requested. Perform other duties as assigned. Investigates and documents complaints from study participant and others. Performs other duties as assigned. **Other Duties:  Performs other duties as assigned. Locations Contact I Service I Sitemap Print Email Search site Search Technical Datasheet Home Products Investor relations News Careers Innovation Sustainability About us Home >> Careers Global Careers Your Career Path Our Culture About Us Search our Careers Career Center FAQs Login Scientist Technologist Share this job on Twitter! Job Code : 6153 Exemption : Exempt Location : The Woodlands Advanced Technolgy Center TX US 77381 Offer Relocation : Yes Job Description : Huntsman currently has an immediate opening for a dynamic individual with proven capability as a Scientist Technologist for our Polyurethanes Division located at our Huntsman Advanced Technology Center. This job exists to support the Polyurethanes Business to achieve its short and medium term growth and profitability goals. The New Business Development (NBD) Scientist Technologist helps the Americas New Business Development Team achieve its objectives by enabling new and advanced product development in the specific technology area of rigid foams. The NBD Scientist Technologist contributes to the team through his/her unique knowledge and proven experience in the fields of Polymer Science, Polyurethane Chemistry, Polyurethane Rigid Foam Formulation, Physics and Fire Science and the interaction of these fields, to provide differentiated solutions to complex product development requirements in an structured project management environment. The job holder has, in addition to a strong technical knowledge, a record of achievement both individual and through leadership of a small to medium teams and understands the importance of his or her work area in the context of the Polyurethane Business strategy and growth ambitions. At this stage, the job holder may have a recognized level of knowledge in polyurethane chemistry applications and markets, as well as knowledge in areas related to the particular performance of these materials, with specific emphasis on polyether polyols (manufacturing and structure/property relationship), and their effects on appliance foam performance. Essential responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to the following: Maintains and promotes a safe work environment, complying with safety policies and procedures. Follow safe work practices for personal, equipment, and team member safety, in both the laboratory and in the field. End results are a minimum of safety incidents and a clean, orderly working environment. Leads other by example. Prepare Complex Project Plans in order to establish a sound basis for developing new products and applications. End results are the design of efficient and effective projects, involving experimental approaches. Develops systems and procedures for the technical team to establish practices for project management including proper design intent, project task definitions, major milestones and deliverables and all other information relevant to the systems in place. Secures the establishment of proper product documentation, technical data sheets and process guidelines. Conducts a significant level of technical work as defined in the project plan and documents this work through the appropriate means including laboratory notebooks, interim reports, visit and trial reports, project meeting minutes, and monthly summaries, as well as fully documented technical reports at critical stages in the project cycle. The end result is a body of work, which demonstrates the ability to effectively conduct product development activities and deliver working products to customers. The Scientis Technologist must demonstrate at all times excellent verbal and written communication skill and must ensure that these practices are shared by others. The Scientist Technologist is expected to spend significant portion of his/her time in front of internal and external customers. In these situations, it is the responsibility of the job holder to ask appropriate questions to clarify requirements, expectations and critical performance parameters. The job holder is expected to convert notes from meetings into clear documents, and check for understanding with customers. When required, the job holder must communicate the findings to other team members in order to make sure that actions are addressed and completed on time. The Scientist Technologist must supervise the activities of assigned Laboratory Technicians or other Scientists and technical service specialists. End results are effective coaching and counseling, accurate evaluation of the subordinate capabilities, and visible skill development of the assigned staff. The Scientist Technologist must be familiar with the resources required to start development activities in a new area of work. This may include the effective use of internet searches, technical databases, patent databases and published industrial and academic literature. The expected level of technical expertise is such that the job holder can critically analyze data and conclusions from a variety of technical publications. Again, the job holder must coach others in developing and applying these techniques. General Responsibilities: Follows instructions and performs other duties as may be assigned by supervisor. Assists other employees in accomplishment of Huntsman company goals. Participates in and completes company-required training programs. Participates in Environmental, Health and Safety initiatives as set forth by the company. Education and Work Experience Requirements: A minimum of a Masters Degree in Chemistry, Polymer Chemistry, Polymer Science and Engineering, Material Science and Engineering, Chemical Engineering with 8 years of related experience A minimum of a Doctorate Degree in Chemistry, Polymer Chemistry, Polymer Science and Engineering, Material Science and Engineering, Chemical Engineering with 3 years of related experience is required. Special Qualifications (Training, Technical skills, etc.): Have knowledge in polyether polyol structure and property relationship. Have experience in appliance foam technology. About Huntsman: Huntsman Corporation is a publicly traded global manufacturer and marketer of differentiated chemicals with 2014 revenues of approximately $13 billion including the acquisition of Rockwood's performance additives and TiO2 businesses. Our chemical products number in the thousands and are sold worldwide to manufacturers serving a broad and diverse range of consumer and industrial end markets. We operate more than 100 manufacturing and R&D facilities in more than 30 countries and employ approximately 16,000 associates within our 5 distinct business divisions. For more information about Huntsman, please visit the company's website at www.huntsman.com . Benefits: The successful candidate will receive a competitive salary and will be eligible to participate in a comprehensive benefits package which includes: medical, vision and dental, basic life insurance, AD&D insurance, and 401k. Huntsman is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Please visit www1.eeoc.gov/employers / poster.cfm to view the federal "EEOC is The Law" poster. Accessibility: Huntsman is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you need assistance in filling out the employment application or require an accommodation while seeking employment, please contact one of our offices near you. We will provide your assistance and make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis. Any personal data that you provide to Huntsman International LLC, its subsidiaries or its affiliates (together, "Huntsman") as part of the online recruitment process and / or otherwise for potential employment (including any sensitive personal data) will be handled according to Huntsman's Notice about the Processing of Personal Data of Applicants, which is located on the Company's privacy page at www.Huntsman.com . *LI-JS1 To submit your resume for this job, select how you heard about the job and then click the "Submit Your Resume" button below. AECOM is a premier, fully integrated professional and technical services firm positioned to design, build, finance and operate infrastructure assets around the world for public- and private-sector clients. With nearly 100,000 employees  including architects, engineers, designers, planners, scientists and management and construction services professionals  serving clients in over 150 countries around the world, AECOM is ranked as the #1 engineering design firm by revenue in Engineering News-Record magazines annual industry rankings, and has been recognized by Fortune magazine as a Worlds Most Admired Company. The firm is a leader in all of the key markets that it serves, including transportation, facilities, environmental, energy, oil and gas, water, high-rise buildings and government. AECOM provides a blend of global reach, local knowledge, innovation and technical excellence in delivering customized and creative solutions that meet the needs of clients projects. A Fortune 500 firm, AECOM companies, including URS Corporation and Hunt Construction Group, have annual revenue of approximately $19 billion. More information on AECOM and its services can be found at www.aecom.com. at http://www.aecom.com About the Business Line Environment Our team of environment specialists offers clients expertise in air quality, impact analysis and permitting, environmental health and safety management consulting/due diligence, remediation consulting/engineering and construction/site restoration, specialty and emerging technologies, waste services and water and natural resources. Job Summary As a key member of our Environmental and Sciences team reporting to the Freeport, Texas, business unit, you bring valuable knowledge and skills to every area of our business. We in turn provide you with opportunity to grow, to be challenged, to determine your career footprint and do the best work of your life! If you are energized by challenges and want to contribute in a collaborative environment that supports your career footprint, we welcome you to apply for membership to our elite committed team. The Environmental Scientist will contribute to a technically diverse team that provides on-site consultative support at client facilities. The successful candidate works independently to perform assignments, developing high quality deliverable products with limited instruction or oversight, and is comfortable working with multiple client customers. The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to: Provides technical guidance related to RCRA (40CFR), Waste characterization and Waste regulation in response to client requests Retrieves, reviews and validates client generated waste profile data per Waste Profile Number Obtains missing information or clarifies discrepancies from requesting client Evaluates and approves waste streams by reviewing supporting analytical report results, SDS, process knowledge data, diagrams or narratives to support appropriate classification of waste Ensures waste is properly classified as Hazardous or Non-hazardous by applying RCRA regulations and guidance as well as state regulations and guidance as needed Evaluates and responds to client phone calls, e-mail and inquiries about RCRA regulations, analytical requirements, type of waste containers recommended, options for waste disposals sites, etc. Responsible for quality control of all work products and products of technical and administrative staff assigned Provides general support and direction to more junior-level employees on routine assignments Provides technical peer review for data validation reports and other routine tasks and deliverables Supports marketing initiatives and actively participates in maintaining a safe work environment and supporting a culture of safety as evidenced in approach to daily activities and projects Minimum Requirements Bachelors Degree in Environmental Science or related field 2+ years experience in a petrochemical environment in waste classification or demonstrated equivalent combination of education, skills, knowledge, abilities and experience Knowledgeable of state and federal environmental regulatory framework and processes, specifically RCRA, Waste Characterization and Waste Regulation Ability to communicate verbally and in written form to impart technical information and interact with clients and regulatory personnel Effective time management and analytical skills Qualified applicants who are offered a position are required to pass a pre-employment substance abuse test Must possess valid Drivers license Due to nature and location of work, United States Citizenship or Naturalized Citizenship is required Preferred Qualifications Experience in the Petrochemical Industry RCRA Management of Hazardous Waste Training What We Offer AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an equal opportunity employer and Minorities, Females, Veterans, and Disabled persons are encouraged to apply. For further information, please click here at http://www.aecom.com/content/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/EEO-is-the-Law-poster-supplement.pdf to view the EEO Is The Law poster. Share this job as a link in your status update to LinkedIn. Job Description SUMMARY Performs a wide variety of laboratory analyses to support the manufacturing and releasing of a chemical or product. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Testing of chemical components or products. Will involve the use of major laboratory instruments and equipment: HPLC, GC, FTIR, UV/VIS, as well as utilizing wet chemicals skills. 2. Analytical review of data to ensure calculations is complete and accurate. 3. Performs quantitative chemical analyses of APIs and related materials under direct supervision following established procedures and guidelines using laboratory instrumentation such as gas chromatographs, liquid chromatographs, ultraviolet-visible spectrophotometers, etc. 4. Performs microbiological analysis as required. 5. Treats numerical data throughout chemical analysis by performing mathematical calculations such as determining concentrations (molarity, parts per million, normality, etc.) and statistical information (standard deviation, mean, etc.) 6. Prepares necessary reagents and equipment to expedite the performance of analysis by measuring and/or weighing chemicals, missing and standardizing solutions, and assembling equipment. 7. Maintains accurate records by logging samples received, recording samples analyzed, procedures us3ed and results obtained on datasheets and/or laboratory notebook. 8. Weights and calculates samples in the physical and chemical analysis of products using balances and measured volumetric containers. 9. Recognizes and informs Team Leader about daily lab activity and analytical problems. 10. Organizes and properly labels samples, sample preparations, volumetric solutions etc. 11. Maintains area free of sample contamination restores equipment and supplies to designated area; participates in general housekeeping efforts. 12. As a condition of employment, must maintain compliance of assigned training plan. 13. Participates in the company performance management program on a regular basis as per the established policy. 14. Within area of responsibility, understand and comply with all DPT safety, environmental and quality practices and procedures as outlined in organizational/departmental guidelines and SOPs as well as applicable federal, state and local regulations. 15. Perform other duties as assigned. Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four-year College or university. 2. 0-2 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. title: Scientific Manager Immunology
summary: Provides scientific support and immune monitoring expertise for the evaluation of immunotherapy studies for patients in ongoing clinical trials at MDACC, as...
post_text: Research - Scientific Manager Immunology jobs in Houston at MD Anderson Cancer Center Career Opportunities Locations How to Apply Benefits MD Anderson Cancer Center Jobs > Houston Jobs > Research Jobs Careers Useful Links How to Apply Benefits Working at MD Anderson Working in Houston EEO and Accessibility Military Skills Translator REGIONAL CARE CENTERS LOCATIONS Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands STAY CONNECTED Facebook Twitter Where will you be when cancer is history? At MD Anderson Cancer Center, we bring together the expertise, the technology and the dedication that is moving us closer to our goal of Making Cancer History®. Advanced Search Search Jobs Job Opportunity Apply Now Scientific Manager Immunology Job Location: Houston, TX The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston ranks as one of the world's most respected centers focused on cancer patient care, research, education and prevention. It is one of only 40comprehensive cancer centers designated by the National Cancer Institute. Since U.S. News & World Report began its annual Best Hospitals survey 25 years ago, MD Anderson has ranked No. 1 or No. 2 in cancer care every year. The goal of MDA department of Immunology is to perform multidisciplinary research and educational activities in basic and cancer immunology. Key Functions 1. Leads and manages the operation and administration of the human immune monitoring laboratory of the IMT platform. The human immune monitoring laboratory has 20 members, 2 of them Senior Research Scientists. 2. Leads the team in decision-making process for establishing project goals and guides their accomplishments with cross-organizational impact on multiple projects. 3. Identifies and leverages innovative opportunities across the different projects with the IMT colleagues and external collaborators, including all Pharmaceutical companies that have signed alliances with the IMT. 4. Recruits, educates, evaluates and retains competent qualified personnel for the human immune monitoring laboratory. 5. Ensures compliance with departmental and administrative policies and procedures. 6. Responsible for the development and utilization of multicolor Flow cytometry (17 colors).  Testing of new technologies (e.g. Nanostring, Seromix) and analytic methodologies (e.g. ViSNE) to find new molecular biomarkers that will predict patient response to immunotherapies for internal and external collaborators (pharmaceuticals and/or institutions). 7. Introduces, Integrates and applies novel technologies and/or ideas across multiple projects. 8. Develops and manages protocols (e.g.; IRB protocols), and manuals as needed.  Reviews and updates protocols annually to ensure quality standard procedures are met. 9. Key contact person with the clinical doctors at MDACC and pharmaceutical companies from the IMT alliances for immunotherapy projects in regards of finding molecular biomarkers from flow cytometry and other technologies, including the acquisition and handling of blood samples, tissues, scientific discussion, the analysis approaches, data acquisition and final data evaluation. 10. Develops information that extends knowledge in the field and identifies solutions for potential project problems. 11. Collaborates and provides advice to colleagues and external partners to solve problems and interpret laboratory results within the framework of related studies/projects. 12. Directs, coordinates and/or delegates the collection and examination of data, the evaluation of potential solutions, and the implementation and revaluation of solutions in regards of the immune monitoring studies. 13. Establishes financial plan and budgets and directs the achievement of new equipment for human immune monitoring laboratory. 14. Ensures that specimen collection, analysis, result reporting and turnaround times are optimal and met the scheduled deadlines. 15. Leads and organizes data meetings with clinical doctors at MDACC, as well as with pharmaceutical companies from the IMT alliances. 16. Provides Immune monitroing support and specific assay development for the study of newly discovered molecular biomarkers. 17. Identifies, evaluates and recommends vendors for immune monitoring testing and analysis needs within the platform and for internal and external collaborators. 18. Educates faculty and postdocs from other departments in collaboration with the IMT in the use of high-dimensional flow cytometry analysis, cell sorting, gene expression analysis through Nanostring, Serum antibody analysis through Seromix, high-dimensional ELISPOT assays and others. 19. Educates, trains and guides fellow clinicians in the choice of the most appropriate immune monitoring assays to answer the questions being asked by their clinical trials. 20. Provides scientific support and immune monitoring expertise for the evaluation of immunotherapy studies for patients in ongoing clinical trials at MDACC, as well as patients with clinical trials from outside MDACC with agreements with the IMT for different solid tumor types (e.g. prostate, pancreas, bladder, kidney, liver, lung tumor) and liquid tumors (AML, CLL, MDS). 21. Communicates immune monitoring results in the form of written and oral reports and disseminate regular written project updates to line management and relevant investigators. 22. Researches new technologies to establish a state-of-the-art facility. 23. Authors, reviews and approves internal and external exports and presentations and integration of scientific data for publication in peer-reviewed journals and grant applications. 24. Reviews, evaluates and interprets medical records, patient data, patient specimens and other test results and providing correlation with immune monitoring data. 25. Helps and leads the developing of new procedures and methods (e.g; high throughput tetramer screening using UV-mediated ligand exchange of peptide-MHC class I complexes, high-dimensional flow cytometry analysis through ViSNE) 26. Interpretats and comprehends relevance of printed results and correlation patient data with clinical and research findings. 27. Collaborates on biomarker-driven clinical trial data collection and data analysis of such trials, and provide peer review of biostatistical methodology research activities. 28. Contributes with functional and technical knowledge to consistently introduce new concepts and groundbreaking solutions. 29. Contributing with extensive immune monitoring knowledge for the cancer disease in both. Other Duties as Assigned Education: Required : Bachelor's degree in one of the basic sciences. Preferred: PhD or MD in one of the basic sciences. Experience: Required: Seven years relevant research experience to include two years in a supervisory/managerial capacity. With preferred Masters degree, five years of required experience to include two years in a supervisory/managerial capacity.  With preferred PhD, three years of required experience to include two years in a supervisory/managerial capacity. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105369 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications. Return to the home page Printable Format Job Description - Product Support Engineer (OPE0010U) Job Description Product Support Engineer - OPE0010U Elsevier : NA-USA-TX-Houston Description Your new challenge! We are looking for a strategic and collaborative technical support professional to join Elseviers Education Assessment Solutions Support Team.  The Product Support Engineer, Assessment Solutions  creates Customer Focused resolutions for the Education Assessment Solutions portfolio and carry primary responsibility leading the Assessment Solution Support team, including overseeing and communicating voice of the customer data to the Education stakeholders. If you are eager to get involved in these activities, then this is the role for you. Working Together The Product Support Engineer will work collaboratively with other support groups in execution account resolution and query reduction initiatives as well as new product launch planning and execution activities to support customer demand.  You will report to a Manager, Technical Support.  This position is based in Houston, TX. Your division/department/area/region Operations/Online Solutions Customer Service/Education/US Your responsibilities The Product Support Engineer, Assessment Solutions will to ensure that all customer interactions reflect quality service, are delivered in a courteous manner and that all customer inquiries are answered efficiently and effectively. Acts as a specialist in support of our Assessment Solutions.  In the event that escalation is required to resolve customer inquiry. Takes ownership and serves as the link between the customer and person or party responsible for final resolution.  Effectively manages call center floor by moving resources to maximize workflow. Responsible for Mentoring and coaching team to enhance soft skills, technical ability and to adhere to department standards. Responsible for creating KPOs and assessing performance compliant with the PDP process. Results Orientation: The ability to demonstrate a clear understanding of all the factors affecting improvement of results within the organization Analyzes all options and initiates actions to optimize resources for the achievement of improved results Effective Communication: Requires good communications skills and the ability to maintain positive and cooperative working relations with a broad range of audiences in both a written and oral form Team Leadership and Development: Train, track and mentor individual Technical Support Representative and team performance. Leverage time management for team collaboration, task/workflow prioritization and stream line processes as necessary to achieve KPIs. Uses tools and standards to consistently evaluate staff effectiveness and to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely manner Provide feedback to employees on performance reviews and PDP plan. Advanced Support and Product Knowledge: Provides daily advanced technical support and product expertise on NHP Assessment Solution products and services to faculty, students, authors, and internal employees Conducts research and testing to determine proper escalation or suggested resolution Adhere to identified processes to respond to issues from email, phone, and web Ensures timely follow-up and adherence to quality and consistency of response to ensure a positive customer experience Demonstrated ability to perform technical and administrative duties in back-up of team members Represent Voice of the Customer: Ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions. Ability to collect, interprets, and provides voice of the customer data to improve customer satisfaction and loyalty.  Key KPIs include: FCR, CSAT, Effort Skills Project management expertise Strong problem solving skills Behaviors Interact as a team player, focusing on the goals of the department and continuous feedback and interaction with Sales Support Managers to ensure constant evaluation of departmental efficiency. Deal with customers directly, if necessary. Qualifications Qualifications and Experiences College Degree preferred, equivalent applicable experience will be considered. 3-4 years of call center or front-line customer service experience required. Excellent verbal skills and polished telephone presence. Strong leadership skills as well as a professional attitude and strong service orientation. Problem solving skills and the ability to handle/diffuse difficult situations and resolve issues. The ability to work independently and as part of a team. Self Starter with attention to detail MS Office Suite Experience Worked with Salesforce CRM a plus Some travel may be required What we offer We welcome you to a truly global, dynamic and challenging environment with great opportunities to develop yourself. Elseviers benefits are very competitive. Elsevier is the world's leading provider of scientific, technical and medical (STM) information, tools and resources. A global company based in Amsterdam, Elsevier partners with scientists, researchers, healthcare providers, educators and decision-makers in academic institutions, governments and corporations to help them find, evaluate and use information. Our breadth of content is unparalleled, spanning virtually every STM field in the world and includes such distinguished brands as Gray's Anatomy, The Lancet and Cell. Using innovative technology, we deliver our content through tools that help our customers be more productive and successful in their work. ScienceDirect delivers the worlds' leading journals electronically to over 11 million readers in 200 countries. And physicians in 95 percent of teaching hospitals rely on ClinicalKey to get critical information that can save lives. Elsevier employs over 7,000 people in more than 70 offices worldwide. We are an employer of choice, attracting and developing talented and creative people who thrive in a challenging and fast-paced environment. We offer an excellent compensation and benefits package as well as a real opportunity for career growth in a growing organization. Elsevier is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact 1.877.734.1938 or accommodations@relx.com .

Collaborate with a team of scientists and engineers on projects to conceptualize, design, develop, and implement solutions designed to optimize the performance and increase the efficiencies of the laboratory processes. Principal responsibilities of this position include developing software interfaces for gathering user information and integrate with laboratory robotic systems, creating applications to process and store laboratory data, building rapport with end-users, and coordinating with cross functional teams; preparing the documentation for software qualification and operating procedures, and ensure successful implementation in the lab. Additional responsibilities include user training, troubleshooting, optimizing the software, and on-going support for the end-users. Qualifications Experience developing software required. Flexibility and self-initiative required to support several simultaneous automation projects. Preparing User Requirement and Testing Procedure, Standard Operating Procedures, and related documentations; and overseeing the functional and validation testing, IQ/OQ/PQ is desirable. Requirements BS, MS or minor in computer science, computer programing, bioengineering or closely related field with two to three years of relevant experience. Technical proficiency and experience in automation and systems development and integration for the life science industry is nice to have but not mandatory. Strong organizational skills, and written and verbal communication skills are required.  Flexibility and self-initiative required to support several software projects simultaneously. Preparing User Requirement and Testing Procedure, Standard Operating Procedures, and related documentations; and overseeing the functional and qualification testing. title: Institute Assoc Scientist II Program Biology
summary: As part of the MD Anderson Cancer Center Moon Shot initiative, we have created an exceptional, integrated environment where industry seasoned scientists work...
post_text: United States Research jobs - Institute Assoc Scientist II Program Biology at MD Anderson Cancer Center Career Opportunities Locations How to Apply Benefits MD Anderson Cancer Center Jobs > United States Jobs > Research Jobs Careers Useful Links How to Apply Benefits Working at MD Anderson Working in Houston EEO and Accessibility Military Skills Translator REGIONAL CARE CENTERS LOCATIONS Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands STAY CONNECTED Facebook Twitter Where will you be when cancer is history? At MD Anderson Cancer Center, we bring together the expertise, the technology and the dedication that is moving us closer to our goal of Making Cancer History®. Advanced Search Search Jobs Job Opportunity Apply Now Institute Assoc Scientist II Program Biology Job Location: Houston, TX The mission of The Center for Co-Clinical Trials (CCCT) is to integrate biological insights with drug discovery expertise to accelerate the development of innovative targeted cancer therapeutics for unmet oncology needs.  The CCCT partners with the Institute for Applied Cancer Science (IACS) to integrate ground-breaking translational research teams with world-class drug discovery scientists while leveraging a state of the art computational biology infrastructure, unparalleled access to patient samples and an industry seasoned in vivo pharmacology unit.  CCCT cross functional teams aim to deliver biological insights to enable rapid translation of novel agents and therapeutic regimens to the clinic targeting the most responsive patients.  As part of the MD Anderson Cancer Center Moon Shot initiative, we have created an exceptional, integrated environment where industry seasoned scientists work side by side with highly successful academic scientists and clinicians to accelerate the development of therapeutics.  We are seeking the most dedicated, highly motivated individuals who will help us reach our goal of delivering safer, more effective treatments to our patients. The Institute Research Scientist II participates in cross-functional research to identify and validate novel oncology targets, and translate these finding into novel oncology therapeutic agents to benefit patients.  The Associate Scientist II in Target Biology will be responsible for providing molecular and cell biology support for the validation of emerging drug discovery targets and/or provide target biology support for internal drug discovery programs. KEY FUNCTIONS · Under moderate supervision, conducts experiments and/or executes on research plans to advance the objectives of CCCT. · Executes standard protocols and assays, and assists in developing novel experimental procedures. · Works closely with manager/team to execute experiments on defined timelines to produce deliverables that enable go/no-go decisions on targets and/or programs. · Interacts closely with other research staff across institutional functional teams. · Records and evaluates data in accordance with methods requested, and presents data to the research project team. · Participate in an integrated drug discovery research team by engaging in interaction with scientists of different disciplines. · Employs safe lab practices. · Maintains detailed laboratory notebook. EDUCATION Required: Bachelor's degree in Biology, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Cell Biology, Enzymology, Pharmacology, Chemistry or related field. EXPERIENCE Required: Eighteen months of relevant research laboratory experience. With preferred degree, no required experience. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105587 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications. summary: The Lead Research Project Manager will work under the supervision of the CAR Director and bridge a translational team of investigators, mentees and staff that...
post_text: University of Texas Medical Branch Jobs - Lead Research Project Manager in Galveston, Texas, United States Navigate Home About Us Institutional Vision UTMB Living Holiday Schedule President's Office Campus Map Tour of Campus Campus Web Cams Benefits Current Employees Employee Rights Search All Jobs Where city, state What job title, keywords View all Jobs Home About Us Institutional Vision UTMB Living Holiday Schedule President's Office Campus Map Tour of Campus Campus Web Cams Benefits Current Employees Employee Rights University of Texas Medical Branch Jobs Where city, state, country What job title, keywords Home View All Jobs ( 616 ) The University of Texas Medical Branch Lead Research Project Manager in Galveston , Texas Min Qualifications Master's degree in scientific field and three years related experience Job Description: Works with Principal Investigator, study team and senior department administration to assure that project budgets and schedules are executed in a timely manner. Salary Range Commensurate with experience This is a band code CS23 Specific Job Related Duties The Center for Addiction Research ( CAR ) at the University of Texas Medical Branch (UTMB) is leveraging institutional target-based discovery and translational research, disease-specific knowledge and specialized core technologies toward new therapeutics for addictions and related chronic health disorders. The goal is to translate basic science knowledge of targets into a portfolio of novel small molecules, peptides and vaccines to enable biological insight into disease pathway and biomarkers, and advance to preclinical drug candidates. The Lead Research Project Manager will oversee the design, optimization, conduct and application of cellular signaling assays to screen activity of new molecules and will coordinate moving new chemical entities through screening, maintain critical molecule databases, actualize patent applications and organize interactions across campus, industry and NIH. The Lead Research Project Manager will work under the supervision of the CAR Director and bridge a translational team of investigators, mentees and staff that cross the barriers of technologies (chemistry, cell biology, animal models, clinical science, structural biology), biomedical disorder (addictions, cancer, infectious diseases, neurodegeneration, etc.), institutions and industry partners. The Lead Research Project Manager will be experienced in drug discovery and translational research and will serve as the lynchpin in amplifying the cross-institutional efforts through consistent communication and organization of efforts. The successful candidate will conduct innovative scientific investigation consistent with the mission of molecular therapeutics and drug discovery in the center and on campus. This fully trained scientist will be committed to the discovery of new innovative biomedical and health knowledge leading to increasingly effective care and will conduct and publish high quality research findings and write/fund grants to support research in this arena. Specific Job Related Duties Lead drug discovery/molecular therapeutics initiatives, conduct cellular, molecular and preclinical research to explore and validate new candidate medications for addictions and related biomedical disorders Serve as program manager for CAR and campus initiatives in drug discovery and translational research Design, optimize and conduct cellular signaling assays appropriate for first-level analyses of new molecules; write and update assay standard operating procedures including centralized data management Establish research objectives and methodology, design procedures, conduct research projects, analyze, interpret and publish results and fund external grants and contracts Direct the research and administrative operations of the CAR Cellular and Molecular Biology Core Interface and establish rapport with faculty, mentees and staff of all levels across campus and collaborating institutions, agencies, and contractors Preferred Skill/Competency Preferred Qualifications: Terminal degree (Ph.D, M.D, or equivalent) and two years of related experience or a masters degree and eight years of related experience Must possess written and verbal communications expertise, demonstrated leadership, initiative and exceptional interpersonal skills Closing Statement #rsch #admin Equal Employment Opportunity UTMB Health strives to provide equal opportunity employment without regard to race, color, national origin, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information or veteran status. As a VEVRAA Federal Contractor, UTMB Health takes affirmative action to hire and advance women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.
