Barrios Careers Careers / Results Title: Orbital Debris Radar Software Scientist/Engineer Location: Houston, Texas 77058 (Clear Lake, Near NASA JSC) Job Number: 3947 Requirements: This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a "US Person" as defined by 22 C.F.R. section 120.15 is required.  Must be authorized to work in the U.S. Relocation Allowance: No Description: - Develop, document, integrate, maintain and operate radar data reduction and analysis computer tools - Participate in experiments with space surveillance radars such as HUSIR, HAX, and the NASA Goldstone Solar System
Radar - Participate in experiments to improve computer models of the space debris environment - Work closely with JETS Orbital Debris Research & Science Operations (ODRSO) colleagues and our NASA customers
Orbital Debris Program Office (ODPO) - Support and participate in technical interchange meetings - Present work products to customers and counterparts (written & verbal) - Perform other duties as required Experience/Skills: - Experience in radar software signal and data processing - Experience with radar calibration software, Fourier Transform signal processing, radar matched filters, target detection software and algorithms, and noise reduction techniques - Experience with software development/maintenance - Experience with modern computer languages (C/C++, FORTRAN, Python) - Experience in analyzing radar data and determining trends, uncertainties, and error sources - Ability to work with radar system engineers to troubleshoot radar data/data processing problems and determine the
appropriate corrective actions - Willing to travel to conferences and radar installations occasionally (domestic and international) Preferences: - Experience planning for radar measurements of Earth-orbiting objects - Experience directing radar tests - Experience with computational applications, e.g. MATLAB, and Excel - Experience working as part of an interdisciplinary team - Demonstration of strong communication skills - Demonstration of creativity, conception, vision, and personal initiative Computer: Experience with modern computer languages (C/C++, FORTRAN, Python Education: For the scientist : BS degree from an accredited college or university in Physics or a closely related field and four (4) years related
experience, or MS degree in Physics or a closely related field with two (2) years of related experience, or Ph.D. in Physics
or a closely related field. For the Engineer : BS degree in engineering from an accredited engineering school and five (5) years of related engineering experience, or
a MS degree from an accredited engineering school and four (4) years of related engineering experience, or Ph.D. from
an accredited engineering school and zero (0) years of related experience. Essential Requirements: Applicant selected will be subject to government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.  Work may involve sitting for extended periods.  May require lifting and carrying up to 25 lb.  Must have sufficient mobility to enter areas of test facilities where necessary.  Generally an office environment, but can involve inside or outside work depending on task.  Standard office equipment (PC, telephone, fax, etc.) Regular attendance in accordance with established work schedule is critical.  Ability to work outside normal schedule and adjust schedule to meet peak periods and surge requirements when required.  Must be able to work in a team atmosphere.  Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation.  Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk/hazard to the employee or others. Click here to email a resume for this opening

The field testing projects will include testing the best genetics from our industry leading canola, corn, cotton, sorghum, soybean and wheat breeding programs as well as working with leading edge technology from Commercial, Discovery Traits and Chemistry. Twenty years from now, the earths population will need 55% more food than it can produce now. Today, Monsanto is working with farmers around the world to do something about it. In over 60 countries, Monsanto has established industry-leading products because we give professionals the freedom to make real decisions. Monsanto is an Employer Of Choice with an outstanding professional development program and a history of building careers. Make an impact by joining the team that is working to solve one of mankinds greatest challenges. This position will report to the Lubbock, Texas location, but can be located within the plains region of Texas. Responsibilities include:  Work independently to administer and provide maintenance of testing locations and operating research planting and harvesting equipment  Preparation for/and planting, field plot maintenance, data collection and harvesting  Interact with scientists and breeders on and off-site for project related needs  Participate in task-related document creation and process review for job-related activities  Ensure that company assets are well-cared for and properly maintained  Establish long-term relationships with cooperators to locate and rent appropriate yield trial land on an annual basis  Manage testing and evaluation of new biotechnology traits and other new products at the off site locations  Maintain Monsantos Freedom to Operate by adhering to all Federal and State Regulatory Compliance requirements  Administer and execute Regulatory Science projects to ensure compliance  Responsible for specific aspects of the home sites safety program  Responsible for recruiting and sourcing part time in season labor to help ensure program success  Develop and maintain relationships with Technology Development Reps & Sales Reps to help steward current products and introduce new products Required Education and Skills/Experience:  Minimum of a Bachelors Degree (or higher) in Agronomy, Weed Science, Entomology, Soil Science, Plant Pathology or a closely related field  Minimum of two or more years of post graduate experience in plot research  Training and experience in experimental design, field test plot management, statistics and data interpretation  Ability to obtain State Certified Pesticide Applicators license  Strong computer skills in MS Office  Demonstrated self-discipline, ability to function effectively without direct supervision, and ability to work effectively with others  Demonstrated ability to develop strong interpersonal relationships  Effective verbal and written communication skills  Ability to provide technical leadership to product and project teams  Excellent time management skills  Experience operating agricultural equipment  Ability to push, lift or pull up to 50 lbs.  Ability to work in strained or cramped positions  Ability to travel 50% of the time within the region including overnight stays Desired Education and Skills/Experience:  Bachelors Degree with six or more years of experience OR- Masters Degree (or higher) in Agronomy, Weed Science, Entomology, Soil Science, Plant Pathology or a closely related field  Ability to obtain a class A CDL driver's license  Strong computer skills utilizing scientific software  Previous farm experience  Prior experience with equipment maintenance and repair Who is Monsanto? Monsanto is an agriculture company with more than 20,000 employees focused on making a balanced meal accessible to everyone. We work to help farmers produce food in a more sustainable way. We think about how our food is grown so farmers have the tools they need to have better harvests. We believe that bringing diverse perspectives together is the most effective way to develop creative solutions to some of the worlds biggest challenges. Career opportunities at Monsanto range from farming, plant breeding, chemistry and engineering to marketing, environmental science, IT and many other areas. Were always looking for exceptional professionals interested in developing a strong career while collaborating to develop solutions for sustainable agriculture. Sound like a job for you? Why work with us?  Life at Monsanto means collaborating with dedicated professionals in a stimulating environment  Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships  You will work with market leading brand products in a global organization  We provide competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and some of the best career development opportunities in the industry  Monsanto is named Great Place to Work in many countries around the world Join our global team where your contribution will make a real difference! apply now Apply Later Share Facebook Twitter Email LinkedIn Recent Jobs Territory Sales Manager - Mansa - , Senior Manager-Tax Financial Reporting - St. Louis, Missouri China Corporate Engagement Lead - Beijing, Beijing HR Lead- Soda Springs Manufacturing Site - Soda Springs, Idaho Territory Sales Manager - Nizamabad - , Andhra Pradesh Useful Links Monsanto Sustainability Careers Viewpoints Awards and Recognitions Students Diversity at Monsanto Discover Monsanto Awards Follow us on the web: Facebook Twitter LinkedIn YouTube Blog stay in the loop with our job news and events Email Address Area of interest Search for a category, location, or category/location pair, select a term from the suggestions, and click "Add". title: Clinical Technical Supervisor
summary: Clinical Laboratory Technical Supervisor/Certifying Scientist. The technical supervisor is responsible for technical and scientific oversight of the laboratory...
post_text: Clinical Technical Supervisor job - Imperial Laboratories, LLC - Dallas, TX | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip Clinical Technical Supervisor Imperial Laboratories, LLC - Dallas, TX Job Description: Clinical Laboratory Technical Supervisor/Certifying Scientist PURPOSE: The technical supervisor is responsible for technical and scientific oversight of the laboratory and responsible for interpreting MS (Mass Spectrometry) data, both LC and GC. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Reviewing and preparing final reports based on all data submitted and assay results. Following the laboratory procedures for specimen handling and processing, test analysis, reporting and maintaining records of patient test results. Recognizing deviations from expected results and following up appropriately. Participating in proficiency testing and maintaining a record of on-going competency. Evaluating and solving problems related to the collection and processing of specimens. Assuming supervisory duties as assigned and empowered by the lab management. Performing appropriate Quality Control procedures and producing reports. Reporting the QC results to the Director, or Designee and carrying out under the direction of the Director or Designee, troubleshooting and corrective actions of questionable or out-of-limit results. Documenting all corrective actions and submitting them for review by the Director or Designee. Resolving and/or escalating issues in a timely fashion. Communicating difficult and sensitive information tactfully. Defining problems, collecting information, establishing facts, and drawing valid conclusions. Working effectively to bring people together to accomplish specific goals/outcomes. Representing the Company in a positive, professional manner with the highest ethical integrity; Adhering to confidential HIPAA requirements (patient files, personal and proprietary information). Preparing special reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends. Maintaining professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Maintaining a productive relationship with each internal department within the company. Providing other duties consistent with a Certifying Scientist role within the Company, as requested. Must be accessible to testing personnel at all times to provide on-site, telephone, or electronic consultation. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree or higher in either Medical Technology or Chemistry, or closely related field and two years of lab training or experience in the high complexity testing specialties performed. Experience with instruments and routine equipment used in a clinical laboratory, specifically LC-MS; and its technical and mechanical indicators of malfunction; and the ability to maintain, troubleshoot, and repair (minor) as needed to prevent errors and problems Ability to analyze, review and interpret test results for both analytical and clinical integrity Basic knowledge of laboratory quality control and assurance procedures and principles of performance improvement Understand legal, regulatory, accreditation standards, and Federal and state laws such as CLIA as required in patient testing as well as an understanding of safety (OSHA) and security (HIPPA) regulations, practices and procedures to ensure work is consistent with standards Must be a US citizen or eligible to work in the US for any employer. No sponsorship will be provided. Job Description Print Preview Apply Apply using LinkedIn Save Job Email Job to Friend Return to List A WORLD LEADER IN TESTING, INSPECTION & CERTIFICATION SERVICES Bureau Veritas offers dynamic, exciting employment opportunities with an attractive salary/benefit package and an opportunity to play a vital role with a global organization. If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a stellar team of professionals, we invite you to apply online today. Bureau Veritas is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such we recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, sexual orientation, genetics, status as a protected veteran, or any other non-job-related characteristics. This position is responsible to ensure equal opportunity in employment in that all persons are treated equally and on the basis of merit, in decisions regarding selection, placement, promotions, training, work assignments, transfers and other personnel actions. City: Houston State: Texas SUMMARY: Direct the process of Laboratory instrument chemical and physical test method instrumentation development, diagnostics, and test method problem solving required for quality control of processes and petroleum and petrochemical products. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPSONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be designated based on the business requirements. Technical representative for Inspectorate with external petroleum bodies Business development support Direct the Technical Services and Support Team which: Performs and advises personnel in special instrument repairs and test procedures to analyze components and physical properties of materials. Responsible for and assisting in advanced troubleshooting instrumentation problems. Compiles and analyzes test information to determine operating efficiency of process or equipment and to diagnose malfunctions. Confers with scientists, engineers and vendors to conduct analyses, interpret test results, or develop nonstandard diagnostic tests to make instrument repairs. Ability to utilize formulas and processes based on test results. Tests and analyzes sample products while in the test validation stage of instrument repairs. Investigates complaints on existing instrument and software problems on a daily basis and can manage multiple ongoing instrument problems. Laboratory test method development; establishes or adjusts work procedures to meet standard test methods. Recommends measures to improve testing procedures, use of equipment, and specifies new analytical test instrumentation. Analyzes and resolves, or assists workers in solving laboratory instrument problems. Responsible for maintaining proper inventory of supplies required in operation of the technical services and support team. Lead role in the development of the technical services and support team. Assists in the all of the development of the technical services and support team, to assure this team expands the breadth and scope of Inspectorate America Corp. capabilities. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Direct manager of personnel of the Technical Services and Support team Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organizations policies and applicable laws QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: Bachelors degree or higher, advanced degree preferred, in a science related filed. Minimum of 10+ years related instrument repair, design and testing experience Minimum 5+ years of laboratory management LANGUAGE SKILLS: Shall posses the ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Shall posses the ability to write reports, business correspondence, procedures, and test methods. Shall posses the ability to effectively present technical information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS: Ability to add, subtracts, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Shall posses the ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. Shall posses the ability to interpret technical reports related to chemicals and their properties. Shall posses the ability to follow electronic schematics and perform system diagnostics. Shall posses the ability to interpret scientific formulas. REASONING ABILITY: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. CERTIFICATES, REGISTRATIONS, AND LICENSES: Valid drivers license required. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk; sit; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds with proper tools. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those and employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works near moving mechanical parts and with explosive material and can be regularly exposed to fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, and risk of electrical shock. The employee is occasionally exposed to risk radiation. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate. When required, the proper personal protective equipment shall be used, accordingly. Shall be available on short notice to travel to any Inspectorate America Corporation office or laboratory in the process of providing technical support. The travel related to work shall be dependent upon Inspectorate America Corporations business requirements. If you are an individual with a disability and you would like us to assist you with searching the Careers Page site for employment opportunities and/or assistance with completing your profile and application, please contact us at 1-888-357-7020 or email us with your request to USinfor@us.bureauveritas.com We are happy to assist you and encourage you to consider Bureau Veritas for your next great career opportunity! Applications without  transcripts will NOT be considered** Performs complex work supervising all aspects of evidential breath testing within a set geographic area. Trains, tests and renews certification of breath test operators in assigned area. Testifies as an expert witness in court as to results of breath test analyses. Maintains and repairs breath test equipment. Participates in training personnel. Exercises progressive independence in the execution of duties which are subject to evaluation. Work is performed under supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. State Classification #: 6052-6054 State Classification Title: Forensic Scientist I-III Salary Group: B19-B21 The following Military Occupational Specialty codes are generally applicable to this position. Applicants must fully complete the summary of experience to determine if minimum qualifications are met. 44DX, 61CX. General Duties: Performs technical supervision of certified breath test programs as stated in the Texas Breath Alcohol Testing Regulations, which involves specialized chemical analyses and preparation of chemical solutions, technical reports, the repair and maintenance of electronic breath testing equipment, supervision of breath test operators as to operation, care, and knowledge of breath testing instruments, interpretation of technical data and presentation of this information in an understandable manner in testimony to lay juries in courts of law, keeping records of activities performed, working with personal computers, working independently with general instructions, and performing related duties as assigned. Researches forensic science field and studies current material in scientific journals regarding new advances and techniques in alcohol testing. Lectures to or instructs law enforcement groups, schools, and others at the discretion of, or, in absence of supervisor. Initiates and/or conducts experiments or research with new procedures and techniques as assigned. Represents the Department at conferences and meetings. Performs related duties as assigned. Education and Experience: Forensic Scientist I Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in Chemistry, or with a major in another scientific field including a minimum of eighteen (18) hours in Chemistry, no more than eight (8) hours of which may be freshman level. Forensic Scientist II Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in Chemistry, or with a major in another scientific field including a minimum of eighteen (18) hours in Chemistry and a minimum of one (1) year of work experience as a Breath Test Forensic Scientist I or the equivalent experience as a Technical Supervisor in another certified Texas Breath Alcohol Testing Program, or as per current Texas Breath Alcohol Testing Regulations requirements. Forensic Scientist III Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with a major in Chemistry, or with a major in another scientific field including a minimum of eighteen (18) hours in Chemistry and a minimum of two (2) years of work experience as a Breath Test Forensic Scientist II (four [4] years total) or the equivalent experience as a Technical Supervisor in another certified Texas Breath Alcohol Testing Program or as per current Texas Breath Alcohol Testing Regulations requirements. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES Knowledge of criminal court proceedings. Knowledge of the proper safety procedures for the handling of the numerous hazardous caustic, flammable, and/or carcinogenic chemicals. Knowledge of the principles, theories, and practices of breath alcohol testing including knowledge of laboratory equipment, scientific instrumentations, and physical examinations as applied to the laws governing breath test related offenses. Knowledge of criminal court proceedings and rules of evidence. Working knowledge of rules of evidence, and courtroom demeanor. Thorough knowledge of departmental rules, regulations, policies and procedures. Working knowledge of the principles, theories, and practices of breath alcohol testing including knowledge of laboratory equipment, scientific instrumentations, and physical examinations as applied to the laws governing breath test related offenses. Skill in use of laboratory equipment and materials. Skill in expert witness testimony in courts of law. Ability to learn departmental rules, regulations, policies and procedures in a timely manner. Ability to communicate findings, orally and in writing, in a clear, concise, and effective manner. Ability to present scientific data in an understandable manner to lay juries. Ability to conduct complex analyses and prepare detailed technical reports. Ability to work effectively with laboratory, legal, and police personnel. Ability to work effectively with laboratory, legal, and law enforcement personnel. Ability to present scientific data and the results of analyses to a lay jury in an understandable manner. Supplemental information: DPS employee who is selected for a position in their current salary group and state title will be transferred with no salary change. DPS employee who is selected for a position in their current salary group with a new state title may receive an increase up to 3.4%. Salary is contingent upon qualifications and is subject to salary administration and budgetary restrictions. DUE TO THE HIGH VOLUME OF APPLICATIONS WE DO NOT ACCEPT TELEPHONE CALLS.  ONLY CANDIDATES SELECTED FOR INTERVIEW WILL BE CONTACTED. Travel: 50% Number of Vacancies: 1 State of Texas retirees may be rehired for full-time, non-commissioned positions only under very specific circumstances. Job Application for Maintenance Technician at Magic Leap, Inc. Apply Now Maintenance Technician at Magic Leap, Inc. We are growing quickly, and this is the time to get on board and play a role in shaping the way people will be interacting with the world tomorrow. Job Description This position will be responsible for maintaining existing process equipment and developing best practices to reduce equipment downtime. Candidates must determine, order and maintain spare parts and tooling required for maintenance. Candidates must be highly innovative and enjoy working in a dynamic and creative environment within a multi-disciplinary team. Responsibilities Develop innovative solutions Interact with vendors and process engineers on equipment installation and qualification Initiate equipment maintenance with disciplined data collection and interpretation Implement and review equipment performance charts Assist Engineers with design of experiments Research and purchase new equipment Advise on corrective action plans Document and report results of maintenance activities Participate in yield improvement team efforts Write and maintain work instructions related to equipment maintenance Improve equipment uptime while maintaining and improving quality standards Hands-on mentality working in a team orientated environment Work as needed to meet organizational production milestones determine and maintain spare parts and miscellaneous equipment for maintenance Qualifications Knowledge of hi-tech manufacturing equipment troubleshooting and repair techniques Ability to learn and train others on process/metrology equipment repair Extensively collect and document equipment related data/procedures Education B.S. in related field Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier. How do I know if I have a disability? You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. title: Project Manager (S&T)
summary: Reports to the Applied Analytics Scientist (Futures). The Project Manager (S&T) performs a broad range of strategic planning, project lifecycle management, data...
post_text: Recuiter Openings | Careers | NSS RPO | VA : NSS RPO MENU About NSS RPO in the News Our Story Leadership Team Capabilities Overview Employers Solutions RPO Q&A White Paper Government Contracting Recruiters Join Our Team Why I Chose NSS RPO Careers Blog Contact Contact Us Request Our Services About NSS RPO in the News Our Story Leadership Team Capabilities Overview Employers Solutions RPO Q&A White Paper Government Contracting Recruiters Join Our Team Why I Chose NSS RPO Careers Blog Contact Contact Us Request Our Services Home » Careers Careers Back to Jobs Project Manager (S&T) Location: Arlington, VA Salary: Posted: Apr 4 Position Title: Project Manager (S&T) Location: Arlington, Virginia Virginia Tech Applied Research Corporation: The Virginia Tech Applied Research Corporation (VT-ARC) complements the broad and rich research enterprise found at Virginia Tech. VT-ARC forms multi-disciplinary teams to apply innovative solutions to the real-world problems that strain our social, political, industrial, and economic foundations.  Specializing in the identification and use of fundamental research, VT-ARC performs contract R&D on larger scale problems and at technology readiness levels beyond those generally addressed by academia.  VT-ARC combines significant technical expertise with program management skills to deliver robust solutions on schedule and on budget. Responsibilities: The Project Manager (S&T) performs a broad range of strategic planning, project lifecycle management, data collection, analysis, and synthesis in support of science and technology focused clients across Government, Academia, and Industry. A key member of the Information Sciences Team, the Project Manager provides vision, oversight, task management and direct support to S&T focused projects, which provide situational awareness on emerging science and technology, S&T innovation, research collaborator networks, and science indicators to decision makers. Required Education, Certifications, Skills, Capabilities : Master's degree in scientific discipline. Prior experience working in or with U.S. Defense S&T organizations and programs. Record of innovation and creative problem solving. Strong interpersonal and teambuilding skills. Strong verbal and written communications skills. Experience envisioning and building projects from the ground up. Demonstrable critical and creative thinking abilities. Innovative and entrepreneurial mindset. Strong ability to grasp the big picture and seize the initiative. Attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to work as a team contributor with a mission focus and emphasis on service, integrity, and excellence. Must be a U.S. citizen willing and able to hold a U.S. security clearance. Desired Education, Certifications, Skills, Capabilities : PhD in scientific discipline strongly preferred. Advanced knowledge or experience in machine learning, human-computer interaction, human-machine collaboration, or related discipline highly desired. Prior experience supporting non-DoD U.S. Government S&T organizations. Prior experience serving clients in Academia. PMP certification. Active security clearance preferred. TS highly preferred. Duties The duties of this position shall include, but are not necessarily limited to (and not listed in priority order) : Reports to the Applied Analytics Scientist (Futures). Manages projects related to S&T organizational growth and development strategy and planning including strategic partnering. Provides input and expertise in the design of S&T forecasting roadmaps and processes. Manages and participates in data collection, organization, analysis, and synthesis to develop science indicators. Works closely with subject matter experts across a range of S&T disciplines. Works jointly with cross-functional info-science teams to identify information gaps, collect and organize key elements of information. Job Application for Manager (Accounting) at Magic Leap, Inc. Apply Now Manager (Accounting) at Magic Leap, Inc. Austin, TX Company Description Magic Leap is an eclectic group of visionaries, rocket scientists, wizards, and gurus from the fields of film, robotics, visualization, software, computing, and user experience. We are growing quickly, and this is the time to get on board and play a role in shaping the way people will be interacting with the world tomorrow. Job Description Accounting Lead responsible for general accounting, accounts payable, cost accounting, cash forecasting, inventory management, closing the books, and financial reporting deliverables to Magic Leap corporate office. Support integration of MII accounting activities into the Magic Leap Inc.s accounting infrastructure Qualifications In depth knowledge of General Accounting and Finance functions, including, but not limited to, Procure-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash and Record-to-Report. Experience with accounting processes and controls in ERP environments. Background in Manufacturing finance, with a focus on capital equipment and R&D. Experience with business process development and project management. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence; Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations; Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals; Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial level reports, and legal documents. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions; Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables; Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems; Ability to deal with a variety of abstract and concrete variables. To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Accounting software; Contact Management systems; Database software; Internet software; Inventory software; Order Processing systems; Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software. Education BS in Accounting with CPA or MBA, and no less than ten years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines.   As a government contractor subject to Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure
  the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories
  is as follows: A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985. Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities 1 .  To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability.  Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out.  If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way. If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way.  Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years.  You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier. How do I know if I have a disability? You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to: Blindness Deafness Cancer Diabetes Epilepsy Autism Cerebral palsy HIV/AIDS Schizophrenia Muscular dystrophy Bipolar disorder Major depression Multiple sclerosis (MS) Missing limbs or partially missing limbs Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) Obsessive compulsive disorder Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation) Disability Status - Select - Yes, I have a disability (or previously had a disability) No, I don't have a disability I don't wish to answer Reasonable Accommodation Notice Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities.    Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job.  Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. 1 Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.  For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labors Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp . title: Research Statistical Analyst
summary: Assesses relevant literature as well as existing data, evaluates the quality of data used in reports and assists with preparation and distribution of data for...
post_text: Research Statistical Analyst - job details by MedicalWorkers.com the Job the Location Job Title, Company or Skill City, State or Zip Code Advanced Search Sign in Research Statistical Analyst POSITION INFORMATION Location: Houston, TEXAS Company: MD Anderson Cancer Center Job Code: l%2fresearch-statistical-analys Posted On: 4/10/2016 DESCRIPTION Apply Now Research Statistical Analyst Job Location: Houston, TX The mission of the Department of Bioinformatics and Computational Biology is to conduct collaborative research with clinical and basic science departments, and to support the need for quantitative sciences in the fields of genomics, proteomics, radiotherapy, molecular and cell biology and computer-assisted diagnoses and image analysis.      The Bioinformatics Group will develop statistically rigorous solutions for the design and analysis of experiments within the Cancer Genomics Program, and will provide data analysis, acquisition, curation and retrieval tools to complement the laboratory services offered by the Cancer Genomics Program.      KEY FUNCTIONS:      1. Statistical Consulting and Collaboration o Compiles, analyzes and reports statistical data for various projects including, but not limited to manual and computer-aided data abstraction and evaluation, clinical trials, computerized imaging and bioinformatics.   *  Prepares statistical considerations for basic trial designs and carries out uncomplicated statistical analyses independently, but completes statistical responsibilities for more complex projects with supervision.   *  Assists faculty in the development of new statistical methodology for measurement and analysis of data.   *  Applies advanced statistical methods, simulation models, and skilled statistical programming as needed.   *  Assesses relevant literature as well as existing data, evaluates the quality of data used in reports and assists with preparation and distribution of data for committee and scientific meetings.   *  Attends project meetings with collaborators with or without supervisor as directed by supervisor.   *  May present findings at relevant meetings both inside and outside of the institution as requested.      2. Protocol Review:   * Participates in the protocol review process jointly with supervisor.      3. Statistical Reporting:   * Prepares written reports to investigators jointly with supervisor.   * May present findings at relevant meetings both inside and outside of the institution as requested.      4. Other duties as assigned.    EDUCATION   Required: Master's degree in Biostatistics, Statistics, Bioinformatics, Mathematics or related field       EXPERIENCE  Required: Two years experience with mainframe and/or PC databases, document processing, and statistical software such as SAS and S-Plus. With preferred degree, no required experience. title: Director, Consumer Insights
summary: The Director Consumer Insights leads the Consumer Insights, Audience Understanding and Analytics teams in a way that is consistent with the organizations goal...
post_text: Director, Consumer Insights  Jobs at Texas Health Careers Join our Talent Network Search Jobs Why Texas Health Benefits and Rewards Contact Us Director, Consumer Insights HOME > Director, Consumer Insights  Arlington, TX Share this Job: 0 Apply for job Location: Arlington, TX US Job ID: 77287 Department: Consumer Insights - Research Area of Interest: Marketing/Public Relations Job Type: Full Time Qualifications: Overview: Texas Health Resources System Services Qualifications/Duties Does the thought of creating a revolutionary and unprecedented Brand Experience in healthcare get you excited?  Are you at home knee deep in data research?  Do you have a knack for digging into analytics and a passion to bring about meaningful business decisions? If so, then you could be the person Texas Health Resources Brand Experience is looking for, with an exciting new opportunity as the Director Consumer Insights. Meet the New Brand Experience: First and foremost, individuals in the Brand Experience Division seek to exemplify and champion the guiding principles of Texas Health Resources.  As keepers and protectors of the brand, individuals in this division abide by a deep commitment to the foundation on which the Texas Health culture is built. We exist to transform human experiences in healthcare. Brand Experience Division Pillars We are people advocates!  The people we serve are at the core of what we do and why we do it. We see health care through their eyes, and such, we tirelessly advocate on their behalf.  Characteristics that embody this pillar include compassion, empathy, persistence and passion. We are stronger when we collaborate!  We are catalysts of knowledge sharing. We are all in this together and we go out of our way to engage and align ourselves with people across the division and organization.  Characteristics that embody this pillar include open-mindedness, excellent listening skills, generosity, a proactive stance and direct communication. We are nimble and adaptable to change!  Innovation is our competitive advantage. We embrace fresh ideas and new approaches to redefine how we work and how we deliver value.  Characteristics that embody this pillar include innovation, creativity, a willingness to take calculated risks, boldness, and being both objective and receptive. We are powered by data and insights!  We are champions of learning. We look both inside and outside of our industry for inspiration and knowledge because it elevates our work and the end product we deliver to those we serve.  Characteristics that embody this pillar include being analytical, thoughtful, and resourceful. We drive business results!  We are disciplined business leaders focused on measurement and outcomes. Everything we do has clear strategic intent because we recognize the impact our decisions have on our business, our brand, our people and our communities.  Characteristics that embody this pillar include intentionality, discernment, and willingness to disagree without being disagreeable. Introducing the Consumer Insights Division of Brand Experience: These are our researchers, thinkers and analytical-minded scientists. They take data and turn it into meaningful insights that help our entity, digital, stakeholder and marketing teams develop interesting and differentiable offerings. They look beyond healthcare to learn from other industries and emerging business models. They harness the wants and preferences of consumers and stakeholders to help make us better. A Position with Analytic Drive: The Director Consumer Insights leads the Consumer Insights, Audience Understanding and Analytics teams in a way that is consistent with the organizations goal of building a living insights engine as a foundation for organizational decision-making aimed at: fresh and innovative insights/business opportunities; insights that fuel inspiring creative ideas/solutions; and gauges consumer perceptions for products, services and messages.  The Director oversees a team of two (2) direct reports. An Opportunity to Lead Change: The Director Consumer Insights manages and supervises all phases of consumer/audience insights research including proposal, design, questionnaire development, analysis, reporting, and presentations. This Individual manages and researches vendor relationships and leads consumer/audience research initiatives. The Director collaborates closely with system and division leadership to provide and communicate key consumer/audience insights that will inform and shape patient/consumer experiences for new and existing programs and services. This includes maintaining an ongoing needs assessment for the organization around the ideal whats next questions that need to be answered.  This leader leverages primary and secondary research to proactively understand and identify opportunities, needs, and trends as it pertains to various audience groups. The Director is responsible for reporting and presenting research findings to senior leaders sharing relevant insights, trends, and consumer feedback. This individual will deconstruct complex research results into simple, clear, and meaningful information that can be distributed more broadly across the organization. This Director leads the development and ongoing management of the research and insights digital repository to include all research and audience understanding work/learnings taken on by the organization, including the creation of an integrated data repository that enables ongoing brand tracking and measurement. The repository should allow end users (both inside and outside of the division, as well as key strategic partners) to easily search for and navigate existing research by topic, date, entity, and geography. The repository should serve as central clearinghouse for industry articles and whitepapers, making these resources easily accessible to division and organization leaders. The Director Consumer Insights serves as the content expert on research and audience understanding resources and contacts. This leader is responsible for building relationships and understanding the resources available from internal sources (Texas Health Resources University, Medical Libraries, and Strategy Division) as well as external relationships (NRC, Advisory Board, SG2, etc.). Additional responsibilities include maintaining updated contact information for resource groups and actively maintain strong working relationships. A little More About You:  Bachelors Degree Required; advanced degree preferred  10+ years of experience with demonstrated success in market research with experience in qualitative and quantitative methods, and general proficiency in syndicated data and analytics  Healthcare experience is preferred  Staff management experience required  Knowledge of Tufte presentation principles (http://www.edwardtufte.com/tufte/) Strongly preferred Skills You Embody:  Expertise in understanding and executing research, including methodology selection, research design, samples sizes and statistical controls.  Experience in influencing senior leadership teams and impacting high-level business decision.  Ability to translate consumer insights into actionable recommendations and strategic choices.  Serve as subject matter expert on secondary research sources and relevant resources for use by end users and provide resource information in a clear and easy to digest format.  Confident presence and good negotiation skills; proven problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities.  Strong relationship-building skills, along with commitment to a collaborative environment and keen understanding of communications, branding, media relations and marketing functions.  Strong interpersonal communication skills, the ability to work with all levels of staff (executive, front-line, trustees and physicians) and function effectively in a fast-paced environment.  Understanding of what drives key business imperatives and focus on learning strategic areas of priority for the system.  Passion for leveraging the dynamic, shifting landscape of healthcare to drive effective brand, media relations and communication initiatives that engage key internal and external stakeholders.  Exceptional communication skills, verbal and written.  Strong organizational skills with ability to set priorities and guide outcomes and conversations.  Knowledge of healthcare industry, hospitals, physician practices and business trends.  Visionary, results-oriented, thoughtful, creative, energetic, engaging, approachable, accurate, collaborative and accountable.  Proficient in project management software and dedicated to its consistent use.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office.  Exemplifies and serves as a champion for Texas Healths guiding principles.  Exemplifies and serves as a champion and ambassador for the Brand Experience Division, Purpose and Principals. Entity Information Texas Health Resources is one of the largest faith-based, nonprofit health care delivery systems in the United States and the largest in North Texas in terms of patients served. Texas Health has 25 acute-care and short-stay hospitals that are owned, operated, joint-ventured or affiliated with the system. It has more than 3,800 licensed beds, more than 21,100 employees of fully-owned/operated facilities plus 1,400 employees of consolidated joint ventures, and counts more than 5,500 physicians with active staff privileges at its hospitals. At Texas Health, we strive to create an atmosphere of respect, integrity, compassion and excellence for all who come in contact with us, be they patients or our employees. We are committed to diversity in our workforce, and our mission to serve spreads across ethnic, cultural, economic and generational boundaries.  We invite you to join us in furthering your career through our accomplishments and philosophy of excellence. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Apply for job Employment opportunities are only reflective of wholly owned Texas Health Resources entities. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employees or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. LEARN MORE Powered by SmashFly

title: Medicinal Chemist
summary: As a member of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team, the successful candidate will collaborate closely with a broad group of scientists within Caltech, with...
post_text: Medicinal Chemist Skip to Main Content Home Search Jobs Create Account Log In Help HR Home Why Work @Caltech? Caltech at a Glance Caltech was awarded Great College to Work For by the Chronicle of Higher Education in 2013 Medicinal Chemist Below you will find the details for the position including any supplementary documentation and questions you should review before applying for the opening.  To apply for the position, please click the Apply for this Job link/button. If you would like to bookmark this position for later review, click on the Bookmark link. To email this position to a friend, click on the Email to a Friend link.  If you would like to print a copy of this position for your records, click on the Print Preview link. Bookmark this Posting | Print Preview | Apply for this Job Posting Details Classification Information Classification Scientific Research_BAL-IC-Lead Exempt/Overtime Eligible Exempt Position Information Posting Number 16101SP Division/Department Chemistry and Chemical Engineering Laboratory Stoltz, Brian M. Work Location (City, State or Country) Pasadena Functional Title Medicinal Chemist Job Category Fulltime Regular If position is parttime, how many hours per week? If position is temporary, is it less than 3 months? No Benefits Eligible? Yes Relocation Available? Emergency Reporting Designation? Essential Non-Reporting Number of Vacancies 1 Desired Employment Start Date Position End Date (if temporary) Anticipated Salary Range Job Summary We are seeking a highly motivated and talented individual with a strong background in synthetic organic chemistry to join our medicinal chemistry team in the Caltech chemistry department. Chemists at Caltech have developed a proprietary platform technology for creating small molecules to treat patients with unmet medical needs. The technology allows unprecedented structural tailoring of small molecules and will enable the development of molecules with better target receptor docking and other desirable properties. This project is in collaboration with a highly respected medical schools translational oncology group, which will provide their proprietary knowledge of unknown oncologic dependencies and experimental expertise to collaboratively create best-in-class drugs. The collaboration is being run like a start-up within the Universities and there is potential for non-salary compensation incentives that are similar to what is typical in a pharma start-up. Job Duties The successful candidate will participate in the molecular design and synthesis of novel compounds, and interface with our biological and pharmacological collaborators in the testing and development of interesting compounds. Specifically, this individual will design and synthesize novel chemical compounds with a focus to optimize potency, selectivity, pharmacokinetics and in vivo efficacy. As a member of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team, the successful candidate will collaborate closely with a broad group of scientists within Caltech, with external collaborators and outside service providers. Additionally, this individual would also manage a small team at a foreign contract research organization to produce intermediate molecules that would be further modified at Caltech. The successful candidate will contribute effectively to patent, report, and scientific publication writing. Basic Qualifications Masters in Synthetic Organic Chemistry with 3+ years industry experience in Pharmaceutical Chemistry. Have successful experience in the application of structure based drug design leading to advanced leads/development candidates. Strong working knowledge of protein-ligand interactions, conformational and structural analysis, and experience in partnering closely with computational structural biologists. Proven track record of contributing to innovative project, including peer-reviewed publications. High level of creativity and productivity with strong synthetic chemistry problem solving and analytical skills. Excellent scientific expertise in organic synthesis, and conversant with the current literature. Experience initiating, working with, and managing projects with external contract research organizations.  Experience with managing CROs outside the US is preferred. Strong knowledge of medicinal chemistry principles, with a solid understanding of key ADME , biochemical and pharmacological principles, and able to effectively integrate and apply these to the optimization of multiple parameters during lead generation and lead optimization efforts. Ability to champion chemistry efforts into new directions to achieve project milestones. Excellent communication skills and ability to present rationale, key data, issues and accomplishments of chemistry efforts to other members of the team and external collaborators. Strong team orientation; highly collaborative. Solutions and results-oriented. Hands-on, resourceful, and open to diverse points of view. Preferred Qualifications PhD in Synthetic Organic Chemistry with 6 years of experience in Synthetic or Medicinal Chemistry and at least 3 years industry experience in Pharmaceutical medicinal Chemistry. Supervisory position? Yes Posting Detail Information Posting Open Date 04/06/2016 Posting Close Date Open Until Filled Yes EEO Statement We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Caltech is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. post_text: TERRACON - Job details Home Search openings Search results Job details Help Job details Job 1 of 1 Apply to job Save to cart Auto req ID 5075BR Posting Title Environmental Field Scientist Location Midland Service Line Environmental Company Information Terracon is a 100 percent employee-owned consulting engineering firm providing quality services to clients. Since 1965, Terracon has evolved into a successful multi-discipline firm specializing in environmental, facilities, geotechnical, and materials services.  Terracon currently has more than 3,500 employees in 150 offices with services available in all 50 states. Terracons growth is due to valued employees exceeding expectations in client service and growing their careers with new and exciting opportunities in the marketplace. Job Description General Responsibilities: Conduct environmental site assessments (Phase I ESA) and field investigations to sample, measure and analyze air, water, material, and soil.  Identify, evaluate and recommend risk and remediation strategies/designs to ensure compliance with federal, state and local regulations.  Prepare applicable ESA reports, permit applications, risk assessments and technical documents including proposals, reports and regulatory agency correspondence.  Design systems and environmental protection plans.  Projects may include Phase II environmental site assessments, ecological and natural resource field surveys, tank closure assessments, asbestos abatement, storm water management, and site planning and permitting. Applicants with experience and/or working knowledge of Texas Railroad Commission and  TCEQ PST and/or TRRP programs  are preferred. Essential Role and Responsibilities: This is an environmental scientist position; therefore an education in environmental studies and/or working experience in the environmental field is required. Preparation of Phase I ESA proposals and reports. Follow safety rules, guidelines and standards for all projects.  Participate in pre-task planning.  Report any safety issues or concerns to management. Be responsible for maintaining quality standards on all projects. Developing level scientific professional responsible for conducting analyses of component portions of projects; assignments are designed to develop knowledge and abilities. Perform site visits, field observations and field data collection or assignments. Assist in the collection and analysis of data from sampling, reports, maps, drawings, tests and aerial photographs to evaluate, plan and permit projects. Conduct field assignments including water, soil and other sampling and be able to lift up to 40 pounds. Implements technical requirements to complete client projects by directing field staff to sample, test and collect data and/or document site activities. Outlines required investigative program(s) by selecting the proper alternative techniques to conduct site studies in field of expertise. Drafts written proposals to clients for small projects and may assist with portions of proposals on larger projects. May have limited client contact pertaining to specific projects/tasks. Must have excellent writing skills, organized and detail oriented. Requirements: Bachelors degree in Environmental Science or related science field.  Or, in lieu of a degree, a minimum of 4 years related environmental experience. Valid drivers license with acceptable violation history. Preferred: Certification in field of expertise preferred. EEO Statement Terracon offers an excellent compensation and benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k) plan, and paid holidays. Terracon is an EEO employer. We encourage qualified minority, female, veteran and disabled candidates to apply and be considered for open positions. We do not discriminate against any applicant for employment, or any employee because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender, disability, age, or military status. No. of Positions 1 Employment Type Regular, Full Time Education Required Bachelor's Degree Experience Required 1 Year or more City State Midland, TX Apply to job Save to cart

Bookmark this Posting | Print Preview | Apply for this Job Posting Details Position Information Position Title Administrative Assistant Posting Title Administrative Assistant System Member Institution/Agency TEXAS A&M UNIVERSITY (TAMU) Department CHEMISTRY / 02-133502 Posting Number S00893FY16 Salary $29,000 to $33,000 Pay Basis Monthly Job Close Date Geographic Location College Station Budget Type Budgeted/Benefits - Full-Time Is this position restricted by the Patriot Act? No Is this position D.O.T. regulated? No EEO AA Statement The Texas A&M System is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Veterans/Disability Employer committed to diversity. Position Summary Information Job Summary The Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing administrative support for faculty with large research programs. Performs all administrative, editorial, financial and business related functions. Required Education and Experience Bachelors degree or any equivalent combination of training and experience (eight years experience with high school graduation or four years with an Associate degree). Two years experience in office administration or project management. Preferred Education and Experience Bachelors degree. Experience in managing business operations. Five to seven years in office administration or project management, including five years technical assistant experience with TAMU . Required Licenses, Certifications, or Registrations Preferred Licenses, Certifications, or Registrations Certified Administrative Professional ( CAP ) Required Special Knowledge, Abilities, and Skills Working knowledge of spreadsheet, presentation and word processing software programs. Interpersonal and communication skills and ability to plan and organize effectively. Preferred Special Knowledge, Abilities, and Skills Experience with scientific-technical typing and journal publications procedures. Good writing skills and organization ability, attention to detail/good proofreading skills, ability to work independently with a set of guidelines. Other Requirements or Other Factors Ability to multi-task and work cooperatively with others. Preferred Other Requirements or Other Factors Employee welcomes, includes and demonstrates respect for and engages people of diverse backgrounds. Detailed Job Duties Duties Performed Manage the offices of large, continuously growing and changing research groups and serve as a primary information resource on office support methods and processes. Complex duties involve daily contact with Laboratory Directors and other staff members (research scientists, visiting scholars, postdoctoral research associates, graduate students and undergraduate students). Coordinate travel arrangements and details for director, and file travel documents. Maintain updates to directors curriculum vitae. Resolve complex, highly sensitive and confidential administrative matters, relating to promotion, salaries, educational, and research activities for all research personnel. Apply and interpret and communicate University policies and procedures and serve as a resource for issues relevant to students and group members. Coordinate the maintenance of office reference and resource materials. Interface between Laboratory Directors and large numbers of undergraduate and graduate students in courses taught by the director, schedule student appointments, record exam grades, and maintain grade records, handouts and exam files. Assist in the development of employment offers. Hire, train, supervise and evaluate student assistants when needed for special projects. Collect and file research group reports. Manage departmental and other committee work, including scheduling of meetings and keeping records of minutes. Assist in transition of incoming and outgoing research chemists of many different nationalities. Assist Laboratory Directors in maintaining compliance with safety regulations, which includes detailed and accurate chemical inventory data management. Maintain groups website. Duties Performed Manage all business matters including authorization of purchase requisitions, invoice approval, budgeting, and salary authorizations for laboratory personnel. Records for multiple accounts are maintained and familiarity with the procedural requirements of various internal and external agencies is required. Compile statistics and direct preparation of periodic financial reports and research proposal budgets. Maintain record of reporting deadlines and assist with preparation of materials for submissions of reports to funding agencies. Duties Performed In coordination with senior laboratory staff, University and Sponsored Research Services personnel, oversee the preparation of all non-technical aspects of progress reports, continuation grant applications, and proposals for new funding to a variety of agencies. Duties Performed Research, compile and apply information, making evaluative judgments on appropriate data to use to prepare and edit various requested surveys and information for outside agencies such as national professional societies and funding agencies and for internal administrative units. Create and maintain databases and group webpage necessary to track all administrative files and records involving space allocations, major equipment purchases and maintenance, accounting, and publishing activities of the laboratory. Manage the maintenance of an equipment inventory including deleting, transferring, and locating the equipment as needed. Duties Performed Prepare and sign all correspondence relating to non-academic and non-scientific matters. Make travel arrangements, coordinate itineraries, and complete travel and leave requests and reimbursement forms for senior scientific staff and a number of distinguished scientists, high level governmental and industrial officials, and potential funding agencies personnel. Interface with scientists to plan and provide logistical and administrative support to organize symposia at scientific meetings. Duties Performed Handle all non-scientific pre- and post-publication aspects of the laboratories publishing activities. Organize and maintain all of the groups extensive research records, including group handbook, figures, research notes and equipment designs. Duties Performed Performs other duties as assigned Supplemental Questions Required fields are indicated with an asterisk (*). * Where did you see this position advertised?
