Following Company Report this job Save Email All TechData jobs Biostatistician,SDTM/CDISC Programmer,SAS/Statistical programmer/Remote Apply TechD ata is looking for SAS programmer and Bios tatistician (Some positions are remote), Statistical Programmer (Some positions can be telecommuting), CDISC programmer (Remote or onsite) for our pharmaceutical clients in Fort Worth, Texas. We also have similar positions in MA, MD, NC, PA , and CA. Please see below requirements and send your resume to: John.zhang @techdataservice.com . TechData is a leading provider for temporary and permanent positions in the pharmaceutical industry. TechData offers very competitive pay rate and benefits. Biostatistician Position (10 on site and 5 remote)  Support clinical trial design and protocol concept sheet development  Develop protocols especially for statistical section  Participate study related activities and provide statistical support such as safety review, interim analyses for Phase II and III oncology studies, etc.  Develop statistical analysis plan (SAP), create TLG template and derived analysis datasets specification, perform QC of TLG.  Contribute to CRF development and review edit check specification  Develop Data Monitoring Committee Charter and create mocked TLG for interim review  Review Independent Radiology Review Committee Charter and data transfer plan  Review CSR QUALIFICATIONS:  At least 4 years clinical trial experience (oncology experience preferred) with Ph.D. in statistics  Familiar with oncology trial design and survival analysis  Good communication skill  Excellent programming skill in SAS  Familiar with statistical software such as East, nQuery, Splus and others.  Team work attitude  Able to handle multiple projects concurrently Sr. Statistical/SAS Programmer (Some position can be telecommuting): To support the Biostatistics team by carrying out and overseeing programming activities of statistical programmers and external vendors (as required), and to ensure timely and accurate programming and validation activities for clinical studies. Contributes to the overall efficiency and best practice running of the Biostatistics group, demonstrating the ability to work efficiently and to a high standard within a clinical team environment. Main duties/responsibilities: 1. Providing statistical programming and validation support for clinical study reports, overseeing programming activities by external vendors (e.g., CROs) when necessary and coordinating programming activities among the study programmers to achieve timely progress in the following areas: analysis datasets, statistical tables, figures, listings, Integrated Summaries of Safety (ISS), Integrated Summaries of Efficacy (ISE), electronic submissions and other internal and external requests (e.g., publications). Accessing and converting data to SAS from Database management system and PC file formats (e.g., MS Excel, text files). Working with external vendors in order to develop or monitor the content and structure of SAS data sets. 2. Developing and maintaining SOPs, SWPs and other related technical documents, providing input to the Database and CRF Development, creating edit check programs and providing feedback to the Data Management. Providing input in developing statistical analysis plans, specifications of analysis datasets, validation plans, and other related documents. Determining and researching SAS software upgrades and related systems and addressing maintenance issues. 3. Managing and developing team, maintaining standards for programming activities, and guiding/coaching Statistical programmers. 4. Working independently to accomplish tasks and goals defined by supervisor. Attending required training and meetings and bringing in new ideas to improve the programming process. * Responsibilities weighting may change significantly based on the incumbent and their assigned areas of responsibility. Qualifications and education required:  Minimum of Bachelors degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related science discipline. Masters preferred. Experience required:  Minimum 5 years experience in SAS programming for phase I-IV clinical trials in a pharmaceutical/CRO environment. 7+ years experience preferred.  Some project experience in a pharmaceutical/CRO programming environment or demonstrated significant leadership of SAS programming activities in a clinical pharmaceutical/CRO environment. Skills and aptitude required:  Experience using SAS-Base, MACRO, STAT, GRAPH, ACCESS, MS Office.  Proven experience with Unix and Windows operating systems.  Understanding of the software development life cycle.  Understanding of FDA guidelines.  Good organization, time management and attention to detail skills needed to work in a stressful environment under tight deadlines while maintaining focus on details and quality.  Applies good judgment and demonstrates initiative to resolve issues.  Strong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills needed to work effectively in a team environment, managing that team as required. SDTM/CDISC Consultant/Programmer The   Data Steward/BMDS Consultant will work in Biomedical Data Stewardship and   will primarily be responsible for working alongside CDISC Consultancy and   Implementation (CCI), a group within the Global Statistical Programming   department. CCI is primarily responsible for supporting the compliant and   consistent adoption of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM). The   role will provide support for the implementation of SDTM standards in new and   ongoing studies and will involve close collaboration with other CDISC   Consultants and Implementers, Statistical Programmers and Data Standards   Librarians. Responsibilities include   (but are not limited to): Perform        all BMDS Consultant role responsibilities as prescribed in group        Standard Operating Procedures and other organizational guidance Participate        in BMDS & CCI meetings to provide expert advice on the application        of standards and SDTM implementation guidance to analysis and submission        requirements Resolve        standards mapping issues in a timely manner and escalate global issues        for CCI and Biomedical Data Stewardship (BMDS) leadership discussion Consult with CDISC Consultants & CDISC Implementers on standard CRF        annotation and SDTM Controlled Terminology Management. Assist in the        development of new and complex standard annotations and terminology Contribute        to BMDS team and process documentation Perform        standard audits and conformance checks to ensure compliance Support        standard process improvement initiatives Support        SDTM controlled terminology Global Librarian activities Stay        current with all developments in the evolution of CDISC SDTM standards        with a particular focus on changes in the SDTM Implementation Guide        between published versions Liaise        with the CDISC Consultancy Group to define the strategy, scope, and        timetable regarding the upgrading of studies to use the latest version        of CDISC SDTM standards. Basic Qualifications Doctorate degree & 2 years of directly related   experience OR Masters degree & 6 years of directly related experience OR Bachelors degree or & 8 years of directly related experience OR Associates degree & 10 years of directly related experience OR High school diploma / GED & 12 years of directly related experience Preferred Qualifications BA/BS or higher degree in Computer Science,   Statistics, Mathematics, Life Sciences, other related scientific subject 7 years of pharmaceutical/biotech industry experience 5 years of SDTM consulting experience  conformance assurance,   standardization, harmonization, liaising, problem-solving In-depth knowledge on SDTM standard  official training from CDISC preferred Active member of CDISC Submission Data Standards (SDS) team preferred Thorough understanding and experience on data quality/compliance checks    DAT, WebSDM, OpenCDISC and CDISC controlled terminology Working knowledge of ADaM standard desirable Prior regulatory submission experience with SDTM data and define.xml Effective oral and written communication Good documentation practice Willingness and ability to learn and follow standard processes and   procedures in team environment Ability to work proactively and independently About TechData Service Company Our mission is to help our clients in cost saving, improving productivity and maximizing returns in R&D investment through our constant technology innovation, consistent, highest standard and exceptional customer-alighned services. TechData Service Company , LLC (TechData) is a well-known provider of talented IT and data science professionals. Our knowledge of and focus on the pharmaceutical and biotechnology research means that we are highly skilled at providing the most qualified and high level expertise service in the pharmaceutical industry. We pride ourselves on our ability to technology solutions for each client, with the goals of maximizing cost savings and improving productivity. Our current available resources includes professionals in clinical research, medical writing, software development, and data science professionals in clinical data management, statistics and SAS/statistical programming. Leading pharmaceutical, biotechnology, device, CRO, and related organizations rely on our strength of talented professionals for their outsourced projects and personnel requirements. Since the founding of our company, we have focused our energies exclusively on the clinical research and trials, building a reputation of excellence among the leading R&D organizations. With an extensive network of talented and experienced data science professionals, TechData is capable of introducing the brightest and most experienced professionals to companies seeking data science expertise.

General administrative or research support as required. Marginal/Incidental functions Other related functions as assigned. title: Sr Research Scientist Cancer Biology
summary: Prepares and presents data for publication or scientific meetings; Develops approaches for training and oversight of other research scientists and junior staff...
post_text: Houston Research jobs - Sr Research Scientist Cancer Biology at MD Anderson Cancer Center Career Opportunities Locations How to Apply Benefits MD Anderson Cancer Center Jobs > Houston Jobs > Research Jobs Careers Useful Links How to Apply Benefits Working at MD Anderson Working in Houston EEO and Accessibility Military Skills Translator REGIONAL CARE CENTERS LOCATIONS Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands STAY CONNECTED Facebook Twitter Where will you be when cancer is history? At MD Anderson Cancer Center, we bring together the expertise, the technology and the dedication that is moving us closer to our goal of Making Cancer History®. Advanced Search Search Jobs Job Opportunity Apply Now Sr Research Scientist Cancer Biology Job Location: Houston, TX The Giancotti laboratory is expanding their work on the molecular underpinnings of metastasis and to begin to translate their findings into novel therapeutic approaches.  Dr. Giancotti and colleagues use CRISPR-Cas9 and ORFEOME genetic screens in the mouse to identify enforcers of dormancy and mediators of metastatic reactivation in breast, prostate, and pancreatic cancer. They then exploit their expertise in cell adhesion, cell signaling and mouse modeling to elucidate the mechanism of action of the most potent hits. Additional areas of interest include the tumor suppressor Merlin, EMT and MET conversions, and Hippo signaling. Novel areas of interest include, but are not limited to, the role of epigenetics and metabolism in tumor progression and metastasis. With strong funding from an NCI Outstanding Investigator Award and a CPRIT Scholar Award, the laboratory is well poised to exploit the new opportunities for clinical validation and translation available at M.D. Anderson Cancer Center. We seek outstanding candidates with a strong background in biochemistry, cell biology or genetics. We are only interested in scientists, who are committed to solve important questions in cancer biology and are fearless in their approaches. Studies and trials: 1. Responsible for running biomarker studies and pre-clinical trials in HIM models. Tumor tissue acquisition: 1. Coordinates tumor tissue acquisition from surgeons and isolates tumors for analysis. Training and oversight: 1. Develops approaches for training and oversight of other research scientists and junior staff on all aspects including data and literature compilation and analysis. 2. Reviews documents as needed prior to publication. Mouse surgeries: 1. Conducts complex mouse surgeries. Reports and data: 1. Writes and edits reports as needed, manuscripts, abstracts, protocols (animal and laboratory) and grants; compiles, writes, and submits reports as needed; analyzes and manipulates research data; prepares and presents data for publication or scientific meetings; maintains current and accurate records of research data; and, obtains and distributes pertinent research material/data. Education: Required: PhD in Natural Science, related field or medical degree. Experience: Required: Five years of experience in experimental or scientific work. Preferred: Experience in biochemistry, cell biology or genetics. It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 105363 Apply Now ABOUT REGIONAL CARE CENTERS For nearly 70 years, MD Anderson has provided an unparalleled level of cancer care at our main campus in the Texas Medical Center. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. Bay Area Katy Sugar Land The Woodlands In addition to care centers serving the greater Houston area, MD Anderson also offers single discipline oncology programs at facilities outside of Texas and the United States: Albuquerque, New Mexico Istanbul, Turkey Phoenix, Arizona Madrid, Spain Watch Our Jobs Sign up here for job alerts and MD Anderson communications. It is one of only 40comprehensive cancer centers designated by the National Cancer Institute. Since U.S. News & World Report began its annual Best Hospitals survey 25 years ago, MD Anderson has ranked No. 1 or No. 2 in cancer care every year. The goal of MDA department of Immunology is to perform multidisciplinary research and educational activities in basic and cancer immunology. Key Functions 1. Recruitment and enrollment of patients onto protocol PA13-0291  Completes Human Subjects Research Training and courses on the informed consent process.  Screens patients for eligibility for PA13-0291  Consents patients for protocol, or coordinates/trains staff of collaborating departments to obtain consent  Registers patient in CORe  Documents consent process  Tracks patients for follow up by checking patients schedules in Prometheus and EPIC and prepares documentation for the Immunotherapy Lab  Removes patient from study at completion  Completes off-study procedures in CORe and EPIC  Assists in QA of consent and scheduled collection verification  Maintains and validates data  Serves as liaison to collaborating departmental staff and patients, answers questions and concerns related to Platform functions and duties  Coordinates special collections for projects with alliances as assigned 2. Procurement of blood, tissue and related data for research protocols.  Performs collection and obtains research samples including blood, bone marrow aspirate and biopsy, and or tissue biopsies  Conducts blood draws  Collects, stores, and/or ships research samples. Maintains chain of custody. Remains knowledgeable of all policies and procedures that are essential to the collection, storage, and/or shipping of research samples.  De-identifies and packages biologic samples and coordinates delivery to the Immunotherapy Laboratory  Demonstrates precision in interpreting orders and obtaining appropriate clinical research samples, precision in sample identification and labeling, and accuracy in documentation  Assists with the request and transfer of samples to and from outside centers using several applications such as EPIC, Tissue Station, and CORe.  Maintains an electronic file system to document the progress and status of each request.  Locates, files, and/or retrieves the required documents for tissue requests in the regulatory file  Completes and oversees data entry regarding sample collection. Maintains a file storage system of completed lab requisitions and related protocol documents. Coordinates source document sharing with Study Staff of collaborating departments  Coordinates sample collections with patients and multiple departments including collaborating clinical departments, diagnostic labs, and treatment centers. Update database with all collection and timepoints  Coordinates with collaborating departmental staff and patients to document missed blood draws and reschedule follow up collections  Serves as liaison for other departments and treatment centers on specimen collection, data collection, documentation, treatment, and patient coordination 3. Maintains a level of professional expertise through educational programs.  Conducts start up meetings and trainings that cover procedures and forms for the collection, processing, storage, and distribution of clinical research specimens  Attends appropriate departmental meetings and institutional continuing education programs.  Maintains working knowledge of current Code of Federal Regulation and Good Clinical Practice guidelines. 4. Other Duties as Assigned  Assists IMT managers in updating and maintaining protocol related information in EPIC  Assists program manager in updating and maintaining SOP  Provides reports to managers, scientists and PIs as requested.  Assists in training junior staff  Demonstrates excellent oral and written communication skills when contacting other institutions, patients, and departments by phone, email, and/or face-to-face interactions.  Assimilates pertinent information in order to compose written correspondence.  Other duties as required. Education: Required: Bachelor's degree in Public Health, Healthcare Administration or related scientific field. Experience: Required: Five years experience in area of research study or direct patient care obtained from nursing, data gathering or related field -OR- three years of required experience and two years experience as a Coordinator, Clinical Studies at M. D. Anderson. May substitute required education degree with additional years of equivalent experience on a one to one basis. Responsibilities of the position include but are not limited to: * Point person/expert on Cortex hardware and software in the lab, maintain cameras and marker sets, prepare calibration, conducts data collections running Cortex, tracking, data processing and analysis for the projects assigned. * Provide support for Grail/Goat and Dflow software; assist data collections and analysis * Keep detailed logs of all research-related activities, data collections, protocols, and backup data on protected drives. * Participate in dissemination of results, writing up methodology and results sections and may present a study from the lab at scientific meetings. * Participate in supervision and facilitation of research projects conducted by graduate students, postdoctoral and clinical fellows, and residents involved in functions related to the research mission in the Human Movement Performance Laboratory. * Provides support for motion analysis data collections that occasionally take place after regular business hours or on weekends to accommodate research participant schedules. * Conduct research and assist in the conduct of research, including the collection of information and samples. * Analyze experimental data and interpret results to write reports and summaries of findings. * Use computers, computer-interfaced equipment, or high-technology industrial applications to perform work duties. * Clean, maintain and prepare supplies and work areas. * Set up, adjust, calibrate, clean, maintain, and troubleshoot laboratory and field equipment. * Measure or weigh compounds and solutions for use in testing. * This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties to meet the ongoing needs of the Department: May assist biological and medical scientists in laboratories. Set up, operate, and maintain laboratory instruments and equipment, monitor experiments, make observations, and calculate and record results. May analyze organic and non-organic substances. summary: Participation in decision-making processes within the project team by actively engaging in scientific and technical discussions....

Sr. Scientist - Downstream Process Development - College Station, TX - FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Texas, LLC Jobs Home Jobs Sr. Scientist - Downstream Process Development - College Station, TX Toggle navigation Sr. Scientist - Downstream Process Development Current Openings Login 04-Apr-2016 to 03-Jun-2016 (CST) Process Development College Station, TX, USA Full Time Email Me Similar Jobs Email Me This Job Summary : The Senior Scientist - Downstream Process Development, functions independently and productively in the Downstream Process Development Group actively engaged in process development within a team based PD laboratory. The individual should display strong technical knowledge and scientific understanding of protein purification as well as having experience in process development at both small and large process scales. The individual will provide significant scientific and technical contributions within the Process Development Group. Essential Functions: Purification methods development of specific protein molecule(s) Development of downstream protein purification processes and technical transfer into cGMP Purification of specific protein molecule(s) Preparation and authoring of technical reports Interacting with appropriate analytical and upstream functional areas to determine appropriate method for protein purification Participation in decision-making processes within the project team by actively engaging in scientific and technical discussions Perform all other duties as assigned Knowledge/Technical Expertise Individual will have considerable knowledge/expertise relevant to downstream processing of protein based products expressed in mammalian, bacterial, insect and yeast cells. Knowledge/expertise should be practical and focused on lab-related activities: Downstream development of protein purification processes Hands on experience with chromatography based processing methods and tangential flow filtration techniques Experience with GE Healthcare's AKTA line of chromatography systems is desired Protein biochemistry (protein folding, protein degradation, aggregation, etc.) General analytical methods applicable for proteins (HPLC, electrophoresis, assay development, etc.) Knowledge of cGMP concepts Downstream technology transfer into cGMP manufacturing Instrument care, maintenance, troubleshooting and data interpretation Document writing, data interpretation, presentation, statistical analysis and trending. Required Skills & Abilities: Builds credibility within lab group by performing high quality work. Expands the technical capabilities of Process Development Group, such as technology development, use of the literature and systems development Teaches others regarding their expertise and training other members of Process Development Group with respect to the day-to-day lab goals and activities. Effectively communicates results of own work though scientific meetings, presentations, discussions and documentation with some input from supervisor. Minimum supervision required on day-to-day activities and accomplished tasks. Leadership input focused on status and future of project or technical area and long-term development path. May be responsible for leading a team, including creating project goals and development plans, and teaching team members. The ability to work in team oriented environment is essential, as this person will work closely with other members of Process Development Group and participate on multidisciplinary project teams. Working Conditions & Physical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to: Experience prolonged standing, along with some bending, stooping, and stretching. Use hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment. Attendance is mandatory. Minimum Qualifications: Ph.D. in Chemistry, Biology, Life Sciences or related field, and 5 years of relevant experience in pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry. Following Company Report this job Save Email All Mary Kay jobs View Company Profile All Mary Kay jobs Send this job to a friend About Our Company For nearly 50 years, Mary Kay has offered its employees more than just a job.  Our employees have embraced the Companys mission to enrich the lives of women around the world by supporting the Mary Kay Independent Beauty Consultants as they pursue the many opportunities and benefits made available through Mary Kay.  In 1963, against the odds, Mary Kay Ash made the impossible become possible.  And at Mary Kay, it still happens every day. At Mary Kay, we believe its possible to love your job.  Whatever your role, we offer rewarding opportunities that can be shaped by your creativity and initiative.  And at Mary Kay, we realize that we do well by doing good  every aspect of our work is quite literally about enriching womens lives, from the women in our independent sales force to the women and children in our communities.  If youre looking for an opportunity that is challenging and meaningful, all while living a balanced life, Mary Kay is the place for you. Position Description Assoc Principal Scientist CPI (Consumer & Product Insights) JOB PURPOSE Leads the implementation of sensory, consumer science, and claims testing techniques and analyses which effectively support the new product development process from early development through on sale date. Serves as a strategic, technical project leader and an in-house expert on consumer behavior, product design, and difficult technical questions. Solves complex product problems through understanding objectives, planning and developing research plans requiring advanced and diverse levels of knowledge and experience in qualitative and quantitative methods, and appropriate application of statistical methods. Investigates and applies novel or state-of-the-art methodologies and technologies to the solution of technical problems that directly impact long-term divisional and Company goals and objectives. May manage the development and maintenance of the descriptive panel program. Proven experience in supervising or overseeing the work of lower level Scientists. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Provides complete consumer, product, and claims research and evaluation support to assigned product categories. Leads more strategic, complex research. Ensures that previous consumer and product knowledge is integrated and synthesized into current projects in order to leverage insights. Responsible for developing and executing comprehensive research plans in support of all new and established products. Interprets valid and reliable data to clearly communicate results and insights in succinct top line reports and presentations. Demonstrates credible business sense by developing new consumer, product, claim insights, and leveraging them to improve business decisions and knowledge base for future strategic planning. 30% 2. Knowledgeable in a wide range of front end, consumer, sensory, and market research techniques and methodologies applicable to ensuring that consumers are tapped in early in the research process to better understand consumer behavior and unmet needs, product design, and solving complex problems. Investigates and applies novel or state-of-the-art technologies, research tools, methods, statistical analyses, and processes and provides leadership in bringing this new knowledge to the department and business. Capitalize on leading-edge and emerging measurement tools and statistical applications to reduce development time and costs while simultaneously improving success rate. Interacts with and develops business relationships with external consultants/moderators and testing vendors who can partner in test design, analyses, and execution critical for solving complex consumer/product problems while adhering to department budget. Understands the basic protocols for dealing with suppliers and contract manufacturers, applying discretion and diplomacy especially when complex issues may involve conflicting viewpoints. 25% 3. Work is performed without appreciable direction, and project responsibilities are completed either independently or in cooperative partnership with cross-functional project team members, including Product Development, Brand, SCR, Product Safety, Regulatory, and Consumer Insights. Maintains an awareness of project plan timelines, production timelines, and back-order potential. Communicates individual plans, results, and issues promptly to maximize team success. Interacts with management on significant technical matters often requiring the coordination of activities across organizational lines. 25% 4. Manages and/or mentors professional staff members and the Descriptive Panel program (if applicable). Provides guidance for influencing and writing appropriate study objectives, executing appropriate tests for those objectives, setting project and team priorities, and ensuring the appropriate levels of competence and support are applied to projects and objectives. Serves as a technical project leader and in-house expert on difficult technical questions, providing guidance for other staff members. 20% In addition to the above, incumbent is expected to meet the required competencies for this position as defined in the competency profile. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES Education BS/MS/Ph.D (7/5/3) degree in Science Engineering, Food Science/Technology, Psychology, or Marketing with Market Research emphasis or equivalent. Experience 10/5/5 through work experience in one or more of the cosmetic, chemical, pharmaceutical, or food/beverage industries. 1. Must possess extensive expertise as a generalist or a specialist with a wide application of principles, theories, and concepts in the areas of advanced sensory/consumer methods, research, statistical analysis, analytical and/or organic chemistry plus a working knowledge of other related disciplines. An understanding of FDA, EPA, and OSHA requirements is recommended. Knowledge of the cosmetic industry is recommended. 2. 3-5 years of experience managing exempt employees .Proven experience in line-management and the ability to lead, coach, and develop direct reports and junior sensory professionals 3. Proven experience of partnering with client/stakeholders as individuals and teams. 4. Ability to utilize effective negotiation skills to influence and gain alignment among team members in the use of new methods, conflict resolution, and consensus building. 5. Must be able to lead and manage multiple projects and develop solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity. 6. Excellent oral and written communication skills are required in order to interact with various levels of personnel within and outside the Company to solve technical problems and to prepare formal written reports. 7. Ability to perform duties under very general direction and independently perform assignments with only general criteria for expected results and exercise considerable latitude in determining technical objective of assignments. 8. Must be proficient in statistical software (SAS, SPSS, etc). and able to perform complex analysis or direct others in statistical analysis. Additional Information: Position Information Company: Mary Kay Location: Dallas, TX 75201 Status: Full Time Employee Job Category: Marketing/ Product Occupations: Market Research Industry: Manufacturing - Other Career Level: Experienced (Non-Manager) Contact Information Reference Code: 150593 Follow Company Your information may be shared with the company. This position is contingent upon award of contract. Requirements: - Bachelors (BA/BS) degree in Operations Research, Mathematics, Economics, or other degree with at least 24 semester hours in quantitative course work, which includes at least three (3) in Calculus. - A minimum of seven (7) years experience in Department of Defense cost estimating (excluding Earned Value Management (EVM) experience and cost performance report analysis experience), with a minimum of ten (10) years DoD acquisition experience. Travel: - As required. Clearance: - Final Secret Preferred Qualifications: - Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (e.g., Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, and Outlook). Duties: - Must be highly proficient in the use of all cost estimating tools Automated Cost Estimating Integrated Tools (ACE-IT), Program Office Support Tool (POST), the statistical analysis package CO$TAT, Excel, PowerPoint and be able to use these tools to estimate and document costs and methodologies for development, procurement, and sustainment for any acquisition effort. - Must be highly proficient in the development of Business Case Analyses, Economic Analyses, Cost Analysis Requirements Description (CARD) documents and Clinger-Cohen Act documents. - Must be capable of independently leading all cost analysis tasks for any program including, but not limited to, tracking tasks that directly impact the Division schedule, identifying programmatic cost issues and developing recommendations to facilitate issue resolution, supporting meetings, developing, preparing and coordinating acquisition cost reports (Defense Acquisition Management Information Retrieval (DAMIR), Enterprise Information Technology Data Repository (EITDR), System Metric and Reporting Tool (SMART), Integrated Budget Documentation and Execution System (IDECS), Centralized Access for Data Exchange (CAFDEx)), correspondences, briefings, plans and other information to support the acquisition process. - Additional duties as assigned. Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; SECRET, TS, or TS/SCI clearance is required. About the company: USfalcon Inc provides integrated technology solutions worldwide to Department of Defense clients in the areas of C4ISR Operations, Aerospace mission support, Engineering, Information Technology, Logistics and Training. It has been recognized as one of the fastest growing privately held companies in the United States. USfalcon has offices in Morrisville, NC, Colorado Springs, CO, Reston, VA, Huntsville, AL and Dayton, OH. For more information, visit the website at www.usfalcon.com. Equal Opportunity Employer.

JOB DESCRIPTION: Medical Laboratory Scientist, Laboratory Services provides technical skills necessary to perform and report moderate or highly complex laboratory tests within a division of the clinical laboratory. Salary Range The salary range for this position is from $53,600 to $80,400 annually, commensurate with experience. This is a pay Band Code PC14. Specific Job Related Duties Makes varied or specialized examinations efficiently, prioritizes and organizes workload. Assesses and processes incoming samples properly. Reviews and interprets data related to normal values based on age, sex and other pertinent conditions and reports patient results accurately with all required documentation. Preferred Skill/Competency Ability to work independently, with flexible schedule required. Ability to provide oversight and education in a demanding environment. Good communication skills Good organizational skills Experience with connecting POCT instruments to a laboratory information system preferred. post_text: Job Information: Medical Technologist/Clinical Laboratory Scientist Job Share Email Opening Apply Now Title Medical Technologist/Clinical Laboratory Scientist Location Schryver Medical - Garland/Dallas Description Medical Technologist The Medical Technologist performs standardized clinical laboratory examinations in Hematology, Microbiology, Serology, Immunology, Clinical Chemistry and Urinalysis.  Provides consultative services. Tasks and Responsiblities: Performs standardized laboratory procedures including automated and manual testing in Hematology, Microbiology, Serology, Immunology, Clinical Chemistry and Urinalysis. Operates, maintains, calibrates and performs quality control procedures on laboratory equipment and instruments. Evaluates validity of laboratory results based on results or quality control materials. Evaluates instrument operational problems. Performs routine maintenance on laboratory instruments such as Hematology Analyzers, Automated Chemistry and Immunochemistry Analyzers, Coagulation Analyzers, Microbiology Instruments, Centrifuges, Incubators, Microscopes  and other laboratory instruments. Reports patient results. Maintains laboratory information and filing systems. Maintains and updates policies, standards and manuals. Provides consultative services regarding laboratory procedures, test results and examinations to physicians, clients, laboratory staff and others using the laboratory facility. Reviews and interprets laboratory results and data. Trains other personnel in performing standardized laboratory and clinical evaluations. National Medical Liaison Senior Director/Director, Field Lead job - Celldex Therapeutics, Inc. - Houston, TX | Indeed.com Find Jobs Find Resumes Employers / Post Job Sign in What: Where: Advanced Job Search job title, keywords or company city, state, or zip National Medical Liaison Senior Director/Director, Field Lead Celldex Therapeutics, Inc. - Houston, TX National Medical Liaison Senior Director/Director, Field Lead  (Can be based in Midwest, South Central, or West Region) Overview: The National Medical Liaison Field Lead position manages a field-based team of experienced Oncology Medical Science Liaisons (MSLs), oversees the development and implementation of field medical plans and strategies, manages all field personnel decisions, develops key performance indicators, tracks field medical activities/deliverables, and conducts performance reviews. In addition, this individual is responsible for developing and working alongside the field force of Oncology MSLs. Determines Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and manages towards achieving them. Participates in the design of internal and external education initiatives, being mindful of national and regional needs. Coordinates pre-meeting scientific preparation and summarizes competitive information. Works to craft Celldex Lifecycle Management (LCM) strategy; and communicates back to organization evolving trends/changes in treatment and healthcare delivery. As part of the field team, the National Medical Liaison Field Lead will also be responsible for: Data generation: Supports extensive program of pre-clinical collaborations and company sponsored research as well as the investigator initiated research (IIR) program; facilitates research site selection, study placement and execution as needed. Must be adept at interpreting data and new information in order to better understand situations and draw appropriate conclusions. This includes prioritizing issues and opportunities based on customer needs, taking ownership and demonstrating accountability. Enhancing knowledge: Engages in Medical to Medical scientific discussions including disease awareness and education, supports medical training for commercial team, employs scientific and clinical expertise while maintaining a high competency in the responsible therapeutic areas through appropriate training, demonstrates competency in these areas through written and verbal communications and assessments, and conveys scientific information clearly and effectively. Facilitates unsolicited medical inquiries and may support the generation of educational materials. Insight gathering: Responsible for initiating, building and fostering internal/external relationships with recognized pre-clinical scientist, clinicians and research experts in therapeutic and managed markets/health care systems. While at outside conferences or engaging in scientific exchange, stays abreast of current scientific trends, opinions of company data, and that of competitor medicines while engaging in scientific exchange either personally or at conferences, advisory boards, or investigator meetings. Required Skills: Ability to motivate independent employees and provide metrics to internal stakeholders Expert at translating the work of field-based personnel to colleagues across key disciplines Able to manage several national efforts via chosen Oncology MSL leaders Requires outstanding communication skills and the ability to function within a team environment Required Education/Experience: Must have an advanced life science degree (PhD, PharmD, or MD) Extensive (more than 7 years) oncology medical affairs experience required, including at least 3 years of management experience Must live within one of the following regions: Midwest, South Central, or West; within 1 hour of major airport; and be able to travel overnight 50-75% as business requires Must have a current and valid drivers license Required experience: oncology medical affairs experience: 7 years Indeed - 11 days ago - save job » View or apply to job Recommended Jobs Director TD Bank - Houston, TX TD Bank - 30+ days ago Director of Health Systems (Managed Care Liai... title: Sr Statistical Analyst
summary: Assesses relevant literature as well as existing data, evaluates the quality of data used in reports and assists with preparation and distribution of data for...
post_text: Sr Statistical Analyst - job details by MedicalWorkers.com the Job the Location Job Title, Company or Skill City, State or Zip Code Advanced Search Sign in Sr Statistical Analyst POSITION INFORMATION Location: Houston, TEXAS Company: Not Provided Job Code: ssional%2fsr-statistical-analys Posted On: 4/10/2016 DESCRIPTION Apply Now Sr Statistical Analyst Job Location: Houston, TX The Department of Biostatistics at MD Anderson: Enhances the scientific excellence of MD Anderson research through outstanding statistical designs and methods, including the proper and efficient use of standard and cutting-edge methods, as well as the development of novel innovative methods.     Provides bio statistical collaboration, consultation and quantitative research resources to clinical, diagnostic, laboratory, population, and prevention scientists, and engages in the planning, conduct, analysis, quality assurance, and interpretation of research studies.     Trains and mentors the next generation of biostatisticians through an innovative and relevant curriculum and through exposure to unique data sets, the latest research methodology and findings, and state-of-the-art computing technology.     KEY FUNCTIONS:     Statistical Consulting and Collaboration:   * Compiles, analyzes and reports statistical data for various projects including, but not limited to manual and computer-aided data abstraction/evaluation, clinical trial design, computerized imaging and bioinformatics.     * Prepares statistical considerations for clinical trial designs and carries out complex statistical analyses with minimal supervision.     * Assists faculty in the development of new statistical methodology for measurement and analysis of data.     * Applies advanced statistical methods, simulation models, and skilled statistical programming as needed.     * Assesses relevant literature as well as existing data, evaluates the quality of data used in reports and assists with preparation and distribution of data for committee and scientific meetings.     * Makes original contributions to research projects and takes initiative in professional activities.     * Independently attends project meetings with collaborators.     * Presents findings at relevant meetings both inside and outside of the institution.     Protocol Review:   * Independently participates in the protocol review process and submits formal biostatistics review memorandums in PDOL.     Statistical Reporting:   * Prepares written reports, manuscripts, and grant applications for investigators with minimal supervision.     * Presents findings at relevant meetings both inside and outside of the institution.     Training:   * Participates in training and supervision of junior statistical analysts.     Other duties as assigned.    EDUCATION   Required: Master's degree in Biostatistics, Statistics, Bioinformatics, Mathematics or related field.       EXPERIENCE  Required: Four years experience with mainframe and/or PC databases, document processing and statistical software such as SAS and S-Plus. With preferred degree, two years of required experience. Now, weve extended our experience and services into your neighborhood. MD Anderson provides medical oncology, radiation oncology and surgical oncology services along with a range of supportive programs at regional care centers in the greater Houston area. The medical oncologists, radiation oncologists and surgical oncologists at each Regional Care Center location are MD Anderson faculty members. On-site nurses and other laboratory and pharmacy technicians support the MD Anderson physicians at each center, so that each patient receives the best combination of MD Andersons wide range of cancer expertise and local care. Those who choose a Regional Care Center location for their treatment become patients of MD Anderson, while remaining under the care of their personal physicians or referring specialists. Our physicians and staff work directly with patients personal physicians to tailor individual treatment plans, keeping them informed throughout the treatment experience. Most patients will receive diagnostic tests and treatments at their chosen facility. However, if one of our physicians determines that theyd benefit from multidisciplinary care, advanced treatments or investigational therapies, patients can receive treatment or participate in clinical trials at our main campus. summary: This position conducts close work with other technicians, students, post-doctoral fellows, visiting scientists and staff members in scientific protocols...
post_text: Research Asst I Melanoma Med Onco Rsch - job details by MedicalWorkers.com the Job the Location Job Title, Company or Skill City, State or Zip Code Advanced Search Sign in Research Asst I Melanoma Med Onco Rsch POSITION INFORMATION Location: Houston, TEXAS Company: Not Provided Job Code: ch-asst-i-melanoma-med-onco-rsc Posted On: 4/2/2016 DESCRIPTION Apply Now Research Asst I Melanoma Med Onco Rsch Job Location: Houston, TX The primary purpose of the Research Assistant I is to provide technical assistance and support for a translational research lab that focuses on generating antigen specific T-cells for Melanoma patients.  This person will plan and carry out various research projects as assigned and provide assistance to professional laboratory staff.  He/she will be responsible for conducting animal maintenance, inventory, breeding, anesthesia, euthanizing, genotyping (PCR and electrophoresis), and treatment administration (intravenous injection, intra peritoneal injection, gavage, et al).  This person will also help in imaging animals, harvesting tissue sample, and other experiments when necessary.      KEY FUNCTIONS      .      Perform experiments that will include basic molecular and biochemical bench-work, cell culturing of mammalian cancer cell-lines and tumor lines, and various assays including but not limited to radioactive killing assays.      .      Purchasing and stocking laboratory supplies, preparation of media and reagents, optimization of lab protocols, and maintenance of laboratory equipment. This requires the monitoring of workflow and planning as it pertains to the need for supplies, equipment maintenance and stock solutions.       .      Perform duties in accordance with instructed methods under the direction of the principal investigator or designee.  This position conducts close work with other technicians, students, post-doctoral fellows, visiting scientists and staff members in scientific protocols currently used. Good communication skills, patience and good working knowledge of equipment and research aims are a necessity.       .      Adhere to institutional and regulatory guidelines when handling, recording, and collecting data and samples on patients enrolled in our clinical studies.        .      Good reading and comprehension skills are a necessity in understanding scientific articles and journals related to experiments being conducted.  Attendance and participation at work related seminars and/or meetings are required.      .      Assist in training new lab members as you become familiar with general lab activities and the labs research aim.       .      Conduct animal maintenance, inventory, breeding, anesthesia, euthanizing, genotyping (PCR and electrophoresis), and treatment administration (intravenous injection, intra peritoneal injection, gavage, et al).  Help with animal imaging and harvesting tissue sample.      .      Perform all duties listed and other duties as assigned.     EDUCATION   Required: Bachelor's degree, major course work in one of the basic sciences.       EXPERIENCE   Required: No experience. Basic Qualifications: - Minimum of 6 years work experience with Data Architecture- Minimum of 6 years work experience with Java - Java Opensource- Minimum of 3 years work experience with HadoopSuitable candidate should have: - A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology.- At-least 4-7 years of IT architecture experience.- Hadoop Developer Certification on any leading distribution.- NoSQL/MongoDB Developer Certification.- Data Mining and Machine learning releated certification.- Cloud application development certification.- At least 4 years of traditional data experience.- At least 3 years of experience developing Advanced BI Architectures & Big Data Technology Roadmaps.- 3+ years of experience in software development/ engineering, including requirements analysis, software development, installation, integration, evaluation, enhancement, maintenance, testing, and problem diagnosis/resolution.- At least 4+ years of experience developing software with high level languages such as Java, C, C++ using Unix/Linux.- At least 2+ years of R, Python development experience.- 3+ Years of Enterprise Data Architecture expierence.Preferred skills: - Experience with Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) - Experience with serialization such as JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) and /or BinaryScript Object Notation (BSON)- Experience deploying applications in a cloud environment- Experience designing and developing automated analytic software, techniques, and algorithms, Sentiment Analysis and OpenNLP- Experience designing, developing and implementing online-machine learning libraries using R, Python, Java Map-reduce and Apache Mahout- Experience with taxonomy construction for analytic disciplines, knowledge areas and skills Required experience: Big Data Architect: 2 years 5 days ago - save job » Apply Now Please review all application instructions before applying to Conquest Consulting, LLC. title: Institute Assoc Scientist II Mouse Modeling
summary: Summary MD Anderson is known for providing cancer patients with exceptional care, which includes early access to innovative new treatments through clinical...
post_text: Institute Assoc Scientist II Mouse Modeling - job details by MedicalWorkers.com the Job the Location Job Title, Company or Skill City, State or Zip Code Advanced Search Sign in Institute Assoc Scientist II Mouse Modeling POSITION INFORMATION Location: Houston, TEXAS Company: MD Anderson Cancer Center Job Code: ssoc-scientist-ii-mouse-modelin Posted On: 4/5/2016 DESCRIPTION Apply Now Institute Assoc Scientist II Mouse Modeling Job Location: Houston, TX The Applied Cancer Science Mouse Modeling Team provides expertise in all areas of model generation from sophisticated design, molecular biology and cell culture to embryo manipulation. The Mouse Modeling Team adapts and optimizes state of the art technologies to accelerate the generation of multi-allele mouse cancer models. As part of MD Anderson, the Mouse Modeling Team collaborates with investigators from a broad range of departments and is well positioned to access the latest data identifying new therapeutic targets to quickly generate models of new targets in the correct mutational background.   Mission Statement   The mission of The University of Texas M. D. Anderson Cancer Center is to eliminate cancer in Texas, the nation, and the world through outstanding programs that integrate patient care, research and prevention, and through education for undergraduate and graduate students, trainees, professionals, employees and the public.   Summary   MD Anderson is known for providing cancer patients with exceptional care, which includes early access to innovative new treatments through clinical trials. The Institute for Applied Cancer Science (IACS) is a new hybrid model that uniquely combines the drug discovery capabilities of the biopharmaceutical industry and the extensive knowledge of biology found in academia with the expertise of MD Anderson's top clinicians. IACS has the singular goal of rapidly developing novel, effective and safe therapeutics that improve patient health. IACS executes programs with the highest probability of clinical success in a rigorous, goal-oriented, data-driven manner.   Scope    The Institute Associate Scientist II participates in cross-functional research to identify and validate novel oncology targets, and translate these finding into novel oncology therapeutic agents to benefit patients.   Position available for a motivated, enthusiastic and responsible individual to participate in a high-powered research program with a strong emphasis in utilizing genetically altered mice (transgenic/knockout). Individual will have a key role in a state of the art mouse modeling facility at the Institute for Applied Cancer Science UT-MD Anderson Cancer Center. Training will be provided in mouse colony management, animal husbandry, embryo isolation, in vitro culture, embryonic stem cell culture, microinjection and microsurgery. Advanced training and excellent educational opportunities are provided. Ideal for those interested in an academic career in science and medicine, or a long-term stable career in academia/biotechnology. Position offers opportunity for advancement.   Key Functions     Under moderate supervision, conducts laboratory experiments.   Under moderate supervision, perform mouse specific procedures necessary for transgenic/knockout/knock-in mouse generation.     Under moderate supervision, conducts molecular biology related genotype screening of transgenic mice.   Under moderate supervision, perform dissection and collects mouse tissue samples.   Under moderate supervision, performs all ordering of mouse related lab supplies and mice.   Under moderate supervision, performs all mouse related experimental scheduling.   Assists with non-invasive imaging and the utilization of in vivo models.   Employ safe lab practices.   Maintain research records and laboratory notes.   Participate in integrated drug discovery research teams.   source:sonj   soid    EDUCATION   Required: Bachelor's degree in Biology, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Cell  Biology, Enzymology, Pharmacology, Chemistry or related field     Preferred: Master's degree   EXPERIENCE  Required: Eighteen months of relevant research laboratory experience. With preferred degree, no required experience.     Preferred: Molecular Biology and exposure to mice handling   Working Conditions and Frequency Percentages Exposure to blood, bodily fluids, and/or tissue - Yes 34%-64%  Hazardous Chemicals and Materials - Yes 34%-64%  Exposure to Radiation - Yes 34%-64%    Physical Demands:        Standing - Frequent 34-66%  Walking - Occasionally 11-33%  Sitting - Frequent 34-66%  Reaching - Occasionally 11-33%  Pushing/Pulling - Occasionally 11-33%  Keyboarding - Frequent 34-66%   It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Job ID: 103680 CONTACT INFORMATION Contact: MD Anderson Cancer Center Company: MD Anderson Cancer Center Phone: Let them know where you found their job posting: MedicalWorkers.com Fax: Login to view Fax # Website: Click Here RELATED LINKS More jobs in Houston, Texas Browse Jobs Employers Advertisers About Contact Link To Us
